original: badzra ni thugs so //
analyzed: badzra ni thugs so //
translated: Vajra is mind.

original: ku tha ra ni gsung ste /
analyzed: ku tha ra ni gsung ste /
translated: Kuṭhāra is speech.

original: mtshan ma med par rtogs pas mtshan ma'i mi shes pa gcod par byed pas rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par rtogs pas mtshan ma'i mi shes pa gcod par byed pas rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Since it is realized as signless, it cuts the ignorance of signs, and so the three vajras are not different.

original: p'a ta ya p'a ta ya zhes pa lan gnyis ni /
analyzed: p'a ta ya p'a ta ya zhes pa lan gnyis ni /
translated: Pātaya pātaya twice

original: dbang po dang yul gyi dbye bas spro ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gyi dbye bas spro ba'o //
translated: is the emanation by the division of sense organ and object.

original: h'um h'um h'um ni dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um ni dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Hum hum hum is the maṇḍala of nine.

original: phat phat gnyis ni dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: phat phat gnyis ni dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Phaṭ phaṭ is indivisible.

original: sv'a h'a zhes pa ni ye shes lnga rnams so //
analyzed: sv'a h'a zhes pa ni ye shes lnga rnams so //
translated: Svāhā is the five gnoses.

original: bye ba bzlas pas ni rab tu gsal ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bye ba bzlas pas ni rab tu gsal ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Recite one hundred thousand times is the perfection of the culmination of clarity.

original: thig le ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thig le ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The drop is Vajradhara.

original: phyag byas pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyag byas pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: The homage is the actualization.

original: de nas 'di rdo rje 'dzin pa la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'di rdo rje 'dzin pa la 'dug pa'o //
translated: Then this is seated on Vajradhara.

original: a'a ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: a'a ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: Ā is Nairātmya.

original: ba ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: ba ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Va is Vajradhara.

original: gnyi ga dbyer mi phyed pa len cing 'dzin la der 'gro zhing rtogs pas 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer mi phyed pa len cing 'dzin la der 'gro zhing rtogs pas 'dud pa'o //
translated: Since both are inseparable, one bows to that which is taken up and held, which goes there, and which is realized.

original: de'i phyir gang 'dud pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'dud pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Therefore, he who bows is Vajradhara himself.

original: 'gas pa ni spro ba'i tshul du gyur pa yin pas lha dags pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'gas pa ni spro ba'i tshul du gyur pa yin pas lha dags pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Since to split is the mode of expansion, it is the rite of splitting the deity.

original: tsha bas gdung bar bya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: tsha bas gdung bar bya bar 'dod pas /
translated: If one wishes to torment with heat,

original: aarka'i lo ma la dug dang ske tshe dang / tsi tra ka'i khu bas dgra'i ming bri zhing 'bras phub kyi me la gdung ste /
analyzed: aarka'i lo ma la dug dang ske tshe dang / tsi tra ka'i khu bas dgra'i ming bri zhing 'bras phub kyi me la gdung ste /
translated: one should write the name of the enemy on a leaf of arka with poison, black mustard seed, and citraka juice, and heat it over a fire of chaff.

original: sngags khri bzla'o //
analyzed: sngags khri bzla'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra ten thousand times.

original: aom he badzra dzra ra sa bhr'um h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom he badzra dzra ra sa bhr'um h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hevajra jvara sabhram hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: 'bras phub kyi me bcug nas sngags khri bzlas so //
analyzed: 'bras phub kyi me bcug nas sngags khri bzlas so //
translated: Having put it in a fire of chaff, one should recite the mantra ten thousand times.

original: de nas tsha ba'i rims kyis 'debs so //
analyzed: de nas tsha ba'i rims kyis 'debs so //
translated: Then, one will be afflicted with a fever.

original: zhi ba'i don du de nas phung la 'o mas bkru'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i don du de nas phung la 'o mas bkru'o //
translated: For the purpose of pacifying, one should then wash it with milk.

original: yang na tsha bas gdung bar 'dod pas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na tsha bas gdung bar 'dod pas zhes pa ni /
translated: Again, if one wishes to torment with heat,

original: gtum mo'i rnal 'byor sbyar bar 'dod pas so //🔽aarka'i lo ma zhes pa la aarka ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: gtum mo'i rnal 'byor sbyar bar 'dod pas so // aarka'i lo ma zhes pa la aarka ni nyi ma'o //
translated: one who wishes to apply the yoga of caṇḍālī.🔽The leaf of arka is a piece of arka, that is, the sun.

original: de'i 'dab ma dum bu ste ka li'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dab ma dum bu ste ka li'o //
translated: It is a leaf, that is, a piece.

original: de la dug dang ske tshe ni dug ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: de la dug dang ske tshe ni dug ni zla ba'o //
translated: The poison is the moon,

original: de'i ske tshe ni a'a li'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ske tshe ni a'a li'i phreng ba'o //
translated: and its mustard is the garland of vowels.

original: gnyis ka tha ma dad pas na sna tshogs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka tha ma dad pas na sna tshogs so //
translated: Both are various because of the final a.

original: de yang ka ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ka ni bde ba'o //
translated: And ka is bliss.

original: de la khu ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //🔽des dgra'i ming ni //
analyzed: de la khu ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do // des dgra'i ming ni //
translated: The semen is the characteristic of experience.

original: dgra smos pas /🔽dgra dang 'drebs  na dgra ste /
analyzed: dgra smos pas / dgra dang 'drebs  na dgra ste /
translated: By that, the name of the enemy is mentioned.🔽 By mentioning the enemy,

original: nyon @29a * //
analyzed: nyon @29a * //
translated: the enemy is like a thief,

original: mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang yang dag pa'i rtog pa rnams te /
analyzed: mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang yang dag pa'i rtog pa rnams te /
translated: the afflictions and secondary afflictions, and the correct thoughts,

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: the objects, faculties, and consciousnesses.

original: bsdus pas gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: bsdus pas gcig gi tshig go //
translated: By collecting, it is the word one.

original: de'i ming ni ming ngo //
analyzed: de'i ming ni ming ngo //
translated: That name is the name.

original: bri ba ni nyams su myong ba nyid de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bri ba ni nyams su myong ba nyid de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Writing is the experience itself, the nature of the arrangement.

original: 'bras phub kyi me ni /
analyzed: 'bras phub kyi me ni /
translated: The fire of chaff

original: phub ma ni snying po med pa ste gsog go //
analyzed: phub ma ni snying po med pa ste gsog go //
translated: is chaff, which is without essence, a heap.

original: de yang me dang 'dra bas ni me ste bsreg pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir yang nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang me dang 'dra bas ni me ste bsreg pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir yang nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: And that is like fire, so it is fire. Because of the nature of burning, it is also experience.

original: der gzhug pa ni de'i bdag nyid du bya ba'o //
analyzed: der gzhug pa ni de'i bdag nyid du bya ba'o //
translated: To enter into that is to make it one’s own nature.

original: rim pa 'dis na sngags ni ye shes so //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis na sngags ni ye shes so //
translated: By this process, the mantra is gnosis.

original: khri ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: khri ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The ten thousand is nonduality.

original: bzlas pa ni bskyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa ni bskyed par bya ba'o //
translated: The repetition is the generation.

original: aom ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: aom ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Om is because of the nondifference of the three vajras.

original: he badzra ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / de ltar ye shes lnga dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: he badzra ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / de ltar ye shes lnga dang dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Hevajra is because of the nondifference of method and wisdom, and because of being inseparable from the five gnoses in that way.

original: dzva ra dzva ra ni rims 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: dzva ra dzva ra ni rims 'bar ba'o //
translated: Jvara jvara is blazing fever.

original: da ha da ha ni bsregs la gdungs shig pa ste rang bzhin med par gyis shig pa'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: da ha da ha ni bsregs la gdungs shig pa ste rang bzhin med par gyis shig pa'i tha tshig go ;
translated: Dhaha dhaha is burning up, which means “make it nonexistent.”

original: / gnyis kyi tshig ni phyi nang gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: / gnyis kyi tshig ni phyi nang gi dbye bas so //
translated: The two words are divided into outer and inner.

original: sha tr'um zhes pa ni bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sha tr'um zhes pa ni bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: Shatrum is just as taught.

original: bh'um gyi sbas ni sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bh'um gyi sbas ni sku rdo rje'o //
translated: The hidden meaning of bhum is the vajra body.

original: de yang h'um h'um h'um zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de yang h'um h'um h'um zhes pa ni /
translated: That is also hum hum hum.

original: rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The three vajras are the nature of the mandala of nine.

original: de yang phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, phat svāhā means that method and wisdom are not different.

original: khri bzlas pa ni /
analyzed: khri bzlas pa ni /
translated: The recitation of ten thousand is

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of the term “nondual wisdom.”

original: chang skyug par 'dod pas bsgrub bya'i lte bar yi ge ma bsgom mo //
analyzed: chang skyug par 'dod pas bsgrub bya'i lte bar yi ge ma bsgom mo //
translated: One who wishes to induce vomiting of beer should visualize the syllable ma at the navel of the victim.

original: yi ge mam gyur pa las char lto bar rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: yi ge mam gyur pa las char lto bar rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: The syllable ma becomes a beer mug, visualized in the stomach.

original: skyur par byed par bltas na chang skyug go //
analyzed: skyur par byed par bltas na chang skyug go //
translated: If one looks at it, causing it to be sour, the beer is vomited.

original: 'di'i don ni rab tu gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni rab tu gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is clear.

original: yang na chang skyug par bya bar 'dod pas zhes pa la /
analyzed: yang na chang skyug par bya bar 'dod pas zhes pa la /
translated: Alternatively, one who wishes to induce vomiting of beer

original: myos par byed pas na chang ste /
analyzed: myos par byed pas na chang ste /
translated: is one who is intoxicated by beer.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: It is connate joy.

original: de skyug par byed par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: de skyug par byed par 'dod pa ni /
translated: One who wishes to induce vomiting of that

original: spro ba'i tshul gyis bsdu ba'i bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: spro ba'i tshul gyis bsdu ba'i bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag par 'dod pas so //
translated: wishes to establish it in the nature of the means of gathering through the method of spreading it.

original: bsgrub bya ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The victim is the vajra holder.

original: lte ba ni bskyed pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: lte ba ni bskyed pa'i gnas so //
translated: The navel is the place of generation.

original: yi ge mam ni lnga pa'i lnga pa ma ste m'a ma k'i chu'i khams byang chub kyi sems khu ba'i rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: yi ge mam ni lnga pa'i lnga pa ma ste m'a ma k'i chu'i khams byang chub kyi sems khu ba'i rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The letter ma is the fifth of the fifth, ma, which is Mamaki, the water element, the bodhicitta in the form of semen.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on it, and establish it by the yoga of union.

original: yi ge mam yongs su gyur pa ni /
analyzed: yi ge mam yongs su gyur pa ni /
translated: The transformation of the letter ma

original: byang chub kyi sems nang du thim pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nang du thim pa'o //
translated: is the dissolution of the bodhicitta within.

original: chang lto bar ni ye shes kyi gnas de'i @29b bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chang lto bar ni ye shes kyi gnas de'i @29b bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: The beer in the belly is the abode of gnosis, by its very nature.

original: bltas na zhes pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: bltas na zhes pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: Looking is the actualization.

original: rnam par bsgom pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bsgom pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Meditating is the union by the method of the various aspects.

original: skyug par byed par bltas na skyug go zhes pa la /
analyzed: skyug par byed par bltas na skyug go zhes pa la /
translated: Looking at the vomiting, one vomits.

original: ba ni lnga pa'i gsum pa la /
analyzed: ba ni lnga pa'i gsum pa la /
translated: The letter ba is the third of the fifth,

original: aa bdag med mas mtshan pa dga' bral te /
analyzed: aa bdag med mas mtshan pa dga' bral te /
translated: marked with the letter a, which is Nairatmya, the separation of joy.

original: de yang zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That is also the realization by the characteristic of attachment.

original: de mthar byed pas ta ste de yang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de mthar byed pas ta ste de yang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i tshul lo //
translated: The letter ta is the termination of that, and that is the method of the innate joy.

original: de ltar yongs su rdzogs par blta ba ni skyug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su rdzogs par blta ba ni skyug par byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, the complete view is the vomiting,

original: ye shes kyi spyan mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi spyan mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: the manifestation of the eye of wisdom.

original: chang skyug pa ni chang ni lhan cig skyes pa bsdus pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: chang skyug pa ni chang ni lhan cig skyes pa bsdus pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The vomiting of beer is the method of the inclusion of the innate,

original: skyug pa ni spro ba'i tshul 'byung bar 'gyur pas rdo rje 'dzin pa rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skyug pa ni spro ba'i tshul 'byung bar 'gyur pas rdo rje 'dzin pa rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: and the vomiting is the method of the emission, which is the perfection of the vajra-holder.

original: rab tu myos pa dbang du bya bar 'dod pas mya ngan med pa'i brgyad la mya ngan med pa'i 'og tu sor ste gos dmar po bgos nas /
analyzed: rab tu myos pa dbang du bya bar 'dod pas mya ngan med pa'i brgyad la mya ngan med pa'i 'og tu sor ste gos dmar po bgos nas /
translated: One who wishes to bring under one’s control a woman who is in love should, on the eighth day of the month, wear red garments,

original: myos byed kyi 'bras bu bza' zhing ka ma tsi ka'i khu bas thig le byas nas sngags bzlas te /
analyzed: myos byed kyi 'bras bu bza' zhing ka ma tsi ka'i khu bas thig le byas nas sngags bzlas te /
translated: eat the fruit of the madana plant, make a bindu with the juice of the madana plant, and recite the mantra.

original: aom aa mu k'i me hr'i ba s'i bha ba tu sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aa mu k'i me hr'i ba s'i bha ba tu sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, so-and-so’s mind is under my control.

original: khris 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sngags 'di khri bzlas na de 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khris 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sngags 'di khri bzlas na de 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one recites this mantra ten thousand times, she will come.

original: 'di'i don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of this is easy to understand.

original: yang na rab tu myos pa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang na rab tu myos pa bdag med ma'o //
translated: Alternatively, the woman who is in love is Nairātmya.

original: dbang du bya bar 'dod pa ni rang dgar bya bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: dbang du bya bar 'dod pa ni rang dgar bya bar 'dod pas so //
translated: One who wishes to bring under one's control wishes to make them one's own.

original: mya ngan med pa'i brgyad ni /
analyzed: mya ngan med pa'i brgyad ni /
translated: The eight aśoka trees

original: aa ni bdag med pas /
analyzed: aa ni bdag med pas /
translated: are a, the non-self.

original: de dag phye ma zhib mor klog pas na aa sa'o //
analyzed: de dag phye ma zhib mor klog pas na aa sa'o //
translated: Since they are read as fine powder, they are aśa.

original: des na aa sa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: des na aa sa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, aśa is the vajra-holder.

original: de yang aa ka ni aa bdag med ma las ka rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang aa ka ni aa bdag med ma las ka rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, a is a, the non-self, and ka is the vajra-holder.

original: bdag med mas 'khril ba'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med mas 'khril ba'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The vajra-holder is embraced by the non-self.

original: brgyad ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad do //
analyzed: brgyad ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad do //
translated: The eight are the eight yoginīs.

original: mya ngan med pa yang yin la brgyad kyang yin pas mya ngan med pa'i brgyad do //
analyzed: mya ngan med pa yang yin la brgyad kyang yin pas mya ngan med pa'i brgyad do //
translated: Since they are aśoka and eight, they are the eight aśoka trees.

original: de dag ni dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: They are the maṇḍala of the nature of nine.

original: mya ngan med pa'i 'og tu song ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mya ngan med pa'i 'og tu song ste zhes pa ni /
translated: Having gone under the aśoka tree

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma 'khyud pas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma 'khyud pas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: means that since the vajra-holder and the non-self embrace, one should understand the nature of the vajra-holder.🔽Having put on red garments

original: gos dmar po bgos nas ni dmar po ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gos dmar po bgos nas ni dmar po ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: means that red is the characteristic of passion.

original: de nyid gos te sgrib par byed pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de nyid gos te sgrib par byed pa'i tshul lo //
translated: That is the garment, the mode of obscuration.

original: de bgos nas ni de la zhugs nas so //
analyzed: de bgos nas ni de la zhugs nas so //
translated: Having put it on, having entered into it,

original: myos byed kyi 'bras bu ni myos byed byang chub kyi sems khu ba'o /
analyzed: myos byed kyi 'bras bu ni myos byed byang chub kyi sems khu ba'o /
translated: the fruit of the intoxicant is the intoxicant, the bodhicitta, the semen.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its fruit is the innate nature.

original: de bza' ba ni khams gsum @30a * //
analyzed: de bza' ba ni khams gsum @30a * //
translated: Eating that, the three realms

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis gang 'khril ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis gang 'khril ba'o //
translated: are embraced by the nature of that.

original: k'a a'a k'a ni /
analyzed: k'a a'a k'a ni /
translated: kā ākani

original: a'a li k'a l'i'i n'a da'i phreng ba gnyid de dang tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: a'a li k'a l'i'i n'a da'i phreng ba gnyid de dang tha mi dad pas so //
translated: The garland of the sounds of ālikāli is non-different from that sleep.

original: ma ni m'a ma k'i te chu'i khams khu ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma ni m'a ma k'i te chu'i khams khu ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Ma is māmakī, the water element, the meaning of semen.

original: yang na aa bdag med pas lhan cig skyes pa gsum de'i bdag nyid kyis brgyan pa yin pas k'a ma'o //
analyzed: yang na aa bdag med pas lhan cig skyes pa gsum de'i bdag nyid kyis brgyan pa yin pas k'a ma'o //
translated: Or, since a is non-self, the three innate [joys] are adorned by the nature of that, and so it is kāma.

original: de bsags pa ni bsags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi bden par rnam par gzhag pa yin pas dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de bsags pa ni bsags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi bden par rnam par gzhag pa yin pas dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: The accumulation of that is the relative truth, which is defined by the characteristic of accumulation, and so it is Hevajra.

original: de'i khu ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i khu ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its semen is the characteristic of experience.

original: thig le des rdo rje 'dzin la phyag bya mngon par btud pas spro ba'o //
analyzed: thig le des rdo rje 'dzin la phyag bya mngon par btud pas spro ba'o //
translated: The drop is the homage to Vajradhara, the bowing.

original: sngags ni ye shes so ;
analyzed: sngags ni ye shes so ;
translated: The mantra is the wisdom.

original: / bzlas pa ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: / bzlas pa ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: The repetition is the generation.

original: de yang aom aa mu k'i me h'ri ba s'i bha ba tu sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de yang aom aa mu k'i me h'ri ba s'i bha ba tu sv'a h'a /
translated: And that is: Oṃ, O so-and-so, come here! svāhā.

original: aom zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //🔽aa mu ki zhes pa ni /
analyzed: aom zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o // aa mu ki zhes pa ni /
translated: Oṃ is the indivisible three vajras, Vajradhara.

original: ming med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: ming med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
translated: So-and-so is the nameless Nairātmya.

original: ma byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: ma byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Ma is the bodhicitta.

original: ae ni ae'i cha byad kyi phyag rgya bdag med ma rnal 'byor mdes brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: ae ni ae'i cha byad kyi phyag rgya bdag med ma rnal 'byor mdes brgyan pa'o //
translated: E is the seal of the e-shaped Nairātmya Yoginī, adorned with the hūṃ.

original: de yang hr'i ni bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang hr'i ni bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: And that is the nature of the four hās.

original: ba s'i bha ba tu zhes pa ni 'di'i ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba s'i bha ba tu zhes pa ni 'di'i ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Come here is the descent of that.

original: de yang sv'a ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang sv'a ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: And that is svā, the three vajras.

original: h'a ni thabs dang shes rab po //
analyzed: h'a ni thabs dang shes rab po //
translated: Hā is method and wisdom.

original: 'di ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the wisdom that is the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: 'di yang khris 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'di yang khris 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la /
translated: And that is the coming of the three.

original: khri ni rnal 'byor gnyis tha mi dad pa'i don dam pa dang kun rdzob dag dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: khri ni rnal 'byor gnyis tha mi dad pa'i don dam pa dang kun rdzob dag dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The throne is the ultimate reality and the relative reality, which are inseparable, of the two yogas.

original: de yang bdag med ma gzugs mi mnga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang bdag med ma gzugs mi mnga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: And that is Nairātmya, whose nature is formless.

original: des 'ong bar 'gyur ba ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: des 'ong bar 'gyur ba ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: One should come to that, which is to say, one should realize it.

original: yang dag par khong du chud pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par khong du chud pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should become of the nature of perfect understanding.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dbang du bya bar 'dod pas s'a lu btags pa can gyi 'gyur ba la zla ba dang nyid ma byas nas rdo rje'i chu ru gzhug cing sngags bzla te /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dbang du bya bar 'dod pas s'a lu btags pa can gyi 'gyur ba la zla ba dang nyid ma byas nas rdo rje'i chu ru gzhug cing sngags bzla te /
translated: One who wishes to bring the moon and sun under one’s control should make a paste of śāli rice, fashion it into the forms of the moon and sun, place it in a vajra vessel, and recite the mantra.

original: aom badzra rka m'a ca la m'a tsa la /
analyzed: aom badzra rka m'a ca la m'a tsa la /
translated: Oṃ vajra rakṣa māca la māca la

original: tishtha / he badzra ya h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: tishtha / he badzra ya h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: tiṣṭha he vajra ya hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: bye ba phrag bdun bzlas te nyi ma dang zla ba yang dag par gnas shing nyin mtshan bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye ba phrag bdun bzlas te nyi ma dang zla ba yang dag par gnas shing nyin mtshan bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having recited it ten million times, the moon and sun will remain in place, and day and night will cease to exist.

original: zla ba dang nyid ma rnam par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyid ma rnam par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual called “Seizing the Moon and Sun.”

original: 'di'i don ni go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni go sla ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is easy to understand.

original: yang na zla ba dang dbang du bya bar 'dod pas zhes pa la /
analyzed: yang na zla ba dang dbang du bya bar 'dod pas zhes pa la /
translated: Or else, “one who wishes to bring the moon and the sun under one’s power”

original: zla ba rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: means that the moon is Vajradhara,

original: nyi ma bdag med ma'o //🔽gnyi ga dbang du bya bar 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: nyi ma bdag med ma'o // gnyi ga dbang du bya bar 'dod pa ni /
translated: and the sun is Nairātmya.🔽“One who wishes to bring both under one’s power”

original: gnyi ga dbyer @30b med pa'i rnam par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer @30b med pa'i rnam par 'dod pas so //
translated: means one who wishes to bring both of them into a state of inseparability.

original: s'a lu btags pa can gyi 'gyur ba la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: s'a lu btags pa can gyi 'gyur ba la zhes pa ni /
translated: “The transformation of the rice cake”

original: s'a lu'i sgras don yod pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sgras don yod pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: means that the word “rice” refers to Amoghasiddhi.

original: de yang a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng ba gnyis so //
translated: That is also the two garlands of the nādas of ālikāli.

original: de'i btags pa ni bcar ba ste phan tshun du dbyer med pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i btags pa ni bcar ba ste phan tshun du dbyer med pas gnas pa'o //
translated: The “cake” is the union of those two, which is the state of their mutual inseparability.

original: de la ka ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de la ka ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The “ka” is the bodhicitta.

original: 'gyur ba ni nyi zla'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni nyi zla'o //
translated: The “transformation” is the sun and moon.

original: bya ba ni skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni skyes pa'o //
translated: The “action” is the male.

original: rdo rje'i chu ni dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i chu ni dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The “vajra water” is the bodhicitta of union.

original: gzhug pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhug pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: “Insertion” is the establishment of that nature.

original: sngags bzla pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: sngags bzla pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: “Reciting the mantra” is the stopping.

original: de yang aom ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang aom ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, “oṃ” is the three vajras.

original: badzra ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: badzra ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Vajra means the holder of the vajra.

original: aarka ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aarka ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: Arka means Nairatmya.

original: gnyis tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The two are non-dual.

original: m'a ca la m'a tsa la ni spro ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: m'a ca la m'a tsa la ni spro ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Maca-lamaca means the mode of emanation.

original: tishtha tishtha ni bsdu ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: tishtha tishtha ni bsdu ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Tishtha-tishtha means the nature of gathering.

original: de yang he badzr'a ya zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang he badzr'a ya zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i ye shes so //
translated: Moreover, hevajra means the wisdom of Hevajra.

original: h'um h'um h'um ni dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um ni dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Hum hum hum means the mandala of nine natures.

original: phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ni /
translated: Phat svaha means

original: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the wisdom of the inseparability of method and wisdom.

original: bye ba bzlas pa ni drug pa sems las 'das pa bdun pa 'di nyid phye ba ste rab tu gsal bar rdzogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: bye ba bzlas pa ni drug pa sems las 'das pa bdun pa 'di nyid phye ba ste rab tu gsal bar rdzogs pa'i don to //
translated: The recitation of ten million is the seventh, the transcendence of mind, which is the division of this very [mantra]. It is very clear and has the meaning of perfection.

original: sngags 'dis gnyis dang gnyis med par rtogs pa yang gnyis su med pa yin no //
analyzed: sngags 'dis gnyis dang gnyis med par rtogs pa yang gnyis su med pa yin no //
translated: The realization of duality and non-duality by this mantra is also non-dual.

original: gnas shing zhes pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: gnas shing zhes pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Abiding means the mode of non-movement.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba dag ni thabs dang shes rab dag go //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba dag ni thabs dang shes rab dag go //
translated: The sun and moon are method and wisdom.

original: nyin mtshan bye brag med par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nyin mtshan bye brag med par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: Day and night are not distinguished.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med pa ma dag bye brag med pa'i rang bzhin nyid du rang las 'byung ba ste thams cad nyid du dus gsum la khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med pa ma dag bye brag med pa'i rang bzhin nyid du rang las 'byung ba ste thams cad nyid du dus gsum la khyab pa yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the impure Vajra Holder and Nairātmya, arising from oneself, all of it pervading the three times.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma rnam par 'dzin pa zhes pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma rnam par 'dzin pa zhes pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The procedure of holding the moon and sun.

original: zhes pa ni ye shes 'di shes par 'gyur ba de'i phyir zla ba dang nyi ma dag gis rnam par 'dzin pa mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes 'di shes par 'gyur ba de'i phyir zla ba dang nyi ma dag gis rnam par 'dzin pa mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since this gnosis is known, therefore the moon and sun are held unmoving.

original: de'i cho ga ni rdzogs pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i cho ga ni rdzogs pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The procedure of that is complete, is the meaning.

original: aom n'a gr'a n'a gr'a zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis dus ma yin pa'i dus su don bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: aom n'a gr'a n'a gr'a zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis dus ma yin pa'i dus su don bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: With the mantra Oṃ nāgārā nāgārā, for the sake of accomplishing the purpose at an improper time,

original: gzhon nu ma'i mig dag la brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i mig dag la brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags nas /
translated: having enchanted the eyes of a young woman one hundred and eight times,

original: me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa lngas yang dag par mchod cing snyan gsan dbab pa'o //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa lngas yang dag par mchod cing snyan gsan dbab pa'o //
translated: having made offerings with the five offerings such as flowers, one should summon.

original: bcu bzhi'am brgyad pa'i snga ba'i dus su bum pa la sogs pa gzhag cing 'bru mar dang sen rtsi'i khu ba la sngags 'di nyid kyis lan brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags @31a * //
analyzed: bcu bzhi'am brgyad pa'i snga ba'i dus su bum pa la sogs pa gzhag cing 'bru mar dang sen rtsi'i khu ba la sngags 'di nyid kyis lan brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags @31a * //
translated: At the time of the fourteenth or eighth day, one should place the vase, etc., and with the mantra, one should enchant the sesame oil and lac juice one hundred and eight times.

original: so ; / de nas mngon par bsngags pa'i sen rtsa'i khu bas bsngags pa'i pa the bo rgan po bskus nas /
analyzed: so ; / de nas mngon par bsngags pa'i sen rtsa'i khu bas bsngags pa'i pa the bo rgan po bskus nas /
translated: Then, with the enchanted lac juice, one should anoint the old thumb of the enchanted palm leaf,

original: 'bru mar gyis kyang blugs la gzhon nu ma la bstan te nga'i rdzas sus khyer smros //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyis kyang blugs la gzhon nu ma la bstan te nga'i rdzas sus khyer smros //
translated: and also fill it with sesame oil, and show it to the young woman, saying, “Tell me who took my property!”

original: de la des smras pa /
analyzed: de la des smras pa /
translated: Then she will say,

original: che ge mo zhes pas khyer ro //
analyzed: che ge mo zhes pas khyer ro //
translated: “So-and-so took it.”

original: rdo rje'i rtsis so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rtsis so //
translated: It is the vajra-nail.

original: sngags 'di rdo rje 'ba' zhig yin pas gsal ba nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: sngags 'di rdo rje 'ba' zhig yin pas gsal ba nyid kyi don to //
translated: This mantra is the vajra alone, and the meaning is clear.

original: yang na aom rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na aom rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Or else, Oṃ is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de yang n'a gr'a n'a gr'a zhes pa ni yi ge bzhis skad cig ma bzhi dang / gzhan dga' ba bzhi yin pas bzhi'o zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis zhes pa ni ye shes 'dis so //
analyzed: de yang n'a gr'a n'a gr'a zhes pa ni yi ge bzhis skad cig ma bzhi dang / gzhan dga' ba bzhi yin pas bzhi'o zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis zhes pa ni ye shes 'dis so //
translated: And nāgārā nāgārā is the four moments with four syllables, and the other four joys, so it is the four. With this mantra, this knowledge,

original: dus ma yin pa'i dus su ni dus dang bral ba'i dus gsum mo //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i dus su ni dus dang bral ba'i dus gsum mo //
translated: The time that is not a time is the time that is free from the three times.

original: bde ba'i dus dang sdug bsngal gyi dus dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus so //
analyzed: bde ba'i dus dang sdug bsngal gyi dus dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of pleasure, the time of pain, and the inconceivable time.

original: 'di gsum dang bral bas gang de dus ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di gsum dang bral bas gang de dus ma yin pa ste /
translated: The time that is free from these three is the time that is not a time.

original: 'di lta bu'i dus su'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i dus su'o //
translated: It is at such a time.

original: brgya rtsa brgyad ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad de //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad de //
translated: The one hundred and eight are the eight yoginis.

original: 'di rnams las bla ma 'am mchog ni bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams las bla ma 'am mchog ni bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: The supreme one among them is Vajradhara, who is not different from Nairatmya.

original: de yang rigs brgya'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid kyis rnam pa brgya yin pas brgya'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rigs brgya'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid kyis rnam pa brgya yin pas brgya'i bdag nyid do //
translated: He is the one hundred, because he is one hundred in number, due to the difference of the one hundred families.

original: rgyu des na gzhon ma ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na gzhon ma ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: For that reason, the young girl is Nairatmya.

original: mig dag ni bden pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mig dag ni bden pa gnyis so //
translated: The eyes are the two truths.

original: mngon par bsngags ni phan tshun du khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsngags ni phan tshun du khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul du byas pa'o //
translated: The consecration is the mutual pervasion, in the manner of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: bcu bzhi ni /
analyzed: bcu bzhi ni /
translated: The fourteen are

original: rnal 'byor ma bcu bzhi rnams la bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma bcu bzhi rnams la bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: the mandala of Nairatmya, which is the fourteen yoginis.

original: brgyad pa ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad la rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad la rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The eighth is the mandala of Vajradhara in the eight yoginis.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of the nature of both.

original: snga ba ni 'od gsal nyid do //
analyzed: snga ba ni 'od gsal nyid do //
translated: The former is just clear light.

original: de la bum pa la sogs pa ni bum pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / bdag med gnyis tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de la bum pa la sogs pa ni bum pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / bdag med gnyis tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Therein, the vase, etc., is the vase-vajradhara, the non-duality of the two selflessnesses.

original: sogs ni dang po'o //
analyzed: sogs ni dang po'o //
translated: The “etc.” is the first.

original: de yang kam ni ye shes kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de yang kam ni ye shes kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Moreover, “kam” is the aspect of intuition.

original: de gzhag pa ni brtag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gzhag pa ni brtag par bya ba'o //
translated: “Placing” that is to be imagined.

original: de gzhon nu ma ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: de gzhon nu ma ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: “The maiden” is Nairatmya.

original: me tog la sogs pa zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs dbyer med par gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs dbyer med par gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: “Flowers, etc.” is to be placed as the indivisibility of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'bru mar la lan brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags so zhes pa ni 'bru mar byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: 'bru mar la lan brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bsngags so zhes pa ni 'bru mar byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: “One should enchant the oil one hundred and eight times” means that the oil is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de yang brgya rtsa brgyad ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang brgya rtsa brgyad ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the “one hundred and eight” is the vajradhara.

original: des mngon par ni ye shes kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: des mngon par ni ye shes kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “By that” is the imagination of the aspect of intuition.

original: aa lakta ni /
analyzed: aa lakta ni /
translated: The “alaka”

original: phyi nas aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: phyi nas aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: is the “a” of the external Nairatmya.

original: lakta ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: lakta ni chags pa'o //
translated: Laktā is passion.

original: 'di gnyis ka yang lhan @31b cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka yang lhan @31b cig skyes pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Both of these are innate wisdom.

original: 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsngags pa yang de'i gzhon nu ma bdag med ma la'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis mngon par bsngags pa yang de'i gzhon nu ma bdag med ma la'o //
translated: By these two, the consecration is in that maiden Nairātmya.

original: brgya rtsa brgyad kyis mig dag la mngon par bsngags so //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad kyis mig dag la mngon par bsngags so //
translated: With one hundred and eight, the eyes are consecrated.

original: sngags pa'i mthe bo rgan po zhes pa ni sngags pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sngags pa'i mthe bo rgan po zhes pa ni sngags pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The old thumb of the reciter is the reciter Vajradhara.

original: mthe bo rgan po ni sor mo lnga'i rgan po yin pa'i phyir gzhi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mthe bo rgan po ni sor mo lnga'i rgan po yin pa'i phyir gzhi mthun pa'o //
translated: The old thumb is the common locus because it is the oldest of the five fingers.

original: des na aa lakta'i khu ba ni /
analyzed: des na aa lakta'i khu ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the juice of alaktaka

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: is with the wisdom of Vajradhara and Nairātmya inseparable.

original: de nyid 'bru mar gyis blugs la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid 'bru mar gyis blugs la zhes pa ni /
translated: That itself is filled with oil

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: and should be consecrated with bodhicitta.🔽The maiden is shown

original: gzhon nu ma la bstan te zhes pa ni rab tu gsal ba'i mtshan nyid mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma la bstan te zhes pa ni rab tu gsal ba'i mtshan nyid mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: and the characteristic of clear manifestation is made manifest.

original: nga'i rdzas sus khyer smros zhes pa la sus ni ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: nga'i rdzas sus khyer smros zhes pa la sus ni ye shes kyis so //
translated: “Tell me who took my substance” is with wisdom.

original: nga'i rdzas ni bdag nyid kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: nga'i rdzas ni bdag nyid kyi dngos po'o //
translated: My substance is the nature of the self.

original: khyer zhes pa ni yang dag pa spangs pa'o //🔽smros zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khyer zhes pa ni yang dag pa spangs pa'o // smros zhes pa ni /
translated: Take is the correct abandonment.

original: lnga pa'i gsum pa'i yi ge ba ste /
analyzed: lnga pa'i gsum pa'i yi ge ba ste /
translated: Speak is the third letter of the fifth [bha].

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is Amitābha.

original: bzhi pa'i gsum pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i gsum pa ni /
translated: The third of the fourth [ma]

original: rin chen 'byung ldan ste gnyi ga dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan ste gnyi ga dbyer med pa'o //
translated: is Ratnasaṃbhava. Both are inseparable.

original: khyer ba ni yang dag par bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: khyer ba ni yang dag par bsdus pa ste /
translated: Taking is the correct gathering.

original: de ni bdag med ma mtshan ma med pa'i tshul can don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul smras pa ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag med ma mtshan ma med pa'i tshul can don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul smras pa ste /
translated: That is, Nairātmyā, who is endowed with the method of signlessness, speaks the method of ultimate truth.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa mngon par gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa mngon par gsal ba nyid do //
translated: It is the clear light of the manifest conventional truth.

original: che ge mos khyer zhes pa ni /
analyzed: che ge mos khyer zhes pa ni /
translated: The one called take

original: ming med par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: ming med par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: is included in the nameless.

original: rdo rje'i dpyad do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dpyad do zhes pa ni /
translated: The analysis of the vajra is

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje mi phyed pa'o //
translated: the vajra, which is indivisible.

original: de'i dpyad ni 'od gsal yi ge aas rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dpyad ni 'od gsal yi ge aas rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: Its analysis is the clear light sealed with the syllable a.

original: 'od gsal bstan nas sgrib pa lnga spang bar bya ba'i phyir sngags lnga gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'od gsal bstan nas sgrib pa lnga spang bar bya ba'i phyir sngags lnga gsungs pa /
translated: Having taught the clear light, in order to abandon the five obscurations, he taught the five mantras.

original: bee d'urya bee d'urya zhes brjod na glang po che 'bros par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bee d'urya bee d'urya zhes brjod na glang po che 'bros par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one says vaidūrya, the elephant flees.

original: zhes pa ya'i sgras g-yung mo'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ya'i sgras g-yung mo'o //
translated: The syllable yā is the Yoginī.

original: de yang rdo rje sems mas brgyan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje sems mas brgyan pa nyid do //
translated: She is adorned with Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar gnyis med pa'i bden pa gnyis drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //🔽'di'i rang bzhin gyi glang po che de 'bros pa ni dbang po dang yul tha dad pas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis med pa'i bden pa gnyis drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo // 'di'i rang bzhin gyi glang po che de 'bros pa ni dbang po dang yul tha dad pas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the nondual two truths are Vajradhara the Sixth.

original: gti mug rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The elephant of his nature flees, and he turns away from the afflictions by means of the difference between the sense organs and the objects.

original: 'di'i don ni gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gsal ba nyid do //
translated: This means clarity.

original: yang na bee d'urya'i sgras lnga pa'i gsum pa yi ge ba 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bee d'urya'i sgras lnga pa'i gsum pa yi ge ba 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the word vaidūrya is the third of the fifth [n], the syllable ba, which is Amitābha.

original: de yang aes brgyan pas bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang aes brgyan pas bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Since that is adorned with ai, it is not different from Nairātmya.

original: d'a'i sgras ni gsum pa'i gsum pa ste mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: d'a'i sgras ni gsum pa'i gsum pa ste mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The word dā is the third of the third [i], which is Akṣobhya.

original: de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa'o //
translated: That is adorned with the Vajraḍākinī.

original: @32a * // y'a zhes pa ni /
analyzed: @32a * // y'a zhes pa ni /
translated: The word yā is the first of the first [k], which is Vajrasattva.

original: ma mm'a ma mm'a zhes brjod na stag 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa la /
analyzed: ma mm'a ma mm'a zhes brjod na stag 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa la /
translated: If one says mama mama mama mama, the tiger flees.

original: ma'i sgra ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: ma'i sgra ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: The word ma is Akshobhya,

original: de yang rdo rje gsum dang tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje gsum dang tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: and he is not different from the three vajras.

original: mm'a ni don yod grub pa rlung gi khams gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: mm'a ni don yod grub pa rlung gi khams gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Mama is Amoghasiddhi, the wind element, and vajra speech.

original: mi ni mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: mi ni mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: Mi is Akshobhya, vajra mind.

original: aa rdo rje ni gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje ste /
analyzed: aa rdo rje ni gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje ste /
translated: A vajra is the form aggregate, Vairochana, and vajra body.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang mm'a'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang mm'a'o //
translated: Vajra holder is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de yang lan gnyis brjod pas drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o /
analyzed: de yang lan gnyis brjod pas drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o /
translated: Also, by repeating it twice, it is the sixth, Vajra Holder.

original: stag 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa la stag dang 'dra bas stag ste gsod cing sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir gti mug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stag 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa la stag dang 'dra bas stag ste gsod cing sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir gti mug la sogs pa'o //
translated: The tiger flees. The tiger is like a tiger, so it is a tiger. Because it kills and produces suffering, it is delusion and so forth.

original: de de nyid du thim pas nga rgyal rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de de nyid du thim pas nga rgyal rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: By its dissolving into that, pride is purified.

original: te lli y'a te lli y'a zhes brjod na bse 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa la don gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: te lli y'a te lli y'a zhes brjod na bse 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa la don gsal ba nyid do //
translated: If one says telliya telliya, the rhinoceros flees. The meaning is clear.🔽

original: ta'i sgras ni bzhi pa'i dang po don yod grub pa n'a da mtha' dag gcig tu bsdoms pa de yang yi ge aes brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: ta'i sgras ni bzhi pa'i dang po don yod grub pa n'a da mtha' dag gcig tu bsdoms pa de yang yi ge aes brgyan pa ste //
translated: The syllable ta is the first of the fourth, Amoghasiddhi, the final na, all combined into one, and that is also adorned with the syllable e.

original: thugs kyi rnam par dag pa'o //🔽lli zhes pa ni //
analyzed: thugs kyi rnam par dag pa'o // lli zhes pa ni //
translated: It is the purity of mind.🔽The word li is

original: la ni sa'o //
analyzed: la ni sa'o //
translated: la, which is earth,

original: de yang rnam par snang mdzad dang tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam par snang mdzad dang tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: and that is also non-different from Vairocana.

original: yi ge la gnyis dang yang dag par ldan pa de yang yi ge ai dang bcas pa tshor ba'i phung po goo r'is brgyan pa ste gti mug la gti mug thim pa'i phyir sku rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge la gnyis dang yang dag par ldan pa de yang yi ge ai dang bcas pa tshor ba'i phung po goo r'is brgyan pa ste gti mug la gti mug thim pa'i phyir sku rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That which is endowed with the two syllables la and i, and also endowed with the syllable i, is the aggregate of feeling, adorned by Gaurī, because delusion dissolves into delusion, the purity of body.

original: y'a'i sgras gang rlung g-yung mo gsung rdo rje aa bdag med ma des brgyan pa thugs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: y'a'i sgras gang rlung g-yung mo gsung rdo rje aa bdag med ma des brgyan pa thugs rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The syllable ya is the wind, the speech vajra, and that is adorned by A, Nairātmya, blessed by mind vajra.

original: aa rdo rje ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin sku rdo rje'i bdag nyid yin te rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gsung rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: aa rdo rje ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin sku rdo rje'i bdag nyid yin te rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gsung rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The syllable a is the nature of the aggregate of form, the nature of the vajra of body, the purity of speech, the nature of the three vajras.

original: de'i de nyid la rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes de'i rang bzhin te ll'i y'a zhes lan gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: de'i de nyid la rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes de'i rang bzhin te ll'i y'a zhes lan gnyis brjod do //
translated: In its reality, there is the knowledge having the nature of the three vajras, and its nature is the two repetitions of lali.

original: 'di ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pas bse 'bros pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pas bse 'bros pa yin te /
translated: This is the flight of the rhinoceros, because of the non-difference of the three vajras.

original: 'di yang sdug bsngal bskyed nas gsod pa'i phyir nga rgyal la sogs pa rnam par dag pas gti mug rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang sdug bsngal bskyed nas gsod pa'i phyir nga rgyal la sogs pa rnam par dag pas gti mug rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is also the purification of delusion by the purification of pride, etc., because it kills, having generated suffering.

original: a'i li m'i li phu phu zhes brjod na sbrul 'bros par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'i li m'i li phu phu zhes brjod na sbrul 'bros par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one utters ali mili phuli phuli, the snake flees.

original: 'di'i don ni gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is clear.

original: a'i li m'i li zhes bya ba la /🔽a'i'i sgras goo r'i tshor ba'i phung po me'i khams so //🔽li'i sgras ni me'i khams dang 'dres pa'i sa'i khams so //
analyzed: a'i li m'i li zhes bya ba la / a'i'i sgras goo r'i tshor ba'i phung po me'i khams so // li'i sgras ni me'i khams dang 'dres pa'i sa'i khams so //
translated: In ali mili,🔽the sound ali is the fire element of the aggregate of feeling of Gaurī.🔽The sound li is the earth element mixed with the fire element.

original: m'i zhes pa ni me'i khams dang lhan cig pa'i rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: m'i zhes pa ni me'i khams dang lhan cig pa'i rlung gi khams so //
translated: The sound mi is the wind element together with the fire element.

original: li zhes pa ni thabs @32b dang shes rab tha mi dad pa me'i khams la sogs pa'i khams gsum re re'ang rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin rdo rje gsum dang tha mi dad pa dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: li zhes pa ni thabs @32b dang shes rab tha mi dad pa me'i khams la sogs pa'i khams gsum re re'ang rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin rdo rje gsum dang tha mi dad pa dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Li is the maṇḍala that is the nature of the nine indivisible three vajras, the three realms, the fire element, and so on, which are not different from method and wisdom.

original: de'i sngags phu phu zhes pa ni lnga pa'i gnyis pa rin chen 'byung ldan de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid slar lan gnyis brjod pas bzhi pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dga' ba bzhi po des so //🔽sprul 'bros so zhes pa ni dug gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sprul dang 'dra bas na sprul te /
analyzed: de'i sngags phu phu zhes pa ni lnga pa'i gnyis pa rin chen 'byung ldan de yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid slar lan gnyis brjod pas bzhi pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dga' ba bzhi po des so // sprul 'bros so zhes pa ni dug gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sprul dang 'dra bas na sprul te /
translated: The mantra of that is phu phu. Since the second of the fifth [n] is Ratnasaṃbhava, and he is also adorned by Vajraḍāka, the nature of method and wisdom, since it is repeated twice, it is the four joys.

original: rnam par ma dag pa'i yul yang dug lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma dag pa'i yul yang dug lta bu'o //
translated: The snake is removed means that since it is like a snake because it has the nature of poison, the snake is the impure object, which is like poison.

original: de shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid des rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid des rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That is purified by the utterly pure nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: ye shes kyi rnam par bden par rgyu ba yin pas sprul 'bros par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rnam par bden par rgyu ba yin pas sprul 'bros par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the movement of the five pristine consciousnesses is true, the emanations flee.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pas phrag dog rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pas phrag dog rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Since attachment and so on are pure, jealousy is pure.

original: nor skyong 'dul ba'i phyag gis lag pa rab tu bstan na /
analyzed: nor skyong 'dul ba'i phyag gis lag pa rab tu bstan na /
translated: If the hand is shown with the mudra of subduing Dhanasamskṛta,

original: khyi 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni ;
analyzed: khyi 'bros par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni ;
translated: the dog flees.

original: / dha'i sgra ni bzhi pa'i bzhi pa don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: / dha'i sgra ni bzhi pa'i bzhi pa don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The syllable dha is the fourth of the fourth, Amoghasiddhi.

original: na'i sgra ni bzhi pa'i lnga pa ste mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: na'i sgra ni bzhi pa'i lnga pa ste mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The syllable na is the fifth of the fourth, Akṣobhya.

original: dha na gnyis char gyi sgras ni /
analyzed: dha na gnyis char gyi sgras ni /
translated: The two syllables dha na

original: de skyong zhing dbyer med par rnam par 'jog pa yin pas nor skyong ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de skyong zhing dbyer med par rnam par 'jog pa yin pas nor skyong ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: are Dhanasamskṛta because they sustain that and are posited as inseparable.

original: de 'dul ba'i phyag gis ni de'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes lngas so //
analyzed: de 'dul ba'i phyag gis ni de'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes lngas so //
translated: The mudra of subduing that is with the five pristine consciousnesses that are the nature of that.

original: lag pa ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: lag pa ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The hand is the pristine consciousness that is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: bstan pa ni 'od gsal du bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni 'od gsal du bya ba'o //
translated: Showing is making [them] manifest.

original: des na khyi 'phros par 'gyur zhes pa la /
analyzed: des na khyi 'phros par 'gyur zhes pa la /
translated: Therefore, the dog flees.

original: rang nyid rang ste bems po'o //
analyzed: rang nyid rang ste bems po'o //
translated: Since one is oneself, one is matter.

original: rnam par rig byed kyi tshul gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa mi shes pa'i rnam pa 'bros pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kyi tshul gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa mi shes pa'i rnam pa 'bros pa ste /
translated: The mode of the expressive is the flight of the aspect of ignorance, which is the adherence to the manifestation of subject and object.

original: bems po ma yin pa rtogs pa'i rnam par 'od gsal nyid thob pas phrag dog la sogs pa rnam par dag pas zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bems po ma yin pa rtogs pa'i rnam par 'od gsal nyid thob pas phrag dog la sogs pa rnam par dag pas zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: By attaining the clear light of the realization that is not matter, there is the purification of hatred by the purification of envy and so forth.

original: de ltar glang po la sogs pa ma rig pa lnga bstan pa phung po lnga dang nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid rnams chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid ji lta ba de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar glang po la sogs pa ma rig pa lnga bstan pa phung po lnga dang nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid rnams chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid ji lta ba de gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having taught the five ignorances such as the elephant, he teaches the five aggregates, the afflictions, the secondary afflictions, and the nature of the conceptualizations, just as they are, as the nature of the utterly pure realm of truth.

original: rdo rje dkar mo chu ma dang / rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag med ma //
analyzed: rdo rje dkar mo chu ma dang / rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag med ma //
translated: The white vajra is the water, and the vajra dakini is Nairatmya.

original: mkha' spyod sa spyod rnal 'byor las //
analyzed: mkha' spyod sa spyod rnal 'byor las //
translated: From the yoga of the sky-farers of the sky and the earth,

original: rengs sogs brtul zhugs can gyis byed //
analyzed: rengs sogs brtul zhugs can gyis byed //
translated: the adept should perform the paralysis and so forth.

original: ces pa la 'di'i rang bzhin nyid gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam @33a * //
analyzed: ces pa la 'di'i rang bzhin nyid gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam @33a * //
translated: From the yoga of the celestial and terrestrial.

original: par shes pa'i rnam par dag pa rnams so //
analyzed: par shes pa'i rnam par dag pa rnams so //
translated: The celestial is the nature of nirvāṇa.🔽 Therefore, because both are non-different, there is yoga.

original: ji ltar zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽These great compassions abide🔽by the nature of existence and peace.🔽 For this reason, it is said:

original: mkha' spyod sa spyod rnal 'byor las //
analyzed: mkha' spyod sa spyod rnal 'byor las //
translated: The nature of the celestial and terrestrial is the yoga of the celestial and terrestrial.🔽 The celestial is the nature of nirvāṇa.🔽 Therefore, because both are non-different, there is yoga.🔽 Thus it is said:🔽These great compassions abide🔽by the nature of existence and peace.

original: zhes pa las spyod ni srid pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa las spyod ni srid pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: For this reason, it is said:🔽The nature of the celestial and terrestrial is the yoga of the celestial and terrestrial.

original: mkha' spyod ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mkha' spyod ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The celestial is the nature of nirvāṇa.🔽 Therefore, because both are non-different, there is yoga.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga tha mi dad pas rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga tha mi dad pas rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽These great compassions abide🔽by the nature of existence and peace.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: For this reason, it is said:

original: srid dang zhi pa'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: srid dang zhi pa'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The nature of the celestial and terrestrial is the yoga of the celestial and terrestrial.🔽 The celestial is the nature of nirvāṇa.🔽 Therefore, because both are non-different, there is yoga.🔽 Thus it is said:🔽These great compassions abide

original: snying rje chen po 'di dag gnas //
analyzed: snying rje chen po 'di dag gnas //
translated: by the nature of existence and peace.

original: zhes pa'o // rgyu 'dis na /🔽shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rgyu 'dis na / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For this reason, it is said:🔽The nature of the celestial and terrestrial is the yoga of the celestial and terrestrial.🔽 The celestial is the nature of nirvāṇa.

original: rengs pa la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rab tu grags pa nyid do //
analyzed: rengs pa la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rab tu grags pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because both are non-different, there is yoga.🔽 Thus it is said:🔽These great compassions abide🔽by the nature of existence and peace.

original: nang du na mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin la sogs par bya ba ni /
analyzed: nang du na mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin la sogs par bya ba ni /
translated: For this reason, it is said:🔽The nature of the celestial and terrestrial is the yoga of the celestial and terrestrial.🔽 The celestial is the nature of nirvāṇa.🔽 Therefore, because both are non-different, there is yoga.🔽 Thus it is said:

original: bskyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'o //
translated: These great compassions

original: brtul zhugs can ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The one who is disciplined is the nature of the vajra holder.

original: 'dis ci bstan na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan na /
translated: What is taught by this?

original: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa yul dang dbang po rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa yul dang dbang po rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang
translated: The method and wisdom that are the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses are inseparable. The three vajras, which are the pure objects and faculties, are inseparable. The maṇḍala of Nairātmya is the nature of the very pure dharmadhātu, the nature of the sixth buddha, Vajradhara.

original: tha mi dad pa bzhi pa'i rang bzhin gyi rang byung gi ye shes kyi bdag nyid bstan to //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa bzhi pa'i rang bzhin gyi rang byung gi ye shes kyi bdag nyid bstan to //
translated: The nature of the fourth is taught to be the nature of self-originated pristine consciousness, which is inseparable from the maṇḍala of the vajra holder.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dkyil 'khor yang 'di lta bu nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dkyil 'khor yang 'di lta bu nyid du bstan te /
translated: The maṇḍala of the vajra holder is also taught to be like that.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyi ga yang dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyi ga yang dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two maṇḍalas are inseparable.

original: a'a li k'a li gnyis kyi n'a da'i phreng ba re re yang sngags kyi de kho na nyid bskyed pa ste de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: a'a li k'a li gnyis kyi n'a da'i phreng ba re re yang sngags kyi de kho na nyid bskyed pa ste de lta ma yin na /
translated: The two garlands of nāda of the two alikāli are the generation of the reality of the mantra. If that were not so,

original: 'di dag phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i phyir bstan pa'i sngags rnams ni 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i phyir bstan pa'i sngags rnams ni 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since these are understood in a distorted way, the mantras taught are not accomplished.

original: aom zhes bya ba ni rang byung ba'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba ni rang byung ba'o //
translated: Om is self-arisen.

original: de nyid thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pas a'a li k'a li rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de nyid thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pas a'a li k'a li rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: That itself is the two, ālikāli, by the inseparability of method and wisdom.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pas kyang sku gsung thugs kyi rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pas kyang sku gsung thugs kyi rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Also, by the inseparability of both, there are three aspects: body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: That is also fourfold by the concepts of bliss and so on.

original: me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga ni ye shes lnga rnams yin no //
analyzed: me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga ni ye shes lnga rnams yin no //
translated: The five gnoses, mirror-like gnosis, and so on, are the five gnoses.

original: rim pa 'dis bco lnga ste de rnams kyang rnam par shes pa'i lus las te /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis bco lnga ste de rnams kyang rnam par shes pa'i lus las te /
translated: By this process, there are fifteen, and those are from the body of consciousness.

original: drug pa rnam par shes pa de yang de'i rang bzhin des de las 'das pa yin pas lnga pa dang / drug pa dang bdun pa 'di gsum re re zhing yang rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin yin pas dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dang gnyi ga tha mi dad pa nyid sngags kyi de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: drug pa rnam par shes pa de yang de'i rang bzhin des de las 'das pa yin pas lnga pa dang / drug pa dang bdun pa 'di gsum re re zhing yang rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin yin pas dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dang gnyi ga tha mi dad pa nyid sngags kyi de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: The sixth consciousness is also that nature, and is beyond that, so these three, the fifth, sixth, and seventh, each have the nature of the three vajras. Thus, the maṇḍala that is the nature of the nine, and the mantra that is nondifferent from those two, is the reality of the mantra.

original: dang po ka'i sde tshan mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ka'i sde tshan mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The first, the ka group, is Akṣobhya.

original: gnyis @33b pa tsa'i sde tshan don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis @33b pa tsa'i sde tshan don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The second, the ca group, is Amoghasiddhi.

original: gsum pa ta'i sde tshan rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: gsum pa ta'i sde tshan rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The third, the ṭa group, is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: bzhi pa ta'i sde tshan rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: bzhi pa ta'i sde tshan rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The fourth, the ṭa group, is Vairocana.

original: lnga pa pa'i sde tshan 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa pa'i sde tshan 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The fifth, the pa group, is Amitābha.

original: 'di re re zhing yang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid rnam sa dang 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid rnams te mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: 'di re re zhing yang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid rnam sa dang 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid rnams te mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rim pas /
translated: Each of these has the nature of the five gnoses and the nature of the five elements, in the order of Akṣobhya and so on.

original: ka kha ga gha nga zhes pa 'di nyi shu rtsa lnga'i dbye bas de rnams ni re re zhing lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ka kha ga gha nga zhes pa 'di nyi shu rtsa lnga'i dbye bas de rnams ni re re zhing lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The twenty-five divisions of ka, kha, ga, gha, ṅa are each of the nature of five.

original: de yang lnga'i bdag nyid des mtha' yas pa'i rigs su 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang lnga'i bdag nyid des mtha' yas pa'i rigs su 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: And since each of those is of the nature of five, they become of infinite types.

original: yi ge thams cad nyid me longs la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rnam pa yin pas sngags kyi de kho na nyid bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad nyid me longs la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rnam pa yin pas sngags kyi de kho na nyid bstan to //
translated: Since all the syllables are the forms of the five intuitions such as the mirror-like intuition, the reality of the mantra is taught.🔽Similarly, the mantra extraction is to be done according to the explanation of the first is the first, the second is the third, etc., the fifth is the fourth, etc.,🔽and the sixth is the second, etc.,🔽and the seventh is the sixth, etc.,🔽and the eighth is the seventh, etc.,

original: de bzhin du sngags btu ba yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro bas dang po'i ni dang po dang / gnyis pa'i ni gsum pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / lnga pa'i ni bzhi pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /🔽bdag med ma yis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags btu ba yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro bas dang po'i ni dang po dang / gnyis pa'i ni gsum pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / lnga pa'i ni bzhi pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / bdag med ma yis rnam par brgyan //
translated: and the ninth is the eighth, etc.,🔽and the tenth is the ninth, etc.,🔽and the eleventh is the tenth, etc.,🔽and the twelfth is the eleventh, etc.,🔽and the thirteenth is the twelfth, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽sv'a zhes pa ni sv'a khu ba ste 'od dpag med gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // sv'a zhes pa ni sv'a khu ba ste 'od dpag med gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: and the fourteenth is the thirteenth, etc.,🔽and the fifteenth is the fourteenth, etc.,🔽and the sixteenth is the fifteenth, etc.,

original: ba rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ba rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
translated: and the seventeenth is the sixteenth, etc.,🔽and the eighteenth is the seventeenth, etc.,🔽and the nineteenth is the eighteenth, etc.,

original: aa bdag med ma thugs rdo rje ste /
analyzed: aa bdag med ma thugs rdo rje ste /
translated: and the twentieth is the nineteenth, etc.,🔽and the twenty-first is the twentieth, etc.,🔽and the twenty-second is the twenty-first, etc.,🔽and the twenty-third is the twenty-second, etc.,🔽and the twenty-fourth is the twenty-third, etc.,🔽and the twenty-fifth is the twenty-fourth, etc.,🔽and the twenty-sixth is the twenty-fifth, etc.,🔽and the twenty-seventh is the twenty-sixth, etc.,🔽and the twenty-eighth is the twenty-seventh, etc.,🔽and the twenty-ninth is the twenty-eighth, etc.,🔽and the thirtieth is the twenty-ninth, etc.,🔽and the thirty-first is the thirtieth, etc.,🔽and the thirty-second is the thirty-first, etc.,🔽and the thirty-third is the thirty-second, etc.,🔽and the thirty-fourth is the thirty-third, etc.,🔽and the thirty-fifth is the thirty-fourth, etc.,🔽and the thirty-sixth is the thirty-fifth, etc.,🔽and the thirty-seventh is the thirty-sixth, etc.,🔽and the thirty-eighth is the thirty-seventh, etc.,🔽and the

original: rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa sngags so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa sngags so //
translated: The three vajras are non-different, that is mantra.

original: de yang h'a zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de yang h'a zhes pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the syllable hā

original: h'a thabs so //
analyzed: h'a thabs so //
translated: is the method.

original: aa shes rab ste gnyi ga tha mi dad pa ni sngags so //
analyzed: aa shes rab ste gnyi ga tha mi dad pa ni sngags so //
translated: The syllable a is wisdom. The non-difference of the two is mantra.

original: yi ge phat kyis spel pa ni khyad par 'dus pa yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: yi ge phat kyis spel pa ni khyad par 'dus pa yin pa'i don to //
translated: The addition of the syllable phaṭ has the meaning of a special collection.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir de la sngags med gang zhig phyag rgya med //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la sngags med gang zhig phyag rgya med //
translated: “There is no mantra without it, no mudrā,

original: gang zhig dkyil 'khor med cing lha yi rnam pa med //
analyzed: gang zhig dkyil 'khor med cing lha yi rnam pa med //
translated: no maṇḍala, no form of the deity,

original: rdo rje 'dzin dang bdag med ma las gzhan pa'ang med //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin dang bdag med ma las gzhan pa'ang med //
translated: and nothing other than Vajradhara and Nairātmya.”

original: ces pa'o // de'i phyir phyi rol dang nang gi brda gnyis kyi sgra bkod pas sngags thams cad gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: ces pa'o // de'i phyir phyi rol dang nang gi brda gnyis kyi sgra bkod pas sngags thams cad gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all mantras are established by the arrangement of the sounds of the two symbolics, external and internal.

original: 'dir ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, only a small portion is taught,

original: bla ma'i rim pa las 'ongs pa bdag nyid rjes su dran par bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i rim pa las 'ongs pa bdag nyid rjes su dran par bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag dang mnyam pa'i sems can rnams kyi don du'o //
translated: for the sake of remembering oneself, which comes from the stages of the guru, and for the sake of sentient beings equal to oneself.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sdom pa las sngags kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sdom pa las sngags kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o zhes pa la /
translated: The second chapter of the Heruka Tantra of the dakinis' network is the chapter on mantra.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Heruka means

original: gnyi ga tha mi dad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga tha mi dad par byas pa'o //
translated: that the two are not differentiated.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo ste bsdus shing sdom pa de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid du 'jug par 'gyur @34a * //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo ste bsdus shing sdom pa de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid du 'jug par 'gyur @34a * //
translated: The network of dakinis is the circle of yoginis, and by the nature of that network, that is, by the nature of that circle, one enters.

original: bas na // mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: bas na // mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sdom pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the network of dakinis.

original: de'i phyir sngags kyi rim par phye ba ni sngags ni yi shas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngags kyi rim par phye ba ni sngags ni yi shas so //
translated: Thus, the mantra section is the mantra, which is the wisdom.

original: de la gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
translated: The garment is the covering.

original: de len cing 'dzin pas na la'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pas na la'o //
translated: The taking of that is the la.

original: de yang gnyis pa ni sprul pa'i sku dang tha mi dad pas chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad par gyur pas zhes pa'i don to //
