analyzed: de yang gnyis pa ni sprul pa'i sku dang tha mi dad pas chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad par gyur pas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And the second is the dharmakaya, because it is not differentiated from the emanation body. Thus is the meaning.

original: dang por 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags dang / de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sa bon dang / de nas phyag bcu drug pa dang / de nas sngags thams cad nyid kyi rkang pa'i dang por aom dang / mthar sv'a h'a dang ph'um phat kyi yi ge spel ba'o //
analyzed: dang por 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags dang / de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sa bon dang / de nas phyag bcu drug pa dang / de nas sngags thams cad nyid kyi rkang pa'i dang por aom dang / mthar sv'a h'a dang ph'um phat kyi yi ge spel ba'o //
translated: First, the mantra of the bali offering to all the spirits, then the seed syllables of the tathagatas, then the sixteen-armed [form], then all the mantras with the syllable om at the beginning and svaha and phet at the end.

original: de'i rjes su grang khyer bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su grang khyer bskyod pa'o //
translated: After that, the shaking of the ground.

original: de'i rjes su rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sa bon dang / de nas phyag gnyis pa'i dang / de nas phyag bzhi pa'i dang / de nas phyag drug pa'i dang / de nas byin gyis brlabs pa'i dang / de nas sa sbyang ba'i dang / de nas rengs pa'i dang /
analyzed: de'i rjes su rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sa bon dang / de nas phyag gnyis pa'i dang / de nas phyag bzhi pa'i dang / de nas phyag drug pa'i dang / de nas byin gyis brlabs pa'i dang / de nas sa sbyang ba'i dang / de nas rengs pa'i dang /
translated: After that, the seed syllables of the yoginis, then the two-armed [form], then the four-armed [form], then the six-armed [form], then the consecration, then the purification of the ground, then the paralyzing,

original: dbang du bya ba'i dang / bskrad pa'i dang / mngon spyod kyi dang / dgug pa'i dang / dbye ba'i dang / gsang ba'i dang / ku ru ku lle'i sngags dang / char dbab pa'i dang / sprin dral pa'i dang / rdo rgyus kyi dang /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i dang / bskrad pa'i dang / mngon spyod kyi dang / dgug pa'i dang / dbye ba'i dang / gsang ba'i dang / ku ru ku lle'i sngags dang / char dbab pa'i dang / sprin dral pa'i dang / rdo rgyus kyi dang /
translated: the mantra for subjugation, the mantra for banishing, the mantra for destroying, the mantra for summoning, the mantra for separating, the secret mantra, the mantra of Kurukulla, the mantra for causing rain, the mantra for dispersing clouds, the mantra for making a rain of stones,

original: lha dags pa'i dang / tsha ba'i rims kyis 'debs pa'i dang / chang skyug pa'i cho ga'i dang / rab tu myos pa dgug pa'i dang / nyi ma dang zla ba gzung ba dang / rdo rje'i dpyad dang / glang po 'bros pa dang / stag 'bros pa dang /
analyzed: lha dags pa'i dang / tsha ba'i rims kyis 'debs pa'i dang / chang skyug pa'i cho ga'i dang / rab tu myos pa dgug pa'i dang / nyi ma dang zla ba gzung ba dang / rdo rje'i dpyad dang / glang po 'bros pa dang / stag 'bros pa dang /
translated: the mantra for making a rain of flowers, the mantra for making a rain of food, the mantra for making a rain of clothes, the mantra for making a rain of gold, the mantra for making a rain of jewels, the mantra for making a rain of medicine, the mantra for making a rain of weapons, the mantra for making a rain of fire, the mantra for making a rain of water, the mantra for making a rain of wind, the mantra for making a rain of earth, the mantra for making a rain of mountains, the mantra for making a rain of trees, the mantra for making a rain of grass, the mantra for making a rain of wood, the mantra for making a rain of charcoal, the mantra for making a rain of ashes, the mantra for making a rain of sand, the mantra for making a rain of stones, the mantra for making a rain of earth, the mantra for making a rain of water, the mantra for making a rain of fire, the mantra for making a rain of wind, the mantra for making a rain of mountains, the mantra for making a rain of trees, the mantra for making a rain of grass, the mantra for making a rain of wood, the mantra for making a rain of charcoal, the mantra for making a rain of ashes, the mantra for making a rain of sand, the mantra for making a rain of stones, the mantra for making a rain of earth, the mantra for making a rain of water, the mantra for making a rain of fire, the mantra for making a rain of wind, the mantra for making a rain of mountains, the mantra for making a rain of trees, the mantra for making a rain of grass, the mantra for making a rain of wood, the mantra for making a rain of charcoal, the mantra for making a rain of ashes, the mantra for making a rain of sand, the mantra for making a rain of stones, the mantra for making a rain of earth, the mantra for making a rain of water, the mantra for making a rain of fire, the mantra for making a rain of wind, the mantra for making a rain of mountains, the mantra for making a rain of trees, the mantra for making a rain of grass, the

original: bse 'phros pa dang / sprul 'bros pa'i dang / khyi 'bros pa sku rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba las gsungs pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'khor lo sgro ba sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyi sngags sum cu rtsa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: bse 'phros pa dang / sprul 'bros pa'i dang / khyi 'bros pa sku rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba las gsungs pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'khor lo sgro ba sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyi sngags sum cu rtsa gnyis yin no //
translated: The thirty-two channels mentioned in the Vajra Family section of the Tantra of the Esoteric Communion, namely, the two channels of the male and female sexual organs, the two channels of the anus and the penis, the two channels of the two eyes, the two channels of the two ears, the two channels of the two nostrils, the two channels of the two shoulders, the two channels of the two upper arms, the two channels of the two elbows, the two channels of the two forearms, the two channels of the two hands, the two channels of the two thighs, the two channels of the two calves, the two channels of the two feet, and the two channels of the two toes, are the thirty-two mantras of the emanation body, which is the nature of the wheel of the thirty-two channels.

original: sngags kyi rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rim par phye ba'o //
translated: This is the section on the mantras.

original: rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las le'u gnyis pa'o /🔽// / de ltar rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye bas sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku bstan te ;
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las le'u gnyis pa'o / // / de ltar rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye bas sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku bstan te ;
translated: This concludes the second chapter of the commentary on the Esoteric Communion Tantra called Illuminating Lamp.🔽Thus, the emanation body, which is the vajra body, is taught by the section on the Vajra Family.

original: / sngags kyi rim par phye bas gsung rdo rje longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan nas /
analyzed: / sngags kyi rim par phye bas gsung rdo rje longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan nas /
translated: And the enjoyment body, which is the vajra speech, is taught by the section on the mantras.

original: da ni thugs rdo rje chos kyi sku bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni thugs rdo rje chos kyi sku bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach the truth body, which is the vajra mind, it is said:

original: de nas lha'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Now, the chapter on the deities will be explained.

original: lha ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lha ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The deities are of two kinds:

original: sku can dang / sngags kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: sku can dang / sngags kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: and the body, and the nature of mantra.

original: gnyi ga @34b yang bstan ma thag pa'i rim par phye ba gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: gnyi ga @34b yang bstan ma thag pa'i rim par phye ba gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: Both are taught by the two divisions just explained.

original: da ni de gnyi ga tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi lha gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni de gnyi ga tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi lha gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to clarify the deity who is the nature of non-dual gnosis, it is said:

original: lha'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lha'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The chapter on the deity will be explained.🔽There,

original: de la / dang por byams pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de la / dang por byams pa bsgom par bya //
translated: first, one should cultivate love.

original: gnyis pa snying rje rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: gnyis pa snying rje rnam par bsgom //
translated: Second, one should cultivate compassion.🔽Third, one should cultivate joy,

original: gsum pa dga' ba bsgom pa dang // kun gyi mtha' mar btang snyoms sgom //
analyzed: gsum pa dga' ba bsgom pa dang // kun gyi mtha' mar btang snyoms sgom //
translated: and at the end of all, equanimity.

original: zhes pa dang / de nas /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / de nas /
translated: And then,

original: yang ni stong pa'i byang chub ste /
analyzed: yang ni stong pa'i byang chub ste /
translated: again, emptiness is enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: In the second, the seed is gathered.

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: In the third, the reflection is complete.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: In the fourth, the syllable is arranged.

original: ces pa la dang po zhes pa ni sngon du'o //
analyzed: ces pa la dang po zhes pa ni sngon du'o //
translated: Here, first means prior.

original: stong pa'i byang chub ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i byang chub ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The enlightenment of emptiness is the cultivation of the three doors of liberation, namely emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: In the second, the seed is gathered.

original: zhes pa ni de'i rjes thogs su lha gang bsgom par bya ba de bskyed pa'i sngags bsdu pa ste yang dag par bsdus pa'i tshul te gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i rjes thogs su lha gang bsgom par bya ba de bskyed pa'i sngags bsdu pa ste yang dag par bsdus pa'i tshul te gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second method, the perfect gathering, of the mantra that generates the deity to be cultivated immediately after that.

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: In the third, the reflection is complete.

original: zhes pa ni phyag dang / zhal dang mig dang mtshan ma'i rnam pa la sogs par bskyed pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag dang / zhal dang mig dang mtshan ma'i rnam pa la sogs par bskyed pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third, the generation of the form of the deity, with hands, faces, eyes, and signs.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: In the fourth, the syllable is placed.

original: ces pa ni mi 'gyur bas ni yi ge ste rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: ces pa ni mi 'gyur bas ni yi ge ste rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: This is the vajra holder, the syllable of immutability.

original: de yang dgod pa ni dmigs par bya ba ste mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang dgod pa ni dmigs par bya ba ste mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, the placement is the object of observation, the nature of immovability.

original: de yang spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi bdag por 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de yang spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi bdag por 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: Moreover, it becomes the lord of one’s family on the crown, according to the words.

original: de lta bu'i rim pas lha bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pas lha bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: In this way, one should meditate on the deity. This is the fourth.🔽Or else,

original: yang na / dang por stong pa'i byang chub ste //
analyzed: yang na / dang por stong pa'i byang chub ste //
translated: enlightenment is empty in the beginning,

original: zhes pa la dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: in the beginning, there is nonduality.

original: de yang stong pa'i byang chub ces pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang stong pa'i byang chub ces pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: And that is enlightenment empty, which is nonconceptual intuition.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: In the second, the seed is gathered.

original: zhes pa ni rlung la zhon pa'i phyir thugs rdo rje ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rlung la zhon pa'i phyir thugs rdo rje ste /
translated: The mind-vajra is mounted on the wind,

original: de yang gnyis pa la sa bon gyi tshul gyis bsdus te yang dag par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gnyis pa la sa bon gyi tshul gyis bsdus te yang dag par gzung ba'o //
translated: and that is gathered in the second by way of the seed, and is well grasped.

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //🔽zhes pa ni ;
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs // zhes pa ni ;
translated: In the third, the reflection is complete.

original: / a'a li k'a li n'a da'i bdag nyid des sku'i sku bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: / a'a li k'a li n'a da'i bdag nyid des sku'i sku bskyed pa yin no //
translated: By that, which is the essence of the vowels and consonants, the body of the body is generated.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: In the fourth, the syllable is arrayed.

original: ces pa ni bkod pas na dgod pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni bkod pas na dgod pa ste /
translated: It is arrayed because it is placed,

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
translated: and it is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de yang mi g-yo bas yi ge ste de'i bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mi g-yo bas yi ge ste de'i bsgom par bya'o //
translated: And that is the syllable of the immovable, and it is to be meditated.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bskyed par @35a * //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bskyed par @35a * //
translated: It is generated by the yoga of meditative equipoise.🔽

original: bya ba'i rim pa 'di'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i rim pa 'di'o //
translated: This is the process of generation by the yoga of meditative concentration.

original: las kyi phyag rgya la yang dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas rim pa 'di'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya la yang dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas rim pa 'di'o //
translated: This is the process of the action seal, also, by the stages of joy, etc.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya la yang 'khor lo rim pas gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa 'di'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya la yang 'khor lo rim pas gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa 'di'o //
translated: This is the process of the fierce fire yoga by the wheel process in the case of the reality seal.

original: phyag rgya chen po la yang phyag rgya gsum gyi dbye bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'o /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la yang phyag rgya gsum gyi dbye bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa'o /
translated: And this is the manifest enlightenment of the knowledge of all modes by the division of the three seals in the case of the great seal.

original: brgyud pa'i rim pa'o //🔽de bas na slar byams pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: brgyud pa'i rim pa'o // de bas na slar byams pa bsgom pa ni /
translated: This is the process of the lineage.

original: sems can rnams la bu gcig pa ltar brtse ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bu gcig pa ltar brtse ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the cultivation of love is the affection for all living beings as for one's only child.

original: gnyis pa snying rje ni 'bras dang shu ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi dge ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa snying rje ni 'bras dang shu ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mi dge ba'i rang bzhin las yang dag par gdon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the desire to deliver them from the suffering of disease, abscess, etc., and from the nature of non-virtue which is the cause of suffering.🔽Sympathetic joy is the desire that they not be deprived of the happiness of the three realms of existence.

original: dga' ba ni sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las grol ba bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa gang sems dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las grol ba bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa gang sems dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the joy of mind that all sentient beings are free from suffering and the causes of suffering and are endowed with happiness.

original: btang snyoms ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Equanimity is the characteristic of being free from the eight worldly dharmas.

original: kun gyi mtha' mar zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kun gyi mtha' mar zhes pa ni /
translated: The end of all is

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug par ro //
translated: the end of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: yang na byams pa ni bu gcig pa'i brtse ba nyid de /
analyzed: yang na byams pa ni bu gcig pa'i brtse ba nyid de /
translated: Alternatively, love is the affection of a single child.

original: 'gro ba thams cad nga las byung //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad nga las byung //
translated: All beings come from me.

original: srid pa gsum yang nga las byung //
analyzed: srid pa gsum yang nga las byung //
translated: The three worlds come from me.

original: nga yis 'di dag kun la khyab //
analyzed: nga yis 'di dag kun la khyab //
translated: I pervade all of these.

original: nga las gzhan pa'i 'gro ma mthong //
analyzed: nga las gzhan pa'i 'gro ma mthong //
translated: I do not see any beings other than me.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is stated in the verse.

original: gnyis pa snying rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa snying rje zhes pa ni /
translated: The second is compassion.

original: bstan pa'i tshul du rnam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i tshul du rnam par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the mode of teaching.

original: gsum dga' ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gsum dga' ba zhes pa ni /
translated: The third is joy.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis gnyi ga tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis gnyi ga tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: It is the nondifferentiation of both by means of its nature.

original: kun gyi mtha' mar btang snyoms bsgoms //
analyzed: kun gyi mtha' mar btang snyoms bsgoms //
translated: At the end of all, one should cultivate equanimity.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dbyer med pa rtogs par gyur pas zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dbyer med pa rtogs par gyur pas zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: This means that one has realized the inseparability of the two.

original: / yang na /
analyzed: / yang na /
translated: Or else,

original: yul dang dbang po tha mi dad pa byams pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po tha mi dad pa byams pa ste /
translated: love is the nondifferentiation of object and sense faculty.

original: dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of joy.

original: snying rje zhes pa ni /🔽k'a bde ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje zhes pa ni / k'a bde ba'o //
translated: Compassion is

original: ru 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ru 'dzin pa ste /
translated: the holding of suffering.

original: bdag nyid 'jug par 'gyur bas na snying rje'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jug par 'gyur bas na snying rje'o //
translated: It is compassion because one takes it into oneself.

original: mchog dga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mchog dga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of supreme joy.

original: dga' ba zhes ba ni bde ba la chags pa'i rang bzhin can rnam par dga' ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes ba ni bde ba la chags pa'i rang bzhin can rnam par dga' ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Joy is the nature of attachment to bliss, the nature of complete delight.

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Equanimity is

original: 'dod chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres par gyur pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags bral rnam par 'dres par gyur pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the nature of the mixture of passion and dispassion, the nature of the innate.

original: yang na byams pa ni gnyis med du rtogs pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: yang na byams pa ni gnyis med du rtogs pa'i shes rab po //
translated: Or else, love is the wisdom that realizes nonduality.

original: snying rje zhes pa ni spro ba'i tshul gyis thabs so //
analyzed: snying rje zhes pa ni spro ba'i tshul gyis thabs so //
translated: Compassion is the method that is the way of delight.

original: dga' ba zhes pa ni gnyi ga dbyer med @35b pa'i rdo rje gsum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes pa ni gnyi ga dbyer med @35b pa'i rdo rje gsum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Joy is the characteristic of the indivisible three vajras.

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Equanimity is the characteristic of the indivisible three vajras, the nature of emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations.

original: bzhi po 'di gnyis thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi sgo'i rang bzhin lha lus pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim pas rang byin gyis brlab pa'i zung du 'jug pa dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: bzhi po 'di gnyis thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi sgo'i rang bzhin lha lus pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rim pas rang byin gyis brlab pa'i zung du 'jug pa dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir
translated: In order to realize the two sets of four, the method and wisdom that are not different, the nature of the door of the eight liberations, the mandala circle of the nature of the deity that is not separate, the stage of self-consecration, and the union,🔽it is said:

original: gsungs pa / ram las nyi ma mngon du rnam bsgoms nas /
analyzed: gsungs pa / ram las nyi ma mngon du rnam bsgoms nas /
translated: From raṃ, visualize the sun,

original: nyi der h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste //
analyzed: nyi der h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste //
translated: and from that hūṃ, a vajra cross.🔽With that vajra, visualize a fence,

original: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni ra ba dang / gur bcing ba yang rnam par bsgoms pa nyid //🔽ces pa smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni ra ba dang / gur bcing ba yang rnam par bsgoms pa nyid // ces pa smos te /
translated: a tent, and binding.

original: nyi ma nyi ma'o //
analyzed: nyi ma nyi ma'o //
translated: Sun is the sun.

original: sngon du ni dang por ro //
analyzed: sngon du ni dang por ro //
translated: First means at the beginning.

original: bsgoms nas ni bltas nas so //
analyzed: bsgoms nas ni bltas nas so //
translated: Having meditated means having seen.

original: de'i rjes su nyid der ni dkyil 'khor gzhir gyur pa der ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su nyid der ni dkyil 'khor gzhir gyur pa der ro //
translated: After that means there, in the place of the mandala.

original: h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste /
analyzed: h'um byung sna tshogs rdo rje ste /
translated: The vajra arisen from hūṃ is the vajra cross.

original: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni bsgom pa nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni bsgom pa nyid //
translated: That vajra itself is the meditation.

original: ces pa ni rab blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni rab blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be seen.

original: dang gi sgra thad kar 'od zer song bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dang gi sgra thad kar 'od zer song bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The word “and” is to be understood as “having gone out in the form of light rays.”

original: gur bcings pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gur bcings pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The enclosure means

original: gur dang 'dra gas na gur te /
analyzed: gur dang 'dra gas na gur te /
translated: that which is like a tent is a tent.

original: de bcings pa spras pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bcings pa spras pa nyid do //
translated: The enclosure is the covering.

original: yang gi sgras ni 'og tu song ba'i 'od zer gyis rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi dang dang steng du 'phros pas thog phub par bsam mo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'og tu song ba'i 'od zer gyis rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi dang dang steng du 'phros pas thog phub par bsam mo //
translated: The word “also” is to be understood as “having gone below,” and the light rays spread out in the form of vajras, and one should imagine that the roof is covered.

original: rim pa 'dis gzhal yas khang ngo //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: By this process, there is the celestial mansion.

original: yan na ram zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan na ram zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line “raṃ yaṃ vaṃ laṃ ḍaṃ taṃ paṃ śaṃ ṣaṃ saṃ haṃ laṃ ḍaṃ paṃ śaṃ ṣaṃ saṃ haṃ laṃ”

original: rin chen 'byung ldan nyi ma bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan nyi ma bdag med ma'o //
translated: means that Ratnasaṃbhava, the sun, and Nairātmya

original: nyi der h'um ni snang ba mtha' yas zla ba byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: nyi der h'um ni snang ba mtha' yas zla ba byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: are the hūṃ in the sun, which is Amitābha, the moon, and bodhicitta.

original: de gnyis byung ba'i khams gsum ni sna tshogs so //
analyzed: de gnyis byung ba'i khams gsum ni sna tshogs so //
translated: The three worlds that arise from those two are the variety.

original: de yang rdo rje ni mi phye pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje ni mi phye pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Moreover, the vajra is the indivisible intuition.

original: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni ye shes de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni ye shes de nyid kyis so //
translated: By that very vajra is by that very intuition.

original: ra ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam pa ni ra ba ste /
analyzed: ra ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam pa ni ra ba ste /
translated: The fence is the special aspect, which is the fence.

original: mdog dang phyag dang zhal dang dbyibs kyi rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mdog dang phyag dang zhal dang dbyibs kyi rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of the color, hands, faces, and shapes is the nature of the conventional truth.

original: de yang ka ni bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang ka ni bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, ka is the nature of the truth.

original: 'di gnyis tha mi dad par gur 'ching ba ni zung 'jug yin no /
analyzed: 'di gnyis tha mi dad par gur 'ching ba ni zung 'jug yin no /
translated: The binding of the two nets without distinction is the union.

original: dang por ro ni rnam bsgom pa /
analyzed: dang por ro ni rnam bsgom pa /
translated: First, one should meditate on the corpse,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid rig //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid rig //
translated: knowing the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: ces pa ni gzhal yas khang der dang por thog mar ro bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni gzhal yas khang der dang por thog mar ro bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In that celestial mansion, first, at the beginning, one should meditate on the corpse.

original: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
translated: By what is it distinguished?

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid nyid rig / ces pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid nyid rig / ces pa ste /
translated: It is said, “knowing the nature of the realm of phenomena.”

original: chos ni 'dus byas thams cad do /
analyzed: chos ni 'dus byas thams cad do /
translated: Dharma is all conditioned things.

original: de rnams kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin te de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin med @36a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin te de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin med @36a * //
translated: The basic space of those is the nature, and the nature of that is the nature of the absence of nature.🔽

original: pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽rig pa ni shes pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin no // rig pa ni shes pa ste /
translated: The realm of those is the nature, and the nature of that nature is the nature of the absence of nature.

original: de shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is consciousness, and that is the conceptualization of consciousness.

original: yang na de dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na de dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, that is called Hevajra,

original: dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: the first is nondual,

original: ro ni rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: ro ni rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: and taste is the absence of nature.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid ni chos rnams kyi dbyings de'i bdag nyid kyi sku ston pa yin pas chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kun rdzob dang don dam tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid ni chos rnams kyi dbyings de'i bdag nyid kyi sku ston pa yin pas chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kun rdzob dang don dam tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The nature of the realm of phenomena is the body that is the nature of the realm of phenomena, and the nature of the realm of phenomena is the nondifference of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: rig pa ni ye shes kyi rnam pas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rig pa ni ye shes kyi rnam pas rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Knowledge is the arrangement by the aspect of exalted wisdom.

original: de steng rnal 'byor pa 'dug nas //
analyzed: de steng rnal 'byor pa 'dug nas //
translated: The yogi sits upon that

original: he ru ka ni rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: he ru ka ni rnam par bsgom //
translated: and meditates on Heruka.

original: zhes pa la ro de'i steng du rnal 'byor pa 'dug nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la ro de'i steng du rnal 'byor pa 'dug nas so //
translated: The yogi sits upon that corpse.

original: he ru ka nyid ni he ru ka'i sku rnam par bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: he ru ka nyid ni he ru ka'i sku rnam par bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: Heruka himself is to be contemplated as the body of Heruka.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa ni /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa ni /
translated: Or, the yogi

original: 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas na rnal 'byor pa ste zung 'jug gi rim pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas na rnal 'byor pa ste zung 'jug gi rim pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: is one who has yoga, i.e., who abides in the stage of union.

original: de'i ngo bo dang chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid bshad zin pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid bshad zin pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: His nature is the essence of the reality of the realm of phenomena, which has been explained.

original: steng du gnas pa ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: steng du gnas pa ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Abiding above means being unmoving by nature as the pervader and the pervaded.

original: he ru ka nyid ni /
analyzed: he ru ka nyid ni /
translated: Heruka himself

original: he zhes pa ni rgyu la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: he zhes pa ni rgyu la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: is so called because he is free from causes, etc.

original: ru zhes pa ni yi ge ru tshogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ru zhes pa ni yi ge ru tshogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Ru means he is free from the collection of syllables.

original: ka zhes pa ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ka zhes pa ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Ka means he does not abide anywhere.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i he ru ka de'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid rnam par dag pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i he ru ka de'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid rnam par dag pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The reality of that Heruka should be contemplated as pure.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs par bsgoms te /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs par bsgoms te /
translated: Contemplating in various ways,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor gyis rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: One should be established by the yoga of meditative equipoise.

original: ram las nyi ma sngon du rnam bsgoms nas /
analyzed: ram las nyi ma sngon du rnam bsgoms nas /
translated: Having previously visualized the sun from the syllable raṃ,

original: zhes bya bas mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: having explained in brief, he explains in detail:

original: rang gi snying gar re pha bsgom //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar re pha bsgom //
translated: One should meditate on the syllable raṃ in one’s heart.

original: zhes pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes pa smos so //
translated: Thus he says.

original: de gang du bsgom par bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gang du bsgom par bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa /
translated: Having anticipated the doubt of where that is to be meditated, he says:

original: rang gi snying gar ni thugs kar ro //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar ni thugs kar ro //
translated: In one’s heart, that is, in the heart center.

original: ram bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ram bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: One should meditate on the syllable raṃ.

original: de las byung ba'i nyi dkyil 'khor //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i nyi dkyil 'khor //
translated: From that, the sun maṇḍala arises.

original: der ni h'um gi rnam pa nyid //
analyzed: der ni h'um gi rnam pa nyid //
translated: There, the form of the syllable hūṃ

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
translated: has the nature of method and wisdom.

original: zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin te thams cad bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin te thams cad bshad zin to //
translated: This has the nature of method and wisdom. Everything has been explained.

original: rang gi snying gar zhes pa ni chos 'byung du'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar zhes pa ni chos 'byung du'o //
translated: “In one’s heart” is in the source of phenomena.

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
translated: Has the nature of method and wisdom.

original: zhes pa la thabs ni sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la thabs ni sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: Method is the vajra cross.

original: shes rab ni sna tshogs padma'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni sna tshogs padma'o //
translated: Wisdom is the variegated lotus.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes chos 'byung dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang sna @36b tshogs padma rnams rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes chos 'byung dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang sna @36b tshogs padma rnams rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The nature of this gnosis is the source of phenomena, the vajra cross, and the variegated lotus, which are the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: der h'um rdo rje de ji lta bu zhig bsgom par bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: der h'um rdo rje de ji lta bu zhig bsgom par bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: It is said how that vajra HŪṀ should be visualized there:

original: h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje ni //
analyzed: h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje ni //
translated: The vajra arisen from HŪṀ,

original: kha dog nag po 'jig chen po //
analyzed: kha dog nag po 'jig chen po //
translated: black in color, very frightening,

original: rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas pa'i //
analyzed: rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas pa'i //
translated: residing in the center of the vajra navel.

original: yang na h'um gi de nyid bsgom pa cis khyad du 'phags she na /🔽rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na h'um gi de nyid bsgom pa cis khyad du 'phags she na / rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas zhes pa ste /
translated: Or, how is the meditation on the reality of HŪṀ superior?🔽Residing in the center of the vajra navel.

original: rdo rje lte ba'i nang du son pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lte ba'i nang du son pa'o //
translated: It is located inside the center of the vajra.

original: kha dog nag po 'jigs chen ni rtogs dka' ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog nag po 'jigs chen ni rtogs dka' ba'o //
translated: Black in color, very frightening, difficult to understand.

original: h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje ni de dbus kyi nang du gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje ni de dbus kyi nang du gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The vajra arisen from HŪṀ, residing in its center inside.

original: h'um gi rnam pa gyur bltas nas //
analyzed: h'um gi rnam pa gyur bltas nas //
translated: Having seen the form of HŪṀ,

original: zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam par bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the nature of hatred.

original: zhes pa ni der yi ge h'um bltas nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni der yi ge h'um bltas nas /
translated: Here, having seen the letter HŪṀ,

original: de yongs su gyur pa las zhe sdang bdag nyid mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las zhe sdang bdag nyid mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: That completely transforms into the nature of Akṣobhya, the essence of anger.

original: rdo rje las skyes nag po che //
analyzed: rdo rje las skyes nag po che //
translated: Born from a vajra, very black,🔽the color of a blue lotus, or the color of blue or dawn,

original: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog / yang na sngo dang skya rengs mdog / dad pas nges par rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog / yang na sngo dang skya rengs mdog / dad pas nges par rnam par bsgom //
translated: one should definitely visualize with faith.

original: zhes pa la rdo rje skye ba ni rdo rje'i rang bzhin du skye zhing 'khrungs pa ni gang la yod pa ni rdo rje skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la rdo rje skye ba ni rdo rje'i rang bzhin du skye zhing 'khrungs pa ni gang la yod pa ni rdo rje skye ba'o //
translated: Here, “born from a vajra” is born and produced from the nature of a vajra.

original: de nyid nag po che ni /
analyzed: de nyid nag po che ni /
translated: That very one is “very black,”

original: shin tu gnag pa ste gnyis med pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu gnag pa ste gnyis med pa'o //
translated: which is very dark, nondual.

original: 'dam skyes sngon po'i mdog 'dra ba ni dkar po dang nag po rnam par bsres pa'i kha dog gi rang bzhin te gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dam skyes sngon po'i mdog 'dra ba ni dkar po dang nag po rnam par bsres pa'i kha dog gi rang bzhin te gnyis so //
translated: The color of a blue lotus is the nature of a color mixed with white and black, which is the second.

original: yang na sngo dang skya rengs mdog /
analyzed: yang na sngo dang skya rengs mdog /
translated: Or the color of blue or dawn.

original: ces pa ni dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po 'dres pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam pa gsum bsgom mo //
analyzed: ces pa ni dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po 'dres pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam pa gsum bsgom mo //
translated: One should visualize the three aspects with the nature of a mixture of white, black, and red.

original: 'di la kha dog gcig go //
analyzed: 'di la kha dog gcig go //
translated: Here, there is one color.

original: dad pas ni rang gi bsam pas so zhes pa ni nges pa ste sbyar bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dad pas ni rang gi bsam pas so zhes pa ni nges pa ste sbyar bar bya ba'o //
translated: By faith, one should apply oneself with certainty, by one's own thought.

original: phyag gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dang phyag drug pa dang / he ru ka gsum las gcig ces dgongs so //
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dang phyag drug pa dang / he ru ka gsum las gcig ces dgongs so //
translated: The one is intended from among the three Herukas, the two-armed, the four-armed, and the six-armed.

original: yang na kha dog nag po ni /
analyzed: yang na kha dog nag po ni /
translated: Or else, the black color is

original: kha dog a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyis /
analyzed: kha dog a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyis /
translated: the nature of the vowels and consonants.

original: nag po bsrabs pa gang de la kha dog nag po'i dri ma med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nag po bsrabs pa gang de la kha dog nag po'i dri ma med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the black color is free from the stain of diminution.

original: de nyid 'jigs chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'jigs chen po ste /
translated: That itself is the great fear,

original: shin tu mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rdo rje byung ba yin te /
analyzed: shin tu mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rdo rje byung ba yin te /
translated: the origin of the vajra, by the nature of complete non-apprehension.

original: mi phyed pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the end of the perfect limit, by the method of indivisibility.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: yi ge h'um las so //
analyzed: yi ge h'um las so //
translated: From the syllable hūṃ.

original: thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because method and wisdom are not different.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rdo rje lta ba'i dbus gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rdo rje lta ba'i dbus gnas pa ni /
translated: The vajra that has become like that, located in the middle of the view,

original: ba byang chub kyi sems thabs so //
analyzed: ba byang chub kyi sems thabs so //
translated: is the method, the bodhicitta.

original: ra shes rab po //
analyzed: ra shes rab po //
translated: The ra is wisdom.

original: gnyi ga lte ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga lte ba'o //
translated: Both are the navel.

original: de yang ka'o //
analyzed: de yang ka'o //
translated: And that is ka.

original: de'i dbus @37a * //
analyzed: de'i dbus @37a * //
translated: In the middle of that

original: gnas nas ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas nas ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: is the syllable hūṃ, which is the indivisibility of method and wisdom.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i h'um de nyid kyis de kho na nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i h'um de nyid kyis de kho na nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: That very hūṃ, which has become like that, should be cultivated as the true wisdom of thatness.

original: yang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang zhes pa ni /
translated: Again means

original: slar yang 'di nyid rgyun mi 'chad par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'di nyid rgyun mi 'chad par bsgom pa'o //
translated: that this should be cultivated without interruption.

original: de nyid h'um gi rnam par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid h'um gi rnam par gyur pa ni /
translated: That very [hūṃ] becomes the form of hūṃ,

original: yi ge h'um gi rang bzhin nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge h'um gi rang bzhin nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause and result are not different in the nature of the syllable hūṃ.

original: bltas nas zhes pa ni rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bltas nas zhes pa ni rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Looking means realizing.

original: zhe sdang bdag nyid ni gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa bdag gis spang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang bdag nyid ni gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa bdag gis spang bar mi bya ste /
translated: The nature of hatred is not to be abandoned by me, the union of the two.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dbyer med pa yin pas zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dbyer med pa yin pas zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Since saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are indivisible, it is hatred.

original: bdag gi lus gang la de nyid yod pa'ang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus gang la de nyid yod pa'ang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The body in which that exists is also called that.

original: de bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni bstan zin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni bstan zin pa'i don to //
translated: That should be cultivated means the meaning that has been explained.

original: slar yang de nyid khyad par du cis 'phags she na /
analyzed: slar yang de nyid khyad par du cis 'phags she na /
translated: Again, how is that reality especially exalted?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / rdo rje skye ba la sogs pa ste skye ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rdo rje skye ba la sogs pa ste skye ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The vajra birth, etc. Birth is arising.

original: nag po che ni cher 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: nag po che ni cher 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The great black one is greatly frightening.

original: gnyi ga yang rdo rje dang tha mi dad pas rdo rje skye ba nag po che'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rdo rje dang tha mi dad pas rdo rje skye ba nag po che'o //
translated: Since both are not different from the vajra, the vajra birth is the great black one.

original: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog ni sngon po ni dkar nag yin pa'i phyir sngon po'o //
analyzed: 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog ni sngon po ni dkar nag yin pa'i phyir sngon po'o //
translated: The color like a blue lotus is blue because blue is white and black.

original: de yang 'dam skyes ni chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang 'dam skyes ni chos 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, the blue lotus is the dharmodaya.

original: der yang dag par ma lus par rab tu snang bas na 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog go //
analyzed: der yang dag par ma lus par rab tu snang bas na 'dam skyes sngon po 'dra ba'i mdog go //
translated: Since it appears completely and totally there, it is the color like a blue lotus.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa tha mi dad pa'i chos 'byung las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa tha mi dad pa'i chos 'byung las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the dharmodaya, where birth and destruction are not different.

original: yang na sngo dang skya rengs mdog / ces pa ni kha dog gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni sngon po'o //
analyzed: yang na sngo dang skya rengs mdog / ces pa ni kha dog gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni sngon po'o //
translated: Or, the color of blue and dawn is blue because it has the nature of two colors.

original: skya rengs ni dmar po'o //
analyzed: skya rengs ni dmar po'o //
translated: Dawn is red.

original: dkar nag dmar ba'i tshul gyis 'jig pa dang skye ba dang gnas pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: dkar nag dmar ba'i tshul gyis 'jig pa dang skye ba dang gnas pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The way of destruction, origination, and abiding is in the manner of white, black, and red.

original: mdog ces pa ni sngo dang skya rengs mdog go //
analyzed: mdog ces pa ni sngo dang skya rengs mdog go //
translated: The color is blue and the color of dawn.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'o //
translated: It is like that.

original: dad pas zhes pa ni dad pa'i dbang pos yin te /
analyzed: dad pas zhes pa ni dad pa'i dbang pos yin te /
translated: Faith is by means of the faculty of faith,

original: dbang po gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of the other faculties.

original: bsgom zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid du bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid du bzhag pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is equipoise in sameness.

original: nges par ni nges par ro //
analyzed: nges par ni nges par ro //
translated: Certainly is definitely.

original: yang na rdo rje skye ba nag po che //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje skye ba nag po che //
translated: Alternatively, the vajra is born with a great black color.

original: zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa 'di rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa 'di rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This nonduality is the pristine consciousness of natural purity.

original: de nyid 'dam skyes sngon po dang 'dra ba'i mdog ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'dam skyes sngon po dang 'dra ba'i mdog ste /
translated: That itself is the color of a blue lotus.

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of method and wisdom inseparable.🔽Alternatively, the color is blue and the color of the sun.

original: yang na sngo dang nyi ma'i mdog / ces pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: yang na sngo dang nyi ma'i mdog / ces pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: That pristine consciousness of the indivisibility of method and wisdom

original: de nyid rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: has the nature of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: bsgom @37b zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bsgom @37b zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: “Meditation” is posited as the state of union.

original: dad pas nges par zhes pa'i don ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: dad pas nges par zhes pa'i don ni bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of “determined by faith” has already been explained.

original: yang na skye ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: yang na skye ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Or, “arising” is birth.

original: nag po che ni 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: nag po che ni 'jigs pa'o //
translated: “Great darkness” is fear.

original: de yang rdo rje ste 'di nyid sngon pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje ste 'di nyid sngon pa'o //
translated: And that is the vajra, which is blue.

original: gnyis su dbyer med pa'i gnyi ga mi phyed par 'khril nas gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer med pa'i gnyi ga mi phyed par 'khril nas gnas pa yin te /
translated: Since it is indivisible, both are inseparable, and they abide.

original: sngon po dang skya rengs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang skya rengs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being blue and dawn.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa 'di gsum gzugs med pa bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa 'di gsum gzugs med pa bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pas so //
translated: Since these three, birth, destruction, and abiding, are not different from Nairātmya, the formless one,

original: mdog ces pa ni so sor snang ba de de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas par gyur pa yin pas sngo dang skya rengs mdog go //
analyzed: mdog ces pa ni so sor snang ba de de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas par gyur pa yin pas sngo dang skya rengs mdog go //
translated: “color” is the individual appearance that exists as the nature of that, so it is blue and dawn color.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rje btsun gang du ji ltar bskyed par bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rje btsun gang du ji ltar bskyed par bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: The venerable one who is like that is generated in what way?

original: nam mkhar rje btsun zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: nam mkhar rje btsun zhes pa smos te /
translated: “In the sky, the venerable one” is stated.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa ni chos 'byung gi gzhal yas khang gi nang du'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa ni chos 'byung gi gzhal yas khang gi nang du'o //
translated: In the sky means in the celestial mansion of the source of phenomena.

original: rje btsun zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rje btsun zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo'o //
translated: The venerable means the chief of migrating beings.

original: bltas nas / rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //🔽rgyan rnams thams cad yongs 'dzin pa'i //
analyzed: bltas nas / rdo rje skye ba snying rje che // rgyan rnams thams cad yongs 'dzin pa'i //
translated: Having seen, the vajra-born one is great compassion.🔽The eight goddesses worship him,

original: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
translated: who holds all the ornaments.

original: ces pa la bltas nas ni nye bar dmigs la'o //
analyzed: ces pa la bltas nas ni nye bar dmigs la'o //
translated: Having seen means having visualized.

original: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
translated: How is he distinguished?

original: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa'i zhes pa ste 'khor lo dang / rna cha la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i rgyan de 'chang ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa'i zhes pa ste 'khor lo dang / rna cha la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i rgyan de 'chang ba rnams kyis so //
translated: He holds all the ornaments means he holds the ornaments of the seals such as the wheel and earrings.

original: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
analyzed: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
translated: Pukkasi holds the sign of the deer.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub sems te zla ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub sems te zla ba'o //
translated: This means the moon, which is the bodhicitta.

original: chom rkun ma ni nyi ma'i snod //
analyzed: chom rkun ma ni nyi ma'i snod //
translated: Caurī is the vessel of the sun.

original: ces pa ni thod par rin chen 'byung ldan nyi ma thogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni thod par rin chen 'byung ldan nyi ma thogs pa'o //
translated: This means holding Ratnasambhava and the sun in a skull cup.

original: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
translated: Vetālī holds the water in her hand.

original: zhes pa ste mi bskyod pas gang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste mi bskyod pas gang ba'i thod pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: This means holding a skull cup filled with Akṣobhya.

original: gha sma r'i ni sman 'dzin cing //
analyzed: gha sma r'i ni sman 'dzin cing //
translated: Ghasmarī holds the medicine.

original: zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad des gang ba'i thod pa bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad des gang ba'i thod pa bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the skull-cup filled with Vairocana.🔽Pukkasi is the vajra hand,

original: pukka s'i ni rdo rje lag / ces pa ni rdo rje'i sha don yod grub pa ste sku rdo rje 'jug pas de nyid rdo rje'i lag go //
analyzed: pukka s'i ni rdo rje lag / ces pa ni rdo rje'i sha don yod grub pa ste sku rdo rje 'jug pas de nyid rdo rje'i lag go //
translated: the vajra flesh of Amoghasiddhi. Since the Body Vajra enters, it is the vajra hand.

original: de bzhin ri khrod ma ro 'dzin //
analyzed: de bzhin ri khrod ma ro 'dzin //
translated: Likewise, Śavarī holds the taste.🔽Śavarī holds the sweet taste, etc. ,

original: zhes pa ni ri khrod ma mngar ba la sogs pa myang ba'i mtshan nyid de 'dzin par byed pas ro 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ri khrod ma mngar ba la sogs pa myang ba'i mtshan nyid de 'dzin par byed pas ro 'dzin pa'o //
translated: since she takes hold of it.

original: gdol ma ma ni cang te'u brdung //
analyzed: gdol ma ma ni cang te'u brdung //
translated: Caṇḍālī beats the drum.

original: 'di rnams kyis gtso bo mchod //🔽g-yung mos sku la 'khyud pa nyid //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis gtso bo mchod // g-yung mos sku la 'khyud pa nyid //
translated: These worship the principal one.🔽The low-caste woman embraces the body.

original: ces pa ni phrag pa nas 'khyud pa ji ltar gyur pa de ltar g-yung mo des mchod do //
analyzed: ces pa ni phrag pa nas 'khyud pa ji ltar gyur pa de ltar g-yung mo des mchod do //
translated: The low-caste woman worships in the manner of embracing from the shoulder.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽'dod chags chen pos rjes chags pa //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'dod chags chen pos rjes chags pa //
translated: How so?

original: zhes pa ste /🔽'dod chags @38a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ste / 'dod chags @38a * //
translated: With great passion, she is passionately attached.

original: chen po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Great passion is the Vajra Holder.

original: de'i rjes su chags pa ni he ru ka bzhi po 'dis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rjes su chags pa ni he ru ka bzhi po 'dis kyang ngo //
translated: The four Herukas are the subsequent passion.

original: 'dis ni mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches the dakini mandala.

original: yang na nam mkhar rje btsun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang na nam mkhar rje btsun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Or else, “in the sky, the Venerable One” and so forth.

original: nam mkha' ni chos 'byung yi ge ae'i cha byad do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni chos 'byung yi ge ae'i cha byad do //
translated: The sky is the source of phenomena, the form of the letter E.

original: rje btsun ni byang chub kyi sems yi ge wam gyi cha byad do //
analyzed: rje btsun ni byang chub kyi sems yi ge wam gyi cha byad do //
translated: The Venerable One is the thought of awakening, the form of the letter VAM.

original: bltas nas zhes pa ni ye shes mthong ba de'i rang bzhin du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bltas nas zhes pa ni ye shes mthong ba de'i rang bzhin du byas pa'o //
translated: “Gazing” means that the vision of pristine awareness is made into its nature.

original: rdo rje skye ba ni gnyis ka tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis skye ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje skye ba ni gnyis ka tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis skye ba'o //
translated: “Born from the vajra” is the birth by the method of non-difference of the two.

original: snying rje che ni rnam pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: snying rje che ni rnam pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “Great compassion” is the nature of all aspects.

original: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod // ces pa ni /
translated: The eight goddesses make offerings.

original: lha mo brgyad kyi skur bskyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad kyi skur bskyed par bya ba'o //
translated: The eight goddesses are to be generated in the body.

original: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa yis //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa yis //
translated: Holding all ornaments

original: zhes pa ni 'khor lo dang rna cha la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyan 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khor lo dang rna cha la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyan 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the wheel, earrings, and so forth are the ornaments of the pure Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa de rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyang 'di dang 'dra ba kho nas gnyi ga mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa de rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyang 'di dang 'dra ba kho nas gnyi ga mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The purity of the Tathagata is the same as that of the Lord, and both are the same.

original: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
analyzed: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
translated: The white one holds the deer and sign.

original: zhes pa ni dkar mo gzugs rdo rje me long lta bu ye shes kyi rang bzhin sku rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkar mo gzugs rdo rje me long lta bu ye shes kyi rang bzhin sku rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: The white one, Rupavajra, is the nature of mirror-like wisdom, and holds the body vajra.

original: chom rkun ma ni nyi ma'i snod //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: chom rkun ma ni nyi ma'i snod // ces pa ni /
translated: The thief holds the sun vessel.

original: chom rkun ma ni sgra rdo rje ma n'a da mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: chom rkun ma ni sgra rdo rje ma n'a da mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: The thief, Shabdavajra, is the nature of the wisdom of equality, and is the speech vajra.

original: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
translated: The zombie holds the water hand.

original: zhes pa ni ro langs ma ni dri rdo rje ma thugs te n'a da la zhon pa'i phyir de yang sa bon so sor rtog pa'i ye shes thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ro langs ma ni dri rdo rje ma thugs te n'a da la zhon pa'i phyir de yang sa bon so sor rtog pa'i ye shes thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: The zombie, Gandhavajra, is the mind, and since it rides on nada, it is also the mind vajra, the wisdom of discerning the individual seeds.

original: ghas ma r'i ni sman 'dzin cing //
analyzed: ghas ma r'i ni sman 'dzin cing //
translated: Ghasmarī holds the medicine.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i phyir bdud rtsi lnga'i sman bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i phyir bdud rtsi lnga'i sman bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: Since the three vajras are non-different, the medicine of the five nectars is the wisdom of perseverance.🔽Pukkasi is the vajra hand.

original: pu kka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag / ces pa ni pukka s'i sa'i khams su grags pa sku rdo rje yang rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa de bas na rdo rje lag ste chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: pu kka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag / ces pa ni pukka s'i sa'i khams su grags pa sku rdo rje yang rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa de bas na rdo rje lag ste chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Since the earth element of Pukkasi is renowned as the vajra body, the three vajras are non-different. Therefore, the vajra hand is the wisdom of the utterly pure realm of phenomena.

original: de bzhin ri khrod ma ro 'dzin //
analyzed: de bzhin ri khrod ma ro 'dzin //
translated: Likewise, Caurī holds blood.

original: zhes bya ba ni ri khrod ma chu'i khams byang chub kyi sems me long la sogs pa'i ye shes tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ri khrod ma chu'i khams byang chub kyi sems me long la sogs pa'i ye shes tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Caurī is the water element, bodhicitta, and the non-different mirror-like wisdom.

original: ro 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems lhan cig pa'i ye shes dang tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ro 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems lhan cig pa'i ye shes dang tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Holding blood” means that the wisdom that accompanies bodhicitta is non-different.

original: gdol ba mo ni me'i khams ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: gdol ba mo ni me'i khams ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: Caṇḍālī is the fire element, Nairātmya.

original: de yang cang te'u ni gzhom du med pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de yang cang te'u ni gzhom du med pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Moreover, her hand drum is the sound of the indestructible.

original: brdung ba ni n'a da dang tha mi dad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: brdung ba ni n'a da dang tha mi dad par bya ba ste /
translated: The beating is the act of making it non-different from the nada.

original: cha @38b med par bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //🔽'di rnams kyis ni gtso bo mchod //
analyzed: cha @38b med par bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'i don to // 'di rnams kyis ni gtso bo mchod //
translated: The meaning is that it is to be generated without parts.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: These are the offerings to the principal deity.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di'i bdag nyid yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di'i bdag nyid yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this Bhagavat is of that nature.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: gsungs pa / 'dod chags chen pos rje chags las //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'dod chags chen pos rje chags las //
translated: It is said: From great passion, the embrace,

original: g-yung mos sku la 'khyud pa nyid //
analyzed: g-yung mos sku la 'khyud pa nyid //
translated: the embrace of the body by the yogini.

original: ces pa la g-yung mo ni rlung a'a li k'a li'i n'a da tshar gnyis so //
analyzed: ces pa la g-yung mo ni rlung a'a li k'a li'i n'a da tshar gnyis so //
translated: The yogini is the two series of the air and the nada of ali and kali.

original: des sku las 'khyud pa ni thugs rdo rje de la zhon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sku las 'khyud pa ni thugs rdo rje de la zhon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The embrace of the body is because the mind-vajra rides on that.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽'dod chags chen pos rjes chags las //🔽zhes pa ste 'dod chags chen po ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'dod chags chen pos rjes chags las // zhes pa ste 'dod chags chen po ni /
translated: How is that?🔽It is said: From great passion, the embrace.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //🔽de'i rjes su chags pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'o // de'i rjes su chags pa ni /
translated: Great passion is the vajra-holder.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The embrace is because of the adherence to that.

original: de yang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa ste /
translated: And that is the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis kyi sku med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis kyi sku med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two garlands of vowels and consonants do not occur without the body.

original: de yang thugs med na mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang thugs med na mi 'byung ngo //
translated: And that does not occur without the mind.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
analyzed: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
translated: The vowels are the moon, the consonants the sun.

original: sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
analyzed: sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
translated: The seed is within.

original: zhes pa ste a'a li zla ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ste a'a li zla ba zhes pa ni /
translated: The vowels are the moon.

original: yi ge aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs bco lnga rnams zla ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs bco lnga rnams zla ba'o //
translated: The fifteen vowels beginning with a are the moon.🔽The consonants are the sun.

original: k'a li nyi zhes pa ni yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: k'a li nyi zhes pa ni yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bzhi rnams so //
translated: The thirty-four consonants beginning with ka are the sun.🔽The seed is within.

original: 'di dag nang du son pa ni sa bon nang du song gyur ba'o //🔽yang na / sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di dag nang du son pa ni sa bon nang du song gyur ba'o // yang na / sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
translated: The seed is within.

original: zhes pa ni n'a da gnyis tha mi dad pa gang sa bon nang du son gyur pa ye shes su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni n'a da gnyis tha mi dad pa gang sa bon nang du son gyur pa ye shes su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The two garlands are not different. The seed within is the gnosis.

original: de nyid rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: That is Vajradhara.

original: ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /🔽sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa / sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //
translated: How so? It is stated:

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
translated: The hero is the oneness of the three existences.

original: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i ye shes de yang sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi srid pa gsum la /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i ye shes de yang sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin gyi srid pa gsum la /
translated: That pristine consciousness, which is the inseparability of method and wisdom, is the three existences of the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: de'i gcig pa nyid ni sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de'i gcig pa nyid ni sems dpa'o //
translated: The “one” of that is the sattva.

original: de yang mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes kyi rar bzhin rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes kyi rar bzhin rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Further, the one who has the nature of supreme joy is Vajradhara, the meaning of the term “coemergent pristine consciousness.”

original: da ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the inseparability of the pristine consciousness maṇḍala and the samaya maṇḍala,🔽it is said:

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab par ni //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab par ni //
translated: The maṇḍala of the sky is pervaded

original: rang gi lus mtshungs rnam par spro //🔽zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi lus mtshungs rnam par spro // zhes pa smos te /
translated: by the emanation of one’s own body.🔽“Emanation”

original: rnam par spro zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rnam par spro zhes pa ni //
translated: means

original: zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam par bsgom //
translated: the meditation on the nature of anger.

original: zhes gang bstan pa de ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: zhes gang bstan pa de ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: That which is explained is the pristine consciousness maṇḍala.

original: rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //
analyzed: rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //
translated: The vajra birth, great compassion,

original: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad po rnams kyis mchod //
translated: and the eight goddesses are the offerings.

original: ces gang bstan pa de ni dam tshig gi dkyil @39a * //
analyzed: ces gang bstan pa de ni dam tshig gi dkyil @39a * //
translated: That which is explained is the samaya maṇḍala.

original: 'khor ro // dkyil 'khor de gnyi ga yang tha mi dad par /
analyzed: 'khor ro // dkyil 'khor de gnyi ga yang tha mi dad par /
translated: The wheel of the mandala is the wheel of the mandala of the retinue.🔽The wheel of the mandala is the wheel of the mandala of the retinue.

original: a'a li zla ba k'i li nyi //
analyzed: a'a li zla ba k'i li nyi //
translated: Both of those mandalas are not different.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan ma thag pa gang de nyid kyis gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan ma thag pa gang de nyid kyis gsal bar byed do //
translated: The just-mentioned “ĀLI is the moon, KĀLI is the sun,” and so forth, clarify that.

original: rang gi lus mtshungs rnam par spro //
analyzed: rang gi lus mtshungs rnam par spro //
translated: One should emanate the body that is similar to one’s own.

original: zhes pa ni rang gi lus ni gnyug ma'i lus te ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi lus ni gnyug ma'i lus te ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: One’s own body is the innate body, the body of pristine consciousness.

original: de dang mtshungs pa ni 'od zer rnams gzugs sna tshogs kyi rnam par spros pas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa ni 'od zer rnams gzugs sna tshogs kyi rnam par spros pas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi skur 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is similar to that is the light rays that are emanated in the form of various forms, becoming the bodies of the mandala of the pledge beings.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab par ni //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab par ni //
translated: One should pervade the mandala of the sky.

original: zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin de rnams ni nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor du yang mi shong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi rang bzhin de rnams ni nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor du yang mi shong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The nature of the three realms is not contained in the mandala of the sky.

original: bsdus nas snying gar dgug pa ni //
analyzed: bsdus nas snying gar dgug pa ni //
translated: Having gathered, one should summon into one’s heart.

original: yo gi zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: yo gi zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
translated: One should become the nature of the yogin’s anger.

original: zhes pa la de rnams 'dus te gcig tu gyur nas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi thugs kar zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: zhes pa la de rnams 'dus te gcig tu gyur nas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi thugs kar zhugs par gyur to //
translated: Having gathered together and become one, they enter into the heart of the gnosis mandala.

original: de nyid yo gi zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur te dkyil 'khor gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yo gi zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur te dkyil 'khor gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: That very one becomes the nature of the yoga’s anger, and is the vajra holder of the inseparability of the two mandalas.

original: 'dis ci bstan na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan na /
translated: What is taught by this?

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bden pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bden pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān is the nature of the two truths.

original: bcom ldan 'das de yang cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
translated: By what is that Bhagavān distinguished?

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:🔽The color of blue and the dawn,

original: sngo dang skye rangs mtshungs pa'i mdog / ces pa la sngo dang skya rengs mtshungs ni shin tu gnag po'o  zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngo dang skye rangs mtshungs pa'i mdog / ces pa la sngo dang skya rengs mtshungs ni shin tu gnag po'o  zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Blue and the dawn” means very dark.

original: bandu dmar po'i spyan dang ldan //
analyzed: bandu dmar po'i spyan dang ldan //
translated: Having eyes like red bandhuka flowers,

original: zhes pa ni me tog bandu ka dang 'dra bar spyan dmar po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni me tog bandu ka dang 'dra bar spyan dmar po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: means having eyes red like bandhuka flowers.🔽Hair yellow, upward swirling, and eyelashes

original: skra ser gyen 'khyil rdzi ma dang // zhes pa ni ser po ni kham pa'o //
analyzed: skra ser gyen 'khyil rdzi ma dang // zhes pa ni ser po ni kham pa'o //
translated: means yellow is tawny.

original: gyen 'khyil ni 'greng ba'o //
analyzed: gyen 'khyil ni 'greng ba'o //
translated: Upward swirling is standing.

original: skra ni dbu skra'o //
analyzed: skra ni dbu skra'o //
translated: Hair is head hair.

original: rdzi ma ni rdzi ma ste gang la rdzi ma yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rdzi ma ni rdzi ma ste gang la rdzi ma yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Eyebrows are eyebrows, and one who has eyebrows is so-called.

original: phyag rgya lngas ni rnam par brgyan ni phyag rgya 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya lngas ni rnam par brgyan ni phyag rgya 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa yin pa'o //
translated: Adorned with the five symbolic ornaments means that these symbols are the purities of the Tathagata.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated:🔽The wheel, earrings, necklace,

original: 'khor lo rna cha mgul gdub dang // lag gdub dang ni skye rags nyid //
analyzed: 'khor lo rna cha mgul gdub dang // lag gdub dang ni skye rags nyid //
translated: armlets, and belt

original: sangs rgyas lnga ni rnam dag pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga ni rnam dag pa //
translated: are the purities of the five Buddhas.

original: 'di rnams phyag rgyar rab tu grags //
analyzed: 'di rnams phyag rgyar rab tu grags //
translated: These are well known as the symbolic ornaments.

original: zhes pa'o // yang cis khyad par du 'phags she na /🔽sdang mig ces pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yang cis khyad par du 'phags she na / sdang mig ces pa ste /
translated: How is he superior?🔽With a wrathful gaze,

original: sdang mig gdug pa'i gdul bya la'o //
analyzed: sdang mig gdug pa'i gdul bya la'o //
translated: he has a wrathful gaze for wrathful disciples.

original: brgyad gnyis lo'i tshul zhes pa ni lha thams cad kyi snying po'i tshul lo //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis lo'i tshul zhes pa ni lha thams cad kyi snying po'i tshul lo //
translated: The manner of the sixteen years is the manner of the essence of all deities.

original: 'di'i mtshan ma ni /🔽g-yon na rdo rje thod pa dang // zhes pa g-yon ni phyag @39b g-yon no //
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan ma ni / g-yon na rdo rje thod pa dang // zhes pa g-yon ni phyag @39b g-yon no //
translated: His symbols are:🔽The vajra and skull-cup in the left🔽hand. The left is the left hand.

original: rdo rje thod pa ni rdo rjes mtshan pa'i thod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thod pa ni rdo rjes mtshan pa'i thod pa'o //
translated: The vajra and skull-cup is the skull-cup marked with a vajra.

original: g-yon pa nas kyang kha tv'am ga / zhes pa ni g-yon pa'i 'gram du kha tv'am ga'o //🔽g-yas na rdo rje nag po nyid //
analyzed: g-yon pa nas kyang kha tv'am ga / zhes pa ni g-yon pa'i 'gram du kha tv'am ga'o // g-yas na rdo rje nag po nyid //
translated: The khaṭvāṅga is in the left armpit.🔽On the right, a black vajra.

original: ces pa ni phyag g-yas na rdo rje nag po'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni phyag g-yas na rdo rje nag po'o //
