translated: The black vajra is in the right hand.

original: rdo rje de ji lta bu zhig yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje de ji lta bu zhig yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: What is that vajra like?

original: h'um gi yi ge 'don pa'i mchog /
analyzed: h'um gi yi ge 'don pa'i mchog /
translated: It is the supreme syllable hūṃ.

original: ces pa ste yi ge h'um gi sgra sgrogs pa yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ste yi ge h'um gi sgra sgrogs pa yin pa'i don to //
translated: It is the sound of the syllable hūṃ.

original: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor nas /
translated: Surrounded by the eight yoginīs,

original: dur khrod du ni mgon po rol /
analyzed: dur khrod du ni mgon po rol /
translated: the Lord plays in the charnel ground.

original: dur khrod kyi sgra'i don bye brag tu 'chad de /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sgra'i don bye brag tu 'chad de /
translated: The meaning of the word “charnel ground” is explained in detail:

original: dbugs rgyu zhes bya'i rigs pa 'dis //
analyzed: dbugs rgyu zhes bya'i rigs pa 'dis //
translated: This is the reasoning called “breathing.”

original: dur khrod ces ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: dur khrod ces ni mngon par brjod //
translated: It is called a charnel ground.

original: ces pa'o // der rol pa ni bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa'o // der rol pa ni bzhugs pa'o //
translated: “To play there” means to dwell there.

original: de yang mgon po ste 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: de yang mgon po ste 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba la 'jug pas so //
translated: And that is the Lord, because he engages in the activity of benefiting beings.

original: rnal 'byor ma brgyad ni goo r'i la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma brgyad ni goo r'i la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eight yoginīs are Gaurī and so forth.

original: yongs bskor nas zhes pa ni phyogs dang mtshams kun nas rim par bskor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs bskor nas zhes pa ni phyogs dang mtshams kun nas rim par bskor ba'o //
translated: The phrase completely surrounding means surrounding in all directions and in between.

original: 'di ni phyag gnyis pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyag gnyis pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is the generation of the two-armed [form].

original: 'di'i yang shes rab ma ni /
analyzed: 'di'i yang shes rab ma ni /
translated: Also, the wisdom-woman of this [form]

original: kha tv'am ga'i gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga'i gzugs can ma'o //
translated: is in the form of a khatvanga.

original: phyag bzhi ni /
analyzed: phyag bzhi ni /
translated: The four-armed [form]

original: yang bdud bzhi las rgyal nas rnam par dag pa ni phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang lha'i bu dang 'chi bdag ste /
analyzed: yang bdud bzhi las rgyal nas rnam par dag pa ni phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang lha'i bu dang 'chi bdag ste /
translated: is the complete purification of the four demons, which are the aggregates, the afflictions, the son of the gods, and the lord of death.

original: 'di rnams rnam par dag pas phyag bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams rnam par dag pas phyag bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four arms of complete purification.

original: gon du brjod pa'i gzugs dang sku mdog dang h'um las byung pa'o zhes pa ni yi ge h'um gi sa bon las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gon du brjod pa'i gzugs dang sku mdog dang h'um las byung pa'o zhes pa ni yi ge h'um gi sa bon las byung ba'o //
translated: The form and color as previously described, arisen from hūṃ, means arisen from the seed syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i mtshan ma yang phyag g-yon gyi dang po ni skyes pa'i thod pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma yang phyag g-yon gyi dang po ni skyes pa'i thod pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Also, the sign is the male skull-cup in the first left hand,

original: mi mgo thod pa aa las byung ba lha dang lha ma yin gyi khrag gis bkang ba'o //
analyzed: mi mgo thod pa aa las byung ba lha dang lha ma yin gyi khrag gis bkang ba'o //
translated: which is arisen from a, filled with the blood of gods and demigods.

original: g-yas kyi phyag dang po na rdo rje zhes pa ni h'um las byung ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyag dang po na rdo rje zhes pa ni h'um las byung ba'o //
translated: The first right hand holds a vajra, which is arisen from hūṃ.

original: phyag lhag ma dag gis shes rab la 'khyud pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag lhag ma dag gis shes rab la 'khyud pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The remaining hands embrace Wisdom.

original: shes rab la 'khyud pa can dang / shes rab kyis kyang 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab la 'khyud pa can dang / shes rab kyis kyang 'khyud pa'o //
translated: He has the form of embracing Wisdom, and Wisdom also embraces him.

original: de nyid shes rab rdo rje phag mo bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid shes rab rdo rje phag mo bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can no zhes pa ni /
translated: That is the Blessed One in the form of Vajravarahi, Wisdom.

original: shes rab ma bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can te de yang rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: shes rab ma bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can te de yang rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: Wisdom is the Blessed One in the form of Vajravarahi.

original: 'di ni phyag bzhi pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyag bzhi pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is the generation of the four-handed one.

original: rnal 'byor ma yang ji ltar phyag gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor pa ltar bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yang ji ltar phyag gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor pa ltar bya'o //
translated: The yoginis should also be like the mandala deities with two hands.

original: phyag drug pa yang //
analyzed: phyag drug pa yang //
translated: The six-handed one is also like that.

original: phyag drug pa zhal gsum po /
analyzed: phyag drug pa zhal gsum po /
translated: The six-handed one has three faces.

original: g-yon dmar ba zhes pa ni g-yon dmar ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon dmar ba zhes pa ni g-yon dmar ba'o //
translated: The left is red means the left face is red.

original: g-yas pa zla ba dang skya rengs lta bu zhes pa ni zhal g-yas pa dkar po'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa zla ba dang skya rengs lta bu zhes pa ni zhal g-yas pa dkar po'o //
translated: The right is like the moon and dawn means the right face is white.

original: dang po sngon po zhes pa ni zhal @40a * //
analyzed: dang po sngon po zhes pa ni zhal @40a * //
translated: The first is blue means the first face is blue.

original: dang po sngon po'o //
analyzed: dang po sngon po'o //
translated: The first is blue.

original: gcer bu gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang gzugs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gcer bu gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang gzugs zhes pa ni /
translated: Naked, the body color and form as previously stated means

original: 'dis ni ru ka gzhan rnams la stag gi pags pa'i na bza' yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ru ka gzhan rnams la stag gi pags pa'i na bza' yod pa yin no //
translated: This is the tiger-skin garment of the other Rudras.

original: phyag rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The hands are the pure perfections.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de rnam par dag pa'i phyag go //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de rnam par dag pa'i phyag go //
translated: The six perfections, beginning with generosity, are the pure hands.

original: phyag g-yon gyi dang po rtse gsum pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi dang po rtse gsum pa /
translated: The first left hand holds a trident,

original: g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje /
analyzed: g-yas kyi dang po na rdo rje /
translated: the first right hand a vajra,

original: phyag g-yon gyi gnyis pa na dril bu /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi gnyis pa na dril bu /
translated: the second left hand a bell,

original: g-yas kyi gnyis pa na gri gug / phyag lhag ma dag rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma la snyoms par 'jug pa /
analyzed: g-yas kyi gnyis pa na gri gug / phyag lhag ma dag rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma la snyoms par 'jug pa /
translated: the second right hand a curved knife, and the remaining hands are in embrace with the Vajra-Chains.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba de ltar shes rab ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba de ltar shes rab ste /
translated: Just like the Lord, so is the wisdom,🔽holding a curved knife and a skull, trampling on the corpse of the nature of the three worlds.

original: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab mas khams gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ro mnan pa'o zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi khams mnan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa 'dzin pa'i shes rab mas khams gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ro mnan pa'o zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi khams mnan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that she tramples on the nature of the realm.🔽Also:

original: yang / a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
analyzed: yang / a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
translated: The vowels are the moon, the consonants the sun.

original: sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
analyzed: sa bon nang du son gyur pa //
translated: The seed has entered within,

original: de nyid sems dpa' zhes byar mdzod //
analyzed: de nyid sems dpa' zhes byar mdzod //
translated: that is to be known as the hero.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can //
translated: It has the nature of supreme joy.🔽And,

original: zhes gang gsungs pa dang // dang po stong pa'i byang chub ste //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa dang // dang po stong pa'i byang chub ste //
translated: The first is the enlightenment of emptiness,

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: the second is the gathering of the seed,

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: the third is the perfection of the reflection,

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: the fourth is the arrangement of the syllables.🔽One should meditate.

original: bsgom par bya'o zhes pa dang de nyid /
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o zhes pa dang de nyid /
translated: And,

original: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
analyzed: dkar mo ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
translated: Pukkasi holds a deer marked with a swastika.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas //
translated: And so forth, up to🔽Pukkasi has a vajra in her hand.

original: pukka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag / ces pa'i bar gyis me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi phyag gnyis pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pukka s'i ni rdo rje'i lag / ces pa'i bar gyis me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi phyag gnyis pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the two-armed form, which is the nature of the five gnoses such as the mirror-like gnosis.

original: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
analyzed: a'a li zla ba k'a li nyi //
translated: The vowels are the moon, the consonants the sun.

original: zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dag ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dag ste /
translated: This teaches method and wisdom.

original: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
analyzed: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
translated: The moon is endowed with the mirror-like gnosis.

original: bdun pa'i bdun pa mnyam nyid ldan //
analyzed: bdun pa'i bdun pa mnyam nyid ldan //
translated: The seventh of the seventh is endowed with the gnosis of equality.

original: zhes pa gnyis ka'i ye shes te /
analyzed: zhes pa gnyis ka'i ye shes te /
translated: This is the gnosis of both.

original: mi phyed pa la stong pa nyid kyi byang chub ces brjod do //
analyzed: mi phyed pa la stong pa nyid kyi byang chub ces brjod do //
translated: That which is indivisible is called the enlightenment of emptiness.

original: 'di'i nang du son pa'i sa bon a'a li k'a li'i yi ge gang ci yang rung ba gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di'i nang du son pa'i sa bon a'a li k'a li'i yi ge gang ci yang rung ba gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes zhes brjod do //
translated: Whatever seed syllable there is in this, which is the nature of both A and Kali, is called the wisdom of discernment.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //🔽de nyid sems dpa' zhes byar brjod //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu // de nyid sems dpa' zhes byar brjod //
translated: In the second, the seed is gathered.🔽That is called the being.

original: ces pa ni de gnyi ga tha mi dad pa sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni de gnyi ga tha mi dad pa sems dpa' ste /
translated: The two are not different, and that is the being.

original: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //🔽gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so // gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: It is the wisdom of successful activity.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: In the third, the reflection is complete.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can // zhes pa ste /
translated: It has the nature of supreme joy.

original: @40b rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: @40b rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the nature of Vajradhara.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so //🔽bzhi pa la ni yi ge 'bru dgod //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes so // bzhi pa la ni yi ge 'bru dgod //
translated: It is the wisdom of the extremely pure realm of reality.

original: ces pa ni //
analyzed: ces pa ni //
translated: In the fourth, the seed syllables are arranged.

original: ri khrod gdol ma g-yung mo yang //
analyzed: ri khrod gdol ma g-yung mo yang //
translated: The outcaste woman of the charnel ground,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: the nature of body, speech, and mind,

original: zhes pa ste ji ltar sku las 'khyud nas mi phyed pa de ltar 'dod chags chen po rjes chags las //
analyzed: zhes pa ste ji ltar sku las 'khyud nas mi phyed pa de ltar 'dod chags chen po rjes chags las //
translated: As it is said, “Just as he embraces the body, so he is not divided from the great passion of the one who is passionate.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ” The meaning is that he has the nature of a vajra-holder.

original: rnam pa ra spro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa ra spro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
translated: “In various forms” and so on.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rnam par spro ba'i tshul gyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rnam par spro ba'i tshul gyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: He is generated by the method of emanating in various forms.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rang gi lus mtshungs te gnyug ma'i lus kyi 'od zer rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi lus mtshungs te gnyug ma'i lus kyi 'od zer rnams so //
translated: The light rays of his own body, that is, his natural body.

original: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
translated: How is he distinguished?

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgra ni bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor khyab pa ste nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgra ni bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: He pervades the sphere of space. The sphere of space is the sphere of Nairātmya.

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab par bya ba yang gnyis su med par spro ba yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab par bya ba yang gnyis su med par spro ba yin pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is pervaded by her, and he emanates nondually.

original: gnyis su med pa'i byang chub nyid bsdu ba de rnal 'byor bas bskyed par bya ste //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i byang chub nyid bsdu ba de rnal 'byor bas bskyed par bya ste //
translated: The yogin should generate that union of nondual enlightenment.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa tha mi dad pa nyid kyis zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur te gnyis 'dod pas na zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa tha mi dad pa nyid kyis zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur te gnyis 'dod pas na zhe sdang ngo //
translated: By the non-difference of the conventional and ultimate truths, he is of the nature of hatred, since he is the desire of the two.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi sku gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste rdzogs par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi sku gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste rdzogs par 'byung ngo //
translated: He who has that kind of nature is so-called, and he arises perfectly.

original: de lta ma yin na spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, he would not be of the nature of expansion and contraction.

original: de yang cis khyad par du phags pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: de yang cis khyad par du phags pa gsungs pa //
translated: And he is also distinguished by what?🔽It is said:

original: sngo dang skya rengs mtshungs pa'i mdog / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngo dang skya rengs mtshungs pa'i mdog / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: His color is like blue and dawn.

original: sngon po ni dkar nag go //
analyzed: sngon po ni dkar nag go //
translated: Blue is white and black.

original: skya rengs ni dmar po yin pas sngo dang skya rengs rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: skya rengs ni dmar po yin pas sngo dang skya rengs rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: Dawn is red, so blue and dawn are the three vajras.

original: de yang aa bdag med pas 'di lta bu'i tshul du gsal zhing so sor snang bar byed pas na skya rengs 'od do //
analyzed: de yang aa bdag med pas 'di lta bu'i tshul du gsal zhing so sor snang bar byed pas na skya rengs 'od do //
translated: And since he is the self of A, he is the dawn light, since he illuminates and appears individually in this way.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: kha dog gis te n'a da gnyis kyi bdag nyid nges so //
analyzed: kha dog gis te n'a da gnyis kyi bdag nyid nges so //
translated: By color, he is of the nature of the two nada.

original: bandu ka dmar spyan dang ldan //
analyzed: bandu ka dmar spyan dang ldan //
translated: He has eyes of red bandhuka flowers.

original: zhes pa la dmar po ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid de de yang kun nas snang ba sku rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa la dmar po ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid de de yang kun nas snang ba sku rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, red is the characteristic of passion, and that is the meaning of the body vajra, which is the appearance of everything.

original: bandu ka zhes pa ni 'phel bar byed pas na bandu ste n'a da gnyis ka yang gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bandu ka zhes pa ni 'phel bar byed pas na bandu ste n'a da gnyis ka yang gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Bandhuka means “to increase,” and the two nas are the speech vajra.

original: ka'i sgras ni thugs rdo rje yin pas bandu ka'o //
analyzed: ka'i sgras ni thugs rdo rje yin pas bandu ka'o //
translated: The suffix ka means the mind vajra, so it is bandhuka.

original: de ltar spyan ni ye shes te de gang la yod pa de ni de dang ldan no //
analyzed: de ltar spyan ni ye shes te de gang la yod pa de ni de dang ldan no //
translated: Thus, eyes are wisdom, and he who has that is endowed with them.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das spyan gsum pa kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das spyan gsum pa kho nar brjod do //
translated: This indicates that the Lord has three eyes.🔽His hair is tawny, upward-streaming, and curling.

original: skra ser gyen 'khyil rdzi ma dang // zhes pa la ser po ni ser skya'i phyir @41a * //
analyzed: skra ser gyen 'khyil rdzi ma dang // zhes pa la ser po ni ser skya'i phyir @41a * //
translated: Here, tawny is because of the tawny color.

original: ro ; / gyen ni gyen du phyogs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ro ; / gyen ni gyen du phyogs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Upward is because of the upward direction.

original: ser gyen 'khyil ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: ser gyen 'khyil ni nyi ma'o //
translated: Tawny and upward-streaming is the sun.🔽Hair is

original: skra zhes pa ni /
analyzed: skra zhes pa ni /
translated: Hair is as follows.🔽🔽

original: ka bde ba la de'i gtso bo ni mnga' bdag ste /
analyzed: ka bde ba la de'i gtso bo ni mnga' bdag ste /
translated: The lord of that is the master.

original: bde ba spangs na de ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi zla ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba spangs na de ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi zla ba'o //
translated: The moon is the nature of the thought of awakening.

original: de ltar zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid kyi lam gang la yod pa de ni skra ser gyen 'khyil rdzi ma'o //
analyzed: de ltar zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid kyi lam gang la yod pa de ni skra ser gyen 'khyil rdzi ma'o //
translated: Thus, the path that has the nature of the moon and sun is the upward-streaming yellow hair.🔽Therefore, the five symbolic ornaments, such as the mirror, are the nature of the five gnoses, the nature of the five transcendent lords, and the ornaments of the wheel, earrings, necklace, bracelets, and girdle, which have the nature of the five gnoses.

original: de bas na phyag rgya lnga me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin 'khor lo dang rna rgyan dang mgul gdub dang lag gdub dang ske rags kyis brgyan pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don
analyzed: de bas na phyag rgya lnga me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin 'khor lo dang rna rgyan dang mgul gdub dang lag gdub dang ske rags kyis brgyan pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don
translated: This is the meaning of “adorned with the five symbolic ornaments.”

original: to // 'di nyid gsungs pa //
analyzed: to // 'di nyid gsungs pa //
translated: This is stated:🔽The wheel, earrings, and jewels,

original: 'khor lo rna cha nor bu dang / lag gdub dang ni ske rags nyid //
analyzed: 'khor lo rna cha nor bu dang / lag gdub dang ni ske rags nyid //
translated: bracelets, and the girdle itself,

original: sangs rgyas lnga ni rnam dag pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga ni rnam dag pa //
translated: are the five buddhas in their pure form.

original: zhes pa ste thabs dang shes rab sku gsum 'byung ba chen po bzhi ye shes lnga'i rnam par dag pa rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ste thabs dang shes rab sku gsum 'byung ba chen po bzhi ye shes lnga'i rnam par dag pa rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “vajra-holder” is as follows: method and wisdom are the four great elements, which are the five pristine awarenesses.

original: de yang cis khyad par du 'phags pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang cis khyad par du 'phags pa gsungs pa /
translated: The text also states the superiority of this [vajra-holder]:

original: sdang mig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdang mig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: “With a wrathful gaze.”

original: sdang ba ni gdul bya ste /
analyzed: sdang ba ni gdul bya ste /
translated: “Wrathful” refers to the objects of discipline,

original: gdug pa'i yul dang dbang pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang yang dag pa'i rtog pa 'di rnams gdul ba yin te /
analyzed: gdug pa'i yul dang dbang pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang yang dag pa'i rtog pa 'di rnams gdul ba yin te /
translated: which are the afflictions, the secondary afflictions, and the correct assumptions that are empowered by the sense faculties of the objects of wrath.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa des na gdug pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa des na gdug pa'o //
translated: They are wrathful because they are made into the nature of the utterly pure expanse of reality.

original: mig ces pa ni lta ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mig ces pa ni lta ba'i ye shes so //
translated: “Gaze” refers to the pristine awareness of seeing.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i phyir sdang mig go //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i phyir sdang mig go //
translated: Because of being such, [the vajra-holder] has a wrathful gaze.

original: yang na sdang ba ni khro ba'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na sdang ba ni khro ba'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Alternatively, “wrathful” is the nature of the relative truth, which is the nature of anger.

original: mig ni lta ba'i ye shes don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: mig ni lta ba'i ye shes don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: “Gaze” is the pristine awareness of seeing, which is the ultimate truth.

original: de'i rang bzhin gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir sdang mig yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir sdang mig yin no //
translated: Since the nature of those two is inseparable, it is the “angry eye.”

original: brgyad gnyis lo'i tshul ni /
analyzed: brgyad gnyis lo'i tshul ni /
translated: The manner of the sixteen years:

original: brgyad gnyis ni bcu drug go //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis ni bcu drug go //
translated: “sixteen” is two times eight.

original: lo ni lo ste byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin gyis brgyad po nyis 'gyur bcu drug ste 'di'i cha byad kyi tshul gang gi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lo ni lo ste byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin gyis brgyad po nyis 'gyur bcu drug ste 'di'i cha byad kyi tshul gang gi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “Years” is years, the nature of the bodhicitta. The eight doubled is sixteen. The manner of the form of this is the nature of whatever is in whatever place.

original: 'dis ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “Vajradhara without the maṇḍala of gnosis and the maṇḍala of the pledge.”

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan ma gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan ma gsungs pa /
translated: The signs of one who has become that are stated:

original: g-yon na rdo rje thod pa dang / g-yon pa nas kyang kha tv'am ga / zhes pa ni /
analyzed: g-yon na rdo rje thod pa dang / g-yon pa nas kyang kha tv'am ga / zhes pa ni /
translated: The vajra skull cup in the left hand, and the khaṭvāṅga in the left hand,

original: phyag g-yon pa ste /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa ste /
translated: are the left hands.

original: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rang @41b bzhin a'a li'i n'a da'i rang bzhin gyi zla ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rang @41b bzhin a'a li'i n'a da'i rang bzhin gyi zla ba'o //
translated: The skull cup is the moon, the nature of the sound of āli, the nature of the bodhicitta that is the nature of the five gnoses.

original: rdo rje thod pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje thod pa ni /
translated: The vajra skull cup is

original: rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The vajra is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de yang thod pa ni /
analyzed: de yang thod pa ni /
translated: And that is the skull bowl.

original: ka ni bde ba'i ye shes te skyod par byed pas na thod pa'o //
analyzed: ka ni bde ba'i ye shes te skyod par byed pas na thod pa'o //
translated: Ka is the intuition of bliss, and since it moves, it is the skull bowl.

original: g-yon pa nas kyang kha tv'am ga zhes pa ni /
analyzed: g-yon pa nas kyang kha tv'am ga zhes pa ni /
translated: And from the left, “khaṭvāṅga” means

original: shes rab kha tv'am ga yi gzugs //
analyzed: shes rab kha tv'am ga yi gzugs //
translated: the form of the wisdom khaṭvāṅga.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: bdag med ma la sogs pa bco lnga'i mkha' 'gro ma le sogs bco lnga'i cha'i bdag nyid des g-yon pa nyid zla ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag med ma la sogs pa bco lnga'i mkha' 'gro ma le sogs bco lnga'i cha'i bdag nyid des g-yon pa nyid zla ba yin no //
translated: Since it is the nature of the fifteen parts beginning with the dakini and ending with the yogini, the left is the moon.🔽Or else,

original: yang na // g-yon pa nas kyang kha tv'am ga / zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na // g-yon pa nas kyang kha tv'am ga / zhes pa ni /
translated: “And from the left, khaṭvāṅga” means

original: kha tv'am ga ni bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga ni bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: the khaṭvāṅga has already been explained.

original: de yang g-yon pa nas ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang g-yon pa nas ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: And that, from the left, is the non-differentiation of the three vajras.

original: ba rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ba rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
translated: Va is Vairocana, the vajra of body.

original: aa ni n'a da gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: aa ni n'a da gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: A is the nada, the vajra of speech.

original: ma lnga pa bsdu ba mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje yin te mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma lnga pa bsdu ba mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje yin te mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five ma-s are gathered into Akṣobhya, the vajra of mind, because of the indivisibility.

original: g-yas na rdo rje nag po nyid //
analyzed: g-yas na rdo rje nag po nyid //
translated: On the right, the vajra is black.

original: ces pa ni g-yas ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni g-yas ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The right is the sun.

original: rdo rje nag po zhes pa ni nag pos bsrabs pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rdo rje nag po zhes pa ni nag pos bsrabs pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: The vajra is black because it is emaciated by black.

original: mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje nag po yin pas /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje nag po yin pas /
translated: Since it is indivisible, it is the black vajra.

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa dag thabs dang shes rab dag gi yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa dag thabs dang shes rab dag gi yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: The right and left are the syllables hūṃ of method and wisdom.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: yi ge las byung gong bu la //
analyzed: yi ge las byung gong bu la //
translated: The aggregate arisen from the syllable

original: h'um phat rnam pa 'dod mi bya //
analyzed: h'um phat rnam pa 'dod mi bya //
translated: is not desired to be the form of hūṃ phaṭ.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
translated: By this statement.

original: yi ge h'um nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: yi ge h'um nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi sa bon no //
translated: The syllable hūṃ itself is the seed of method and wisdom.

original: de bas na yi ge phat kyi khyad par du byed pa mi bzhed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge phat kyi khyad par du byed pa mi bzhed pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not accepted that the syllable phaṭ is a qualifier.

original: 'di gnyis tha mi dad pa gang brjod pa'i bdag nyid n'a da'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis tha mi dad pa gang brjod pa'i bdag nyid n'a da'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “the nature of the nāda that is the nature of the expression of the non-difference of these two” is this.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /🔽rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor nas /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor nas /
translated: That is stated:🔽The lord plays in the charnel ground,

original: dur khrod du ni mgon po rol //
analyzed: dur khrod du ni mgon po rol //
translated: surrounded by the eight yoginīs.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is stated:

original: dur khrod kyi sgra ni don gsal por bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis phyed de /🔽dbugs rgyu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sgra ni don gsal por bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis phyed de / dbugs rgyu zhes pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the word charnel ground is clear from the Bhagavān himself:🔽“Breath”

original: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i bdag nyid des dbugs 'byung rdub  byed pa'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li n'a da'i bdag nyid des dbugs 'byung rdub  byed pa'o //
translated: means that the nature of ālikāli causes the inhalation and exhalation of breath.

original: rigs pa 'dis gnyi ga tha mi dad pa'i rnal 'byor ni dur khrod ces mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis gnyi ga tha mi dad pa'i rnal 'byor ni dur khrod ces mngon par brjod do //
translated: By this reasoning, the yoga of the nondifferentiation of both is called “charnel ground.”

original: 'dir rol pa ni spro ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rol pa ni spro ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Here, “sport” means to remain in the manner of emanation.

original: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor nas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma brgyad yongs bskor nas //
translated: Surrounded by the eight yoginīs

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: means

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa yin no //
translated: that he remains in the manner of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: de nyid mgon po ste 'jig rten gsum gyi bla ma zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid mgon po ste 'jig rten gsum gyi bla ma zhes pa'i don to //
translated: He is the protector, the guru of the three worlds.

original: de ltar thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyag gnyis pa bstan pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyag gnyis pa bstan pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Thus, the one with two arms, who is the nondifferentiation of method and wisdom, is Vajradhara.

original: phyag bzhi pa ji ltar zhe na /🔽bdud bzhi las @42a * //
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa ji ltar zhe na / bdud bzhi las @42a * //
translated: How is he the one with four arms?

original: rnam par rgyal ba rnam par dag pa ste zhes pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba rnam par dag pa ste zhes pa la /
translated: He is pure, meaning that he is victorious over the four māras.

original: bdud bzhi la phung po'i bdud gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdud bzhi la phung po'i bdud gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The four demons are: the demon of the aggregates, which is the nature of the five aggregates of form and so on;

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni nyon mongs pa dang / yul dang dbang po rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa yin pas nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun du rtog pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni nyon mongs pa dang / yul dang dbang po rnams la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa yin pas nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun du rtog pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the demon of afflictions, which is the nature of afflictions, secondary afflictions, and conceptions, since it engages in the adherence to the apprehended and apprehender with regard to objects and faculties;

original: lha'i bu'i bdud ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud ni /
translated: the demon of the sons of the gods,

original: lha ni mdzes par rol pas na lha ste rnam par shes pa'o //🔽de'i bu ni yul dang dbang po rnams ni de bskyed pa'i phyir lha'i bu ste yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: lha ni mdzes par rol pas na lha ste rnam par shes pa'o // de'i bu ni yul dang dbang po rnams ni de bskyed pa'i phyir lha'i bu ste yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: which is the consciousness, since the gods are beautiful;

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni 'chi bdag gi gshin rje 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud ni 'chi bdag gi gshin rje 'jig pa'o //
translated: and the demon of the lord of death, which is the lord of death, Yama, the destroyer.

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par rig byed rnams kyis bskyed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par nyams su myong ba de yang yul dang dbang po dang rnam par rig byed 'gog pa'i rang bzhin yang chags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bdud nyid do //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par rig byed rnams kyis bskyed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par nyams su myong ba de yang yul dang dbang po dang rnam par rig byed 'gog pa'i rang bzhin yang chags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bdud nyid do //
translated: The experience of the aspects of pleasure, etc. generated by the objects, sense faculties, and expressions is also Māra, because it has the nature of the cessation of the objects, sense faculties, and expressions, and because it has the characteristic of attachment.

original: de ltar bdud bzhi po de rnams las rgyal bas ma lus par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdud bzhi po de rnams las rgyal bas ma lus par rgyal ba'o //
translated: Thus, he is the Victor over all four Māras.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni /
translated: His purity is

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the Vajra-Holder who transcends the characteristic of the experience of the aspects of pleasure, etc.

original: de yang gong du bstan pa'i gzugs dang sku mdog dang h'um las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gong du bstan pa'i gzugs dang sku mdog dang h'um las byung ba'o //
translated: He is also taught above as having the form, color, and origin from hūṃ.

original: phyag mtshan yang khyad par med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyag mtshan yang khyad par med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The hand implements also have the characteristic of being without distinction.

original: khyad par gsungs pa //
analyzed: khyad par gsungs pa //
translated: The distinction is stated:

original: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na skyes pa'i thod pa dang lha dang lha ma yin gyi khrag gis bkang pa zhes pa la phyag g-yon gyi dang po ni skyes pa'i thod pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na skyes pa'i thod pa dang lha dang lha ma yin gyi khrag gis bkang pa zhes pa la phyag g-yon gyi dang po ni skyes pa'i thod pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The first of the left hands is a human skull,

original: dang po ni gnyis su med pa de mkha' 'gro ma thams cad bsdu ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po ni gnyis su med pa de mkha' 'gro ma thams cad bsdu ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the first being nondual, because of the nature of the gathering of all dakinis.

original: g-yon ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon ni zla ba'o //
translated: The left is the moon.

original: de yang phyag ni dga' ba bzhi longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid nges so //
analyzed: de yang phyag ni dga' ba bzhi longs spyod pa'i bdag nyid nges so //
translated: And the hands are the nature of the enjoyment of the four joys.

original: de'i phyir thod pa ni mi'i thod pa ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thod pa ni mi'i thod pa ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Therefore, the skull is a human skull, the gnosis of the vajra holder.

original: lha dang lha ma yin gyi khrag gis bkang pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin gyi khrag gis bkang pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Filled with the blood of gods and demigods.

original: mdzes pas ni lha ste gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: mdzes pas ni lha ste gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: The gods are beautiful, the five aggregates of form and so on.

original: lha ma yin ni yul rnams so //
analyzed: lha ma yin ni yul rnams so //
translated: The demigods are the objects.

original: de rnams kyi khrag ni 'dod chags te de rnams la chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khrag ni 'dod chags te de rnams la chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Their blood is passion, characterized by attachment to them.

original: des bkang ba ni de'i bdag nyid spro ba'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: des bkang ba ni de'i bdag nyid spro ba'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The filled is the mode of the emanation of its nature, the mode of abiding.

original: dang po'i g-yas kyi phyag na rdo rje @42b zhes pa ni g-yas pa nyi ma'o //
analyzed: dang po'i g-yas kyi phyag na rdo rje @42b zhes pa ni g-yas pa nyi ma'o //
translated: The vajra in the right hand of the first is the sun in the right hand.

original: de yang phyag ste khams gsum la 'khyud pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang phyag ste khams gsum la 'khyud pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That is the hand, the nature of the embrace of the three realms.

original: dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The first is nondual.

original: de la rdo rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la rdo rje zhes pa ni /
translated: In that, the vajra is

original: mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the indivisible pristine consciousness.

original: phyag lhag ma dag gis zhes pa ni g-yas dang g-yon pa'i phyag gnyis zla ba dang nyi ma dag 'dres pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: phyag lhag ma dag gis zhes pa ni g-yas dang g-yon pa'i phyag gnyis zla ba dang nyi ma dag 'dres pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The remaining hands are the two hands, right and left, the entity of the sun and moon mixed together.

original: lhag ma nyid ni lhag mas kyang shes rab la 'khyud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma nyid ni lhag mas kyang shes rab la 'khyud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The remaining is also the remaining, because of the embrace of wisdom.

original: 'khyud pa'i phyag ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin no //
analyzed: 'khyud pa'i phyag ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin no //
translated: The embrace is the nondual pristine consciousness.

original: de gsungs pa //
analyzed: de gsungs pa //
translated: That is stated:

original: shes rab rdo rje phag mo ni //
analyzed: shes rab rdo rje phag mo ni //
translated: The wisdom is Vajravarahi,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs can no //
translated: the form of the Bhagavat.

original: zhes pa ni bdag med ma rdo rje 'dzin pa dang tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag med ma rdo rje 'dzin pa dang tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: This is the nondifference of Nairatmya and Vajradhara.

original: phyag bzhi pa dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o //🔽de ltar phyag drug pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o // de ltar phyag drug pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The four-armed one is Hevajra.🔽Thus, the six-armed one is the one with three faces, and so on.

original: phyag drug pa zhal gsum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa drug ni bsdu ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyag drug pa zhal gsum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa drug ni bsdu ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The six are the summarized forms.

original: de yang zhal gsum ni sku gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang zhal gsum ni sku gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, the three faces are the nature of the three bodies.

original: g-yon pa dmar ba zhes pa ni g-yon pa zla ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa dmar ba zhes pa ni g-yon pa zla ba'o //
translated: The left is red, the left is the moon.

original: de nyid dmar po nyi ma ste gnyi ga tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dmar po nyi ma ste gnyi ga tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: That itself is the red sun, the two are not different.

original: g-yas nyi ma ste de nyid zla ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas nyi ma ste de nyid zla ba'o //
translated: The right is the sun, that itself is the moon.

original: de yang skya rengs kyi 'od de aa bdag med ma yin la de'i tshul gyis 'dzin pas na skya rengs so //
analyzed: de yang skya rengs kyi 'od de aa bdag med ma yin la de'i tshul gyis 'dzin pas na skya rengs so //
translated: That is also the light of dawn, that is Nairātmya, and by the method of that, it is dawn.

original: 'dis kun du snang zhing so sor gsal bar byed pas na skya rengs so //
analyzed: 'dis kun du snang zhing so sor gsal bar byed pas na skya rengs so //
translated: This illuminates everywhere and makes each thing clear, therefore it is dawn.

original: de yang dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the first is nondual.

original: de nyid sngon po ste dkar po dang nag po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid sngon po ste dkar po dang nag po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That itself is blue, the nature of white and black.

original: de nyid gcer bu ste sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid gcer bu ste sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That itself is naked, the nature of unobstructedness.

original: gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang gzugs zhes pa ni yi ge h'um gi rang bzhin nyid bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gong du brjod pa'i sku mdog dang gzugs zhes pa ni yi ge h'um gi rang bzhin nyid bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the above statement “the color and form” is that the Bhagavān is the very nature of the syllable hūṃ.

original: phyag rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa ni phyag rnams ni bsdu ba'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa ni phyag rnams ni bsdu ba'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The hands are the purity of the perfections. The hands are the purity of the aggregates.

original: gang zhe na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: gang zhe na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: What are they? They are the six perfections of generosity and so forth.

original: 'dis ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the Bhagavān has the nature of expansion and contraction.

original: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na rtsa gsum pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi dang po na rtsa gsum pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The first of the left hands holds the triple staff.

original: g-yon pa ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni zla ba'o //
translated: The left is the moon.

original: phyag ni nyi ma ste 'khyud nas longs spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag ni nyi ma ste 'khyud nas longs spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The hand is the sun, because it embraces and enjoys.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang dang po ste /
translated: These two are the first.

original: gnyis med pas g-yon gyi phyag dang po'o //
analyzed: gnyis med pas g-yon gyi phyag dang po'o //
translated: They are nondual, so they are the first of the left hands.

original: de'i phyir rtse gsum ni rdo rje gsum te sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtse gsum ni rdo rje gsum te sku gsung thugs so //
translated: Therefore, the triple point is the three vajras, which are the body, speech, and mind.

original: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na zhes pa la g-yas ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyi dang po na zhes pa la g-yas ni nyi ma'o //
translated: In the first right hand means in the right hand which is the sun.

original: @43a * // phyag ni bshad zin pa'i don to //
analyzed: @43a * // phyag ni bshad zin pa'i don to //
translated: Hand means as previously explained.

original: dang por rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang la /
analyzed: dang por rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang la /
translated: First, Vairocana is the nature of the conventional truth, the characteristic of the universal illumination of the vajra body of Vajradhara.

original: nyi ma yang bdag med ma yin pas g-yas kyi phyag dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma yang bdag med ma yin pas g-yas kyi phyag dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The sun is also Nairātmya, so the right hand and the conventional and ultimate are not different.

original: rdo rje ni sku rdo rje ste dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni sku rdo rje ste dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The vajra is the vajra body, the indivisible gnosis.

original: phyag g-yon gyi gnyis pa na dril bu zhes pa ni g-yon pa zla ba'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon gyi gnyis pa na dril bu zhes pa ni g-yon pa zla ba'o //
translated: In the second left hand is a bell means in the left hand which is the moon.

original: gnyis pa rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: gnyis pa rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The second is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: de yang bsdu ba'i rnam pas phyag go //
analyzed: de yang bsdu ba'i rnam pas phyag go //
translated: That is also a hand by the aspect of gathering.

original: de la dril bu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la dril bu zhes pa ni /
translated: There, a bell means

original: de la a'a li k'a li gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi gsung rdo rje mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la a'a li k'a li gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi gsung rdo rje mi phyed pa'o //
translated: there, the indivisible speech vajra of the nature of both the vowels and consonants.

original: phyag g-yas kyi gnyis pa na gri gug ces pa la g-yas ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas kyi gnyis pa na gri gug ces pa la g-yas ni nyi ma'o //
translated: In the second right hand is a flaying knife means in the right hand which is the sun.

original: de'i gnyis pa ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyis pa ni zla ba'o //
translated: The second of those is the moon.

original: de ltar g-yas gnyis pa'i phyag de dag 'dres pa'i dngos po gri gug ste mi shes pa thams cad gcod pas thugs rdo rje dang dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de ltar g-yas gnyis pa'i phyag de dag 'dres pa'i dngos po gri gug ste mi shes pa thams cad gcod pas thugs rdo rje dang dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Thus, those two right hands are mixed things, a flaying knife, because it cuts all ignorance, and wisdom, because it is inseparable from the mind vajra.

original: phyag lhag ma dag gis rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa la lhag ma ni ma lus par rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa ste lhag ma nyid do //
analyzed: phyag lhag ma dag gis rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa la lhag ma ni ma lus par rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa ste lhag ma nyid do //
translated: The remaining hands are in union with the vajra chain. The remaining hands are the innate nature of the inseparable three vajras in their entirety.

original: de dag gis ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa gang yin pas lhag ma phyag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa gang yin pas lhag ma phyag gnyis pa'o //
translated: Since there is no difference between method and wisdom, the remaining two hands are in union.

original: de la rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma la snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma'i sgra'i rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: de la rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma la snyoms par 'jug pa ni rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma'i sgra'i rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: In that regard, the union with the vajra chain is Vajradhara, the sound of the vajra chain.

original: de la lu gu rgyud kyi rang bzhin gyis phan tshun tha mi dad par 'ching bas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de la lu gu rgyud kyi rang bzhin gyis phan tshun tha mi dad par 'ching bas rdo rje'o //
translated: In that regard, it is a vajra because it is bound by the nature of the chain, which is mutually inseparable.

original: lu gu rgyud de bdag med ma de dang lhan cig snyoms par 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: lu gu rgyud de bdag med ma de dang lhan cig snyoms par 'jug pa ni /
translated: The union with that chain is the union with that Nairātmya.

original: mtshungs par tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du 'jug pa yang dag pa'i ye shes te rgyu de'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du 'jug pa yang dag pa'i ye shes te rgyu de'i phyir na'o //
translated: The wisdom that engages in the nature of non-difference is the correct wisdom. For that reason.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba de ltar shes rab ste /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba de ltar shes rab ste /
translated: That itself is the Bhagavat, and that is the wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab dag cung zad dbyer med pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dag cung zad dbyer med pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that method and wisdom are inseparable.

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The flaying knife and skull-cup in the right and left hands

original: g-yas pa ni nyi ma cha med pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa ni nyi ma cha med pa'o //
translated: The right is the sun without a part.

original: g-yon ni zla ba cha dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon ni zla ba cha dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The left is the moon with a part.

original: cha med pa de nyid cha dang bcas te rgyu de'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: cha med pa de nyid cha dang bcas te rgyu de'i phyir na'o //
translated: That partless [moon] itself has a part. For that reason.

original: gri gug dang thod pa ni gri gug bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: gri gug dang thod pa ni gri gug bdag med ma'o //
translated: The flaying knife is Nairātmya.

original: thod pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: thod pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The skull-cup is Vajradhara.

original: gnyi ga tha mi dad pas na gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: gnyi ga tha mi dad pas na gcig gi tshig go //
translated: Since both are non-different, there is the word “one.”

original: de nyid khams gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ro mnan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid khams gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ro mnan pa'o //
translated: That itself is the supine corpse, which is the nature of the three realms.

original: zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi sgras ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi sgras ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The three realms are the three vajras.

original: de'i bdag nyid can de ni @43b de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can de ni @43b de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of that.

original: ro ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ro ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Taste is the nature of all phenomena.

original: mnan pa ni khyab par byed pa gcig pa'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: mnan pa ni khyab par byed pa gcig pa'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas pa'i don to //
translated: Pressing down means abiding in the manner of a single pervader.

original: lha'i le'u gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i le'u gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The third chapter is called “The Chapter on the Gods.”

original: gang phyir lus su byung bas na //
analyzed: gang phyir lus su byung bas na //
translated: Because it arises in the body,

original: lha zhes bya bar mngon par brjod //
analyzed: lha zhes bya bar mngon par brjod //
translated: it is called “the god.”

original: ces pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ces pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: lha ni n'a da zhon pa'i thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lha ni n'a da zhon pa'i thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: The god is the mind vajra mounted on the nāḍī.

original: de yang gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, clothing is covering.

original: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na lha'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na lha'i le'u'o //
translated: Since it takes up and holds that, it is the chapter on the gods.

original: de yang gsum pa ni gsum po rnams rdzogs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams mdog dang phyag dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de yang gsum pa ni gsum po rnams rdzogs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams mdog dang phyag dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa sku rdo rje'o //
translated: Moreover, the third is the form of the body, speech, and mind that are complete, with color, hands, and shape, which is the body vajra.

original: de yang sa bon las byung ba yin pas sngags kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sa bon las byung ba yin pas sngags kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: Moreover, since that arises from the seed, it is the form of the mantra.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: The fourth is the placement of the syllables.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: ye shes kyi rnam pa nyid du gyur pa yin pas rim par phye ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can nyid 'di rim par phye ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rnam pa nyid du gyur pa yin pas rim par phye ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can nyid 'di rim par phye ba gsum pa'o //
translated: Since it is the aspect of pristine consciousness itself, this one with the nature of the three divisions is the third division.

original: rnam par shes las n'a da 'byung //
analyzed: rnam par shes las n'a da 'byung //
translated: The nāda arises from consciousness.

original: n'a da las ni sku 'byung ste //
analyzed: n'a da las ni sku 'byung ste //
translated: The kāya arises from the nāda.🔽Thus the kāya and the nāda

original: de ltar sku dang n'a da dag / rnam par shes dang gnyis med gsum //
analyzed: de ltar sku dang n'a da dag / rnam par shes dang gnyis med gsum //
translated: are the three nondualities of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pas n'a da bskyed //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas n'a da bskyed //
translated: Consciousness generates the nāda.

original: des kyang sku ni rnam par sprul //
analyzed: des kyang sku ni rnam par sprul //
translated: It also emanates the kāya.

original: gnyi ga sprul par 'grub pa na'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga sprul par 'grub pa na'o //
translated: The two are emanations.

original: rnam par shes pa su yis sprul //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa su yis sprul //
translated: By whom is consciousness emanated?

original: rnam par shes pa 'od gsal phyir //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'od gsal phyir //
translated: Since consciousness is clear light,

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes //
translated: it is not produced by nature.

original: de yis kyang ni bskyed pa gang //
analyzed: de yis kyang ni bskyed pa gang //
translated: What is produced by that?

original: de la skyes zhes ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: de la skyes zhes ji ltar brjod //
translated: How can it be called produced?

original: de phyir n'a da dang ni sku //🔽gnyis po 'di ni bskyed pa med //
analyzed: de phyir n'a da dang ni sku // gnyis po 'di ni bskyed pa med //
translated: Therefore the nāda and the kāya🔽are both unproduced.

original: gnyi ga ma skyes par grub pas //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma skyes par grub pas //
translated: Since both are established as unproduced,

original: ma skyes pa ni bden par brjod //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni bden par brjod //
translated: nonproduction is said to be true.

original: de ltar 'gro kun ma skyes pa //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro kun ma skyes pa //
translated: Thus all migrating beings are unproduced.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis 'od gsal lo //
translated: He is naturally luminous.

original: ma rig gdung ba'i sems kyis ni //
analyzed: ma rig gdung ba'i sems kyis ni //
translated: By the mind tormented by ignorance,

original: bskyed pa ru ni yongs su btags //
analyzed: bskyed pa ru ni yongs su btags //
translated: he is designated as “produced.”

original: de nyid rnam par dag phyir 'di //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag phyir 'di //
translated: But because of his purity,

original: gtso bo chen po thugs rjes bzhugs //
analyzed: gtso bo chen po thugs rjes bzhugs //
translated: the Great Lord abides with compassion.

original: dgyes rdor gnyis su dbyer med pa //
analyzed: dgyes rdor gnyis su dbyer med pa //
translated: He is Hevajra, nondual,

original: dag pa la ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: dag pa la ni bstan pa yin //
translated: taught in the pure (tantras).

original: de lta bas na thugs kyi rnam par dag pa nag po chen po /
analyzed: de lta bas na thugs kyi rnam par dag pa nag po chen po /
translated: Therefore, the purity of the mind is Mahakala,

original: phyag gnyis pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can shes rab ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can shes rab ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: the two-armed one, the nature of the five intuitions, free from the wisdom woman.

original: phyag bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa ni /
translated: The four-armed one

original: sngon po dang / dkar po dang / gnag pa'i phyir thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sngon po dang / dkar po dang / gnag pa'i phyir thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa nyid do //
translated: is the indivisibility of means and intuition, because of being blue, white, and black.

original: phyag drug pa ni sngo dang skya rengs te /
analyzed: phyag drug pa ni sngo dang skya rengs te /
translated: The six-armed one is blue and dawn,🔽because blue is white and black,

original: sngon po ni dkar zhing gnag po'o //🔽skya rengs ni dmar ba'i phyir rdo rje gsum tha @44a * //
analyzed: sngon po ni dkar zhing gnag po'o // skya rengs ni dmar ba'i phyir rdo rje gsum tha @44a * //
translated: and dawn is red.

original: mi dad pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyis phyag drug pa'o //
analyzed: mi dad pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyis phyag drug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by means of the indivisibility of means and intuition, he is six-armed.

original: phyag bcu drug pa ni /
analyzed: phyag bcu drug pa ni /
translated: The sixteen-armed one🔽is the indivisibility of the three intuitions, because of being blue, white, red, black, and yellow.

original: gnag pa dang / dmar ba dang / dkar ba'i zhal gsum gyis rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: gnag pa dang / dmar ba dang / dkar ba'i zhal gsum gyis rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The three faces, black, red, and white, are the three vajras.

original: 'dres pa rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The mixed faces are the three vajras inseparable.

original: lhag ma'i zhal ni bung ba mtshungs //
analyzed: lhag ma'i zhal ni bung ba mtshungs //
translated: The remaining faces are like bees.

original: zhes pa ni dga' ba bzhi'i dbye bas zhal brgyad do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dga' ba bzhi'i dbye bas zhal brgyad do //
translated: The eight faces are the division of the four joys.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rnam par dag pas phyag bcu drug pa yin te /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rnam par dag pas phyag bcu drug pa yin te /
translated: The sixteen arms are the purity of method and wisdom.

original: phyag gnyis pa dang / phyag bzhi pa dang / phyag drug pa dang / phyag bcu drug pa he ru ka bzhi po 'di bla ma las kyang bla mar ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa dang / phyag bzhi pa dang / phyag drug pa dang / phyag bcu drug pa he ru ka bzhi po 'di bla ma las kyang bla mar ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dbyer med par blta bar bya'o //
translated: These four herukas with two arms, four arms, six arms, and sixteen arms should be seen as the indivisibility of the wisdom mandala and the commitment mandala, even higher than the guru.

original: rim par phye ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rim par phye ba gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third chapter.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra

original: rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor las lha'i rim par phye ba ste le'u gsum pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor las lha'i rim par phye ba ste le'u gsum pa'o /
translated: The third chapter of the Padmini, the chapter on the deities.

original: // / de ltar rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa'i rim par phye ba gsum gyi rdo rje gsum bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa'i rim par phye ba gsum gyi rdo rje gsum bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the three vajras of the three divisions of the vajra family and so forth,🔽now, in order to explain the fourth division, the consecration, which is the indivisibility of those,

original: da ni de rnams dbyer med pa bzhi pa dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni de rnams dbyer med pa bzhi pa dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'i bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: it is said:

original: kun nas dbang bas dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas dbang bas dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: Consecration is the consecration of the all-pervading.

original: dri ma med par byed cing sgrib pa med par rnam par dag pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dri ma med par byed cing sgrib pa med par rnam par dag pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said to be stainless, free from obscurations, and pure.

original: lha zhes bya bas dbang bskur bas na lha dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: lha zhes bya bas dbang bskur bas na lha dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: Since the deity is consecrated, it is the consecration of the deity.

original: de yang gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
translated: Cloth is covering.

original: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na lha dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na lha dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o //
translated: Since it takes and holds that, it is the division of the consecration of the deity.

original: de bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: That will be explained is what is to be shown.

original: rang gi snying gar rang gi sa bon las 'od zer nag po lcags kyu'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis phyung nas des khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs nas ma mo brgyad kyis yang dag par mchod nas rjes su gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes
analyzed: rang gi snying gar rang gi sa bon las 'od zer nag po lcags kyu'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis phyung nas des khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs nas ma mo brgyad kyis yang dag par mchod nas rjes su gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes
translated: Having drawn forth from one's heart center a black light ray in the form of a hook, one invites all the Buddhas residing in the three realms, and having made offerings to the eight Mothers, one should make a request.

original: pa la rang gi snying gar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pa la rang gi snying gar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for in one's heart center,

original: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor tha mi dad pa'i lha'i thugs kar ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor tha mi dad pa'i lha'i thugs kar ro //
translated: it is in the heart center of the deity who is not different from the mandala of gnosis and the mandala of commitment.

original: rang gi sa bon ni yi ge h'um gi sa bon no //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon ni yi ge h'um gi sa bon no //
translated: One's seed syllable is the seed syllable of the letter hūṃ.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje de'i lte ba'i nang las so //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje de'i lte ba'i nang las so //
translated: From its complete transformation, a vajra arises.

original: 'od zer nag po'i lcags kyu phyung nas zhes pa ni spros nas so //
analyzed: 'od zer nag po'i lcags kyu phyung nas zhes pa ni spros nas so //
translated: Having drawn forth a black light ray in the form of a hook, one should emanate it.

original: lcags kyu'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lcags kyu'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa ni /
translated: In the form of a hook means

original: mtshon @44b par bya ba rnams mdzub mo lta bus mtshon par byed pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mtshon @44b par bya ba rnams mdzub mo lta bus mtshon par byed pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: that the objects to be indicated are indicated by the finger-like [light ray].

original: khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs la zhes pa ni spyan drangs nas so //
analyzed: khams gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad spyan drangs la zhes pa ni spyan drangs nas so //
translated: Having invited all the Buddhas dwelling in the three worlds,

original: ma mo brgyad kyis zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad kyis so //
analyzed: ma mo brgyad kyis zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad kyis so //
translated: having made offerings to the eight Mothers means having made offerings to the eight Yoginis.

original: yang dag par mchod nas ni /
analyzed: yang dag par mchod nas ni /
translated: Having made offerings

original: pi wam dang gling bu la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: pi wam dang gling bu la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod pa byas nas /
translated: with the lute, flute, and so on,

original: phyis rjes su gsol ba gdab par bya ba ni gsol ba gdab pa'o //
analyzed: phyis rjes su gsol ba gdab par bya ba ni gsol ba gdab pa'o //
translated: the supplication is the supplication after that.

original: yang na rang gi snying ga zhes pa ni bsdus nas snying gar 'gugs pa ni /
analyzed: yang na rang gi snying ga zhes pa ni bsdus nas snying gar 'gugs pa ni /
translated: Or, at one's heart means that, having gathered, one draws into the heart.

original: yo gi zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: yo gi zhe sdang bdag nyid 'gyur //
translated: The yogin becomes the nature of wrath

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin du bskyed pa'i lha'i thugs kar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin du bskyed pa'i lha'i thugs kar ro //
translated: means that one generates the deity as the nature of Akshobhya at the heart.

original: rang gi sa bon las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From one's seed means

original: yi ge h'um gi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin las so //
analyzed: yi ge h'um gi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin las so //
translated: from the vajra holder, the nature of the syllable hum.

original: 'od zer nag po byung nas zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal gyi ye shes spros nas so //
analyzed: 'od zer nag po byung nas zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal gyi ye shes spros nas so //
translated: Having emanated the clear light gnosis of the nature of Akshobhya, black light rays arise.

original: des lcags kyu'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa la /
analyzed: des lcags kyu'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa la /
translated: By that, in the form of a hook,

original: aa ni yi ge aa la sogs pa'i yi ge aam gi bar gyi bco lnga ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: aa ni yi ge aa la sogs pa'i yi ge aam gi bar gyi bco lnga ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: means that the fifteen letters from A to Aṃ are the dakinis.

original: de rnams khong du chud cing rtogs par byed pas na lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: de rnams khong du chud cing rtogs par byed pas na lcags kyu'o //
translated: Since they cause understanding and realization, they are hooks.

original: de yang yi ge aa bdag med ma'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de yang yi ge aa bdag med ma'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: Moreover, the letter A is the nature of Nairātmya.

original: des zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: des zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pas so //
translated: By that means that Vajradhara is not different from Nairātmya.

original: khams gsum du bzhugs pa ni sku gsung thugs tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: khams gsum du bzhugs pa ni sku gsung thugs tha mi dad pas so //
translated: Residing in the three realms means that body, speech, and mind are not different.

original: de bzhugs pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhugs pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: Residing there means abiding in the nature of that.

original: sangs rgyas ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: The buddhas are the five tathāgatas, who are the nature of the five gnoses.

original: spyan drangs pa ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: spyan drangs pa ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: Summoned means gathered.

original: ma mo brgyad kyis ni dkar mo la sogs pa lnga ni yul lnga rnams so //
analyzed: ma mo brgyad kyis ni dkar mo la sogs pa lnga ni yul lnga rnams so //
translated: The eight mothers are the five, beginning with Gaurī, who are the five objects.

original: ri khrod ma la sogs pa gsum ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: ri khrod ma la sogs pa gsum ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The three, beginning with Carcikā, are the three vajras.

original: 'di rnams kyang skyed par byed pa yin pas ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang skyed par byed pa yin pas ma lta bu'o //
translated: These are like a mother because they generate.

original: gzung bar bya ba la mngon par zhen pas 'dzin par byed pa dmigs pa las so //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba la mngon par zhen pas 'dzin par byed pa dmigs pa las so //
translated: The apprehender is from the objective reference, because of the adherence to the apprehended.

original: gnyi ga yang lha'i rnam par dag par gyur nas sgrib pa med pa nyid du gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang lha'i rnam par dag par gyur nas sgrib pa med pa nyid du gyur ba yin no //
translated: Both of them become the purity of the gods, and become free of obscuration.

original: de rnams kyis yang dag par mchod nas ni yang dag par mchod pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis yang dag par mchod nas ni yang dag par mchod pa byas pa ste /
translated: Having made the right offering, they have made the right offering.

original: dbang po dang yul dag mngon par zhen pa las bzlog pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dag pa'i mchod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dag mngon par zhen pa las bzlog pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dag pa'i mchod pa yin no //
translated: This is the right offering, which is the reversal of the adherence to the sense organs and their objects.

original: rjes su gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes pa la //
analyzed: rjes su gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes pa la //
translated: One should make a request.

original: rjes ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rjes ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: The request is similar.

original: 'dra ba nyid kyis na gsol ba gdab pa @45a * //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid kyis na gsol ba gdab pa @45a * //
translated: By the very similarity, one makes a request.

original: ste mgon po'i rang bzhin rnams su byed do //
analyzed: ste mgon po'i rang bzhin rnams su byed do //
translated: One makes a request to the nature of the protector.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro ma dbyer med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro ma dbyer med pa yin no //
translated: This is the inseparability of the transcendent lords and the dakinis.

original: gsol ba gdab pa de gang yin gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa de gang yin gsungs pa /
translated: What is that request?

original: aom aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi skur bdag de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis mdzad du gsol cig pa'o //
analyzed: aom aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi skur bdag de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis mdzad du gsol cig pa'o //
translated: Om, consecrate me, all Tathagatas! In the aspect of Please cause me to be consecrated in the extremely pure Dharma Body of all aspects, all Tathagatas!

original: yang na aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am zhes pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang na aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am zhes pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes thob pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, consecrate me means to attain unobstructed wisdom.

original: sarba ta th'a ga t'a m'am ku ru pam zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga t'a m'am ku ru pam zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: All Tathagatas! means Please cause me to be the Vajra Holder who is inseparable from all Tathagatas!

original: sangs rgyas de rnams he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pa lngas dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes pa la sangs rgyas de rnams he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa ni mtshon pa tsam
analyzed: sangs rgyas de rnams he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pa lngas dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes pa la sangs rgyas de rnams he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa ni mtshon pa tsam
translated: Those Buddhas, in the form of Heruka, should confer empowerment with five vases filled with the five nectars, which are the nature of the five Tathagatas. Those Buddhas, in the form of Heruka, is just an illustration.

original: te / lha gang bsgom par bya ba'i lha de nyid kyi gzugs kyis blta bar bya'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: te / lha gang bsgom par bya ba'i lha de nyid kyi gzugs kyis blta bar bya'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: One should see with the form of that very deity who is the deity to be meditated upon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pas dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes pa ni khrus gsol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pas dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes pa ni khrus gsol ba'o //
translated: One should be consecrated with the vase filled with the five nectars, the nature of the five Tathagatas, this is the bathing.

original: yang na sangs rgyas de rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas de rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
translated: Or, by those Buddhas

original: me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis so ;
analyzed: me long la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis so ;
translated: means by the nature of the five intuitions, mirror-like intuition, etc.

original: / he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: / he ru ka'i rnam pa'i gzugs kyis zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The form of Heruka means the nature of non-duality.

original: de nyid bdud rtsi lngas gang ba ste ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid des so //
analyzed: de nyid bdud rtsi lngas gang ba ste ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid des so //
translated: That very [vase] is filled with the five nectars, the nature of the five intuitions.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa lnga yin no //
translated: That very [vase] is the five Tathagatas.
