original: bum pa des zhes pa la bde ba'i ye shes la dgyes par rol pa lnga'i bdag nyid de 'dis na bum pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa des zhes pa la bde ba'i ye shes la dgyes par rol pa lnga'i bdag nyid de 'dis na bum pa'o //
translated: By that vase means the nature of the five ecstasies of the bliss intuition. This is the vase.

original: ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin rnams phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin rnams phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five aggregates are of the nature of one intuition.

original: des dbang bskur ba ste rnam pa thams cad du sgrib pa med pa nyid du skyes pas na 'di lta bu'i dus na dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: des dbang bskur ba ste rnam pa thams cad du sgrib pa med pa nyid du skyes pas na 'di lta bu'i dus na dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: He is consecrated, since he is born as the state of non-obstruction in every way. At this time, he is consecrated,

original: khrus gsol bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khrus gsol bar gyur pa'o //
translated: and he is bathed.

original: spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: On his head is his own clan lord.

original: 'dis ni he ru ka rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni he ru ka rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: By this, Heruka is complete.

original: yang na dbang bskur ba na zhes pa ni sgrib pa med par skyed par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang bskur ba na zhes pa ni sgrib pa med par skyed par gyur pa na'o //
translated: Or else, when he is consecrated means when he is born as non-obstruction.

original: me tog gi char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa la me tog ni khrag go //
analyzed: me tog gi char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa la me tog ni khrag go //
translated: A rain of flowers falls means that the flower is blood.

original: char 'bab pa ni khu bas me tog gi char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: char 'bab pa ni khu bas me tog gi char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The rain is semen, and so a rain of flowers falls.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rtog pas @45b sprul pa'i sku 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rtog pas @45b sprul pa'i sku 'byung ngo //
translated: The emanation body arises from the non-dual thought.

original: rnga'i sgra grag par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rnga'i sgra smos pas n'a da gnyis kyi bdag nyid can a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyi n'a da steng du 'jug ste n'a da gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i ye shes spro bar gyur bas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku
analyzed: rnga'i sgra grag par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rnga'i sgra smos pas n'a da gnyis kyi bdag nyid can a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyi n'a da steng du 'jug ste n'a da gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i ye shes spro bar gyur bas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku
translated: Since the wisdom of the indivisibility of the two nadas is emanated, the sambhogakaya arises.

original: 'byung ngo // gur kum gyi char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung ngo // gur kum gyi char 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: A rain of saffron falls means

original: gur gum bdag med ma ste byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: gur gum bdag med ma ste byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: that saffron is Nairatma, bodhicitta.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i char 'bab ste thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems khu ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i char 'bab ste thabs kyi bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems khu ba'o //
translated: The rain of connate bodhicitta is the bodhicitta of the method, the bindu.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med par gyur par byang chub kyi sems chos kyi sku 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med par gyur par byang chub kyi sems chos kyi sku 'byung ngo //
translated: Since both become indivisible, the bodhicitta of the dharmakaya arises.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should make offerings with Rupadharvaja, and so on.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin de dang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin de dang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that is the nature of method and prajna, and the three vajras are indivisible,

original: gzugs rdo rje ma dang / sgra rdo rje ma dang / dri rdo rje ma dang / ro rdo rje ma dang / reg bya rdo rje ma dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma dang drug dbyer med par rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma dang / sgra rdo rje ma dang / dri rdo rje ma dang / ro rdo rje ma dang / reg bya rdo rje ma dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma dang drug dbyer med par rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The six goddesses are the indivisible perfection of the six sense objects: form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and the ultimate realm.

original: mchod par bya ba rdo rje glu ste mi phyed pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba rdo rje glu ste mi phyed pa'i sgras so //
translated: The vajra song is the offering, because of the sound of indivisibility.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
translated: The goddesses Locanā, etc.,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin rnams kyis so //
translated: are the four great elements.

original: blang bar bya'o zhes pa ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya'o zhes pa ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: “One should take” means one should manifest.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin nyid dkyil 'khor gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes bskyed par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin nyid dkyil 'khor gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes bskyed par bya ba yin no //
translated: The nature of signlessness is the generation of the gnosis of Vajradhara, who is the nature of both maṇḍalas.

original: dbang bskur ba na zhes pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin des 'od gsal ba bskyed pa na'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba na zhes pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin des 'od gsal ba bskyed pa na'o //
translated: “At the consecration” means at the generation of clear light by that nature free of obscurations.

original: spyi bor ni mgo bor byang chub kyi sems khu ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: spyi bor ni mgo bor byang chub kyi sems khu ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “On the head” means in the head, the nature of bodhicitta, the seminal essence.

original: rang gi rigs kyi bdag po ni mi bskyod pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi bdag po ni mi bskyod pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ngo //
translated: The lord of one’s own family is Akṣobhya, the nature of the Innate.

original: 'dis ni zhes pa ni rgyu 'dis na'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes pa ni rgyu 'dis na'o //
translated: “By this” means by this cause.

original: he ru ka rdzogs pa nyid do zhes pa ni rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: he ru ka rdzogs pa nyid do zhes pa ni rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: “The perfection of Heruka” is the perfection itself.

original: he ru ka zhes pa ni he ru ka'i sgra'i don yang rgyu la sogs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'dis bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi bye brag tu gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: he ru ka zhes pa ni he ru ka'i sgra'i don yang rgyu la sogs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'dis bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi bye brag tu gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Heruka” is the meaning of the word Heruka. “Free from cause, etc.” This is said to be the specialty of the Lord himself.

original: thun gsum du byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsgom pa rnam par bsgoms nas langs te lha'i gzugs su gzhag go zhes pa ni tho rangs dang nyi ma phyed dang dgongs ka'i dus rnams so //🔽byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsgom pa ni dmigs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: thun gsum du byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsgom pa rnam par bsgoms nas langs te lha'i gzugs su gzhag go zhes pa ni tho rangs dang nyi ma phyed dang dgongs ka'i dus rnams so // byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsgom pa ni dmigs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Having meditated on the meditation of consecration in three periods, having arisen, one should be placed in the form of the deity. This is the times of dawn, noon, and evening.

original: bsgoms @46a * //
analyzed: bsgoms @46a * //
translated: The meditation of consecration is the meditative concentration on the object.

original: nas zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bzhag nas so //
analyzed: nas zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bzhag nas so //
translated: “Having meditated” means having been placed in the manner of nonduality.

original: langs te zhes pa ni spro bas gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: langs te zhes pa ni spro bas gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Having arisen” means one will abide in the emanation.

original: yang na thun gsum du byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsgom pa zhes pa ni thun mtshams gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na thun gsum du byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsgom pa zhes pa ni thun mtshams gsum ste /
translated: Or else, the meditation of consecration in three parts is the three periods of the day.

original: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang / gnyi ga'i dkyil 'khor dbyer med pa'i ye shes so /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang / gnyi ga'i dkyil 'khor dbyer med pa'i ye shes so /
translated: The consecration is the three wisdoms: the wisdom mandala, the pledge mandala, and the wisdom of the indivisibility of the two mandalas.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsgom pa zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba la thug pas sgrib pa med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsgom pa zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba la thug pas sgrib pa med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
translated: The meditation of consecration is the attainment of the stage of nonobstruction by means of the consecration that culminates in the conferral of initiation.

original: bsgoms nas langs te zhes pa ni bshad zin pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsgoms nas langs te zhes pa ni bshad zin pa'i don to //
translated: Having meditated and arisen is the meaning of what has been explained.

original: lha'i gzugs su gzhag go zhes pa ni lha ni ye shes te don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i gzugs su gzhag go zhes pa ni lha ni ye shes te don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: One should be placed in the divine form means that the deity is wisdom, the ultimate truth.

original: gzugs zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The form is the relative truth.

original: bden pa gnyis ka'i bdag nyid des lha'i gzugs su bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ka'i bdag nyid des lha'i gzugs su bzhag pa yin te /
translated: By means of that which is the nature of the two truths, one should be placed in the divine form,

original: rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang bskyed par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang bskyed par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: which means that one should generate the stage of Vajradhara.

original: dbang gi le'u ste bzhi po'i zhes pa ni kun nas sgrib pa med par byed pas dbang ngo //
analyzed: dbang gi le'u ste bzhi po'i zhes pa ni kun nas sgrib pa med par byed pas dbang ngo //
translated: The fourth chapter is called the initiation chapter because it is the initiation that makes one completely free of obscurations.

original: de yang gos ni sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gos ni sgrib pa'o //
translated: The cloth is the obscuration.

original: de len cing 'dzin pas na rim par phye ba ste /
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pas na rim par phye ba ste /
translated: Since it is taken up and held, it is the division.

original: dbang gi rim par phye ba bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dbang gi rim par phye ba bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the division of the empowerment.

original: bzhi pa rdzogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bzhi pa rdzogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The fourth is the nature of the innate perfection.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye bas sku rdo rje sngags kyi rim par phye bas gsung rdo rje /
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye bas sku rdo rje sngags kyi rim par phye bas gsung rdo rje /
translated: The division of the vajra family is the vajra body. The division of the mantra family is the vajra speech.

original: lha'i rim par phye bas thugs rdo rje /
analyzed: lha'i rim par phye bas thugs rdo rje /
translated: The division of the deity family is the vajra mind.

original: dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye bas rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye bas rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The division of the empowerment is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: las kyi phyag rgya la dga' ba la sogs pa rim pas so //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya la dga' ba la sogs pa rim pas so //
translated: The joy of the karma consort, and so on, is the sequence.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ni 'khor lo bzhi'i rim pas gtum mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni 'khor lo bzhi'i rim pas gtum mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The dharma consort is the yoga of caṇḍālī through the sequence of the four cakras.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni phyag rgya bzhi tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni phyag rgya bzhi tha mi dad pas so //
translated: The mahāmudrā is the four mudras that are not different.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa yin no //
translated: The samayamudrā is the manifest enlightenment of omniscience.

original: rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las dbang bskur pa'i rim par phye ba ste le'u bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las dbang bskur pa'i rim par phye ba ste le'u bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter, the initiation procedure, from the Illuminating Lamp Great Commentary on the glorious Esoteric Community.

original: // / da ni de nas de kho na nyid kyi le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: // / da ni de nas de kho na nyid kyi le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Now, the chapter on reality will be explained, as it is said,🔽“Then, the chapter on reality will be explained.”

original: de la de kho na nyid bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid bzhi ste /
translated: There are four realities:

original: bdag gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: the reality of the self, the reality of the mantra, the reality of the deity, and the reality of gnosis.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba bdag gi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba bdag gi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The Vajra Family chapter is the reality of the self.

original: sngags kyi rim par phye ba sngags kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: sngags kyi rim par phye ba sngags kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The Mantra chapter is the reality of the mantra.

original: lha'i rim par phye ba ni lha'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: lha'i rim par phye ba ni lha'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The Deity chapter is the reality of the deity.

original: @46b dbang bskur pa'i rim par phye ba ni ye shes kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: @46b dbang bskur pa'i rim par phye ba ni ye shes kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The Initiation chapter is the reality of gnosis.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid bzhi bstan nas bzhi po tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid bzhi bstan nas bzhi po tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the four realities, in order to show that the four are not different,

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi de kho na nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi de kho na nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to realize the reality of the knowledge of the nature of the extremely pure realm of phenomena, the vajra-holder, it is said.

original: de nas zhes pa ni rjes thogs su bar ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni rjes thogs su bar ma chad pa'o //
translated: Then means immediately, without interruption.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the division of reality should be done.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is said:

original: ngo bo gzugs med ces bya ba smos te rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: ngo bo gzugs med ces bya ba smos te rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature is formless, it is said. One's own nature is one's own nature.

original: gang dang gang gi ngo bo de dang de'i ngo bo de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi ngo bo de dang de'i ngo bo de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of whatever is that, the nature of that is its essence.

original: des na de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist.

original: de skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
translated: Thus it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: gang gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gang gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Whatever form is empty by the intrinsic nature of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang gang rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang gang rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness is empty by the intrinsic nature of consciousness, and so on.

original: mthong ba yang mthong ba rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba yang mthong ba rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Seeing also does not exist by way of its own entity as seeing.

original: bdag gi de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba dang po'o //
analyzed: bdag gi de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba dang po'o //
translated: This is the first chapter on the reality of the self.

original: sgra med thos pa po yang med //
analyzed: sgra med thos pa po yang med //
translated: There is no sound, and there is no hearer.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is

original: de bzhin du thams cad du rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yin par sbyar ro //
translated: as above, with the addition of “by way of its own entity” throughout.

original: sgra ni sgra'i ngo bo nyid kyis med la /
analyzed: sgra ni sgra'i ngo bo nyid kyis med la /
translated: Sound does not exist by way of the entity of sound.

original: thos pa ni thos pa po rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa sngags kyi de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: thos pa ni thos pa po rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa sngags kyi de kho na nyid de /
translated: Hearing does not exist by way of the entity of the hearer. This is the reality of mantra.

original: sngags kyi rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rim par phye ba'o //
translated: This is the chapter on mantra.

original: dri med snom pa po yang med //
analyzed: dri med snom pa po yang med //
translated: There is no smell, and there is no smeller.

original: ces pa ni de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is to be applied as above.

original: dri sna'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung bya yin pa'i phyir sna'i rnam par shes pa yang n'a da la thim par gyur pa //
analyzed: dri sna'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung bya yin pa'i phyir sna'i rnam par shes pa yang n'a da la thim par gyur pa //
translated: Since smell is the object of the nose consciousness, the nose consciousness also dissolves into the nāḍī.

original: n'a da la zhon pa ni sems te /
analyzed: n'a da la zhon pa ni sems te /
translated: The mind, which rides on the nāḍī,

original: de kho na nyid gsum po des lha'i de kho na nyid de lha'i rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum po des lha'i de kho na nyid de lha'i rim par phye ba'o //
translated: is the reality of the deity. This is the chapter on the deity.

original: ro med myong ba po yang med //
analyzed: ro med myong ba po yang med //
translated: There is no taste, nor is there a taster.

original: ces pa ni ro nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin la de yang ye shes kyi de kho na nyid dbang bskur pa'i rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni ro nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin la de yang ye shes kyi de kho na nyid dbang bskur pa'i rim par phye ba'o //
translated: This is the characteristic of the experience of taste. Moreover, that is the suchness of exalted wisdom, divided into the stages of empowerment.

original: reg med reg pa po yang med //
analyzed: reg med reg pa po yang med //
translated: There is no touch, nor is there a toucher.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is

original: de kho na nyid bzhi bsdus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzhi bsdus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the nature that includes the four suchnesses.

original: reg pa dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dga' ba la thug par ro //
analyzed: reg pa dga' ba la sogs pa rnam par dga' ba la thug par ro //
translated: Touch is the joy and so on up to supreme joy.

original: sems med sems las byung ba med //
analyzed: sems med sems las byung ba med //
translated: There is no mind, nor are there mental factors.

original: ces pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba sems las 'das pa'i phyir drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //🔽yang na / ngo bo gzugs med mthong ba med //
analyzed: ces pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba sems las 'das pa'i phyir drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o // yang na / ngo bo gzugs med mthong ba med //
translated: This is the sixth, Vajradhara, because the connate joy is beyond the mind.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa bzhis de kho na @47a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa bzhis de kho na @47a * //
translated: Alternatively, the four beginning with “The essence is formless and unseen” are the four suchnesses.

original: nyid bzhi'o // thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid bzhi'o // thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because method and wisdom are inseparable,

original: reg med reg pa po yang med //
analyzed: reg med reg pa po yang med //
translated: there is no touch, nor is there a toucher.

original: sems med sems las byung ba med //
analyzed: sems med sems las byung ba med //
translated: There is no mind, nor are there mental factors.

original: ces pa'o // de kho na nyid bzhi bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa'o // de kho na nyid bzhi bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the inclusion of the four suchnesses.

original: de lta bu'i rim pa'i dngos pos yul drug gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi dbyings rnams dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de dbang po drug rnams so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pa'i dngos pos yul drug gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi dbyings rnams dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de dbang po drug rnams so //
translated: The six objects are form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and the sphere of phenomena. The six sense faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin yang khams gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin yang khams gsum yin no //
translated: The nature of these is the three realms.

original: rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon conceptualization,

original: skyed byed ma dang sring mo nyid //
analyzed: skyed byed ma dang sring mo nyid //
translated: the mother who gives birth and the sister

original: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu mchod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu mchod //
translated: are always worshipped by the yogin who knows.

original: bar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma //
analyzed: bar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma //
translated: The middle one is the sister, the vajra woman.

original: gdol ma de bzhin bram ze ma //
analyzed: gdol ma de bzhin bram ze ma //
translated: The outcaste woman is the brahmin woman.

original: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis //
translated: By the rite of method and wisdom,

original: de nyid 'dod pas rtag tu mchod //
analyzed: de nyid 'dod pas rtag tu mchod //
translated: one should always worship reality with desire.

original: ces pa'i don ni go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: ces pa'i don ni go sla ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is easy to understand.

original: yang na skyed byed ma'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga rnams te /
analyzed: yang na skyed byed ma'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga rnams te /
translated: Or, the word mother who gives birth refers to the five objects such as form.

original: gang phyir 'gro ba bskyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir 'gro ba bskyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they give birth to the world,

original: bskyed ma zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: bskyed ma zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: by the word mother who gives birth.

original: phal cher gzung bar bya ba la mngon par zhen pas dmigs pa'i dbang po rnams bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: phal cher gzung bar bya ba la mngon par zhen pas dmigs pa'i dbang po rnams bskyed pa'o //
translated: Most likely, the sense faculties are generated by the power of the object, due to strong attachment to the object to be grasped.

original: sring mo'i sgras mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rnams te //
analyzed: sring mo'i sgras mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rnams te //
translated: The word “sister” refers to the five sense faculties such as the eye,

original: gang phyir skal pa ston pa yi //🔽shes rab sring mor brjod par bya //
analyzed: gang phyir skal pa ston pa yi // shes rab sring mor brjod par bya //
translated: because of the statement:🔽“Wisdom is called a sister,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: because she shows good fortune.”

original: de ltar mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the five sense objects such as form are to be grasped by the five sense faculties such as the eye.

original: gnyi ga sbyor ba rig bas rnal 'byor rig go //
analyzed: gnyi ga sbyor ba rig bas rnal 'byor rig go //
translated: The yogin knows the union of both,🔽because of the statement:🔽“The yogin always knows the union of both.”

original: rtag tu ni dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par dbyer med pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: rtag tu ni dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par dbyer med pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: “Always” means at all times, without interruption, by the aspect of inseparability.

original: mchod ces pa ni nye bar longs spyod pa ste 'dis ni rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: mchod ces pa ni nye bar longs spyod pa ste 'dis ni rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: “Worship” means enjoyment. This consecrates the vajra and lotus.

original: 'dis ni mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa yang bstan to /
analyzed: 'dis ni mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa yang bstan to /
translated: This also teaches the consecration of the eye, etc.

original: yul dang dbang po sbyor ba las skyes pa'i ye shes yin pas lus byin gyis brlab pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po sbyor ba las skyes pa'i ye shes yin pas lus byin gyis brlab pa yang bstan to //
translated: Since it is the intuition born from the union of object and sense-faculty, the blessing of the body is also taught.

original: gar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma //
analyzed: gar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma //
translated: The dancer, the cook, the vajra woman,

original: gdol ma de bzhin bram ze ma //
analyzed: gdol ma de bzhin bram ze ma //
translated: the untouchable woman, and likewise the brahmin woman,

original: rigs ni rnam pa lngar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa lngar gnas pa'o //
translated: are the five types of family.

original: mchod pa ni goms par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni goms par bya ba'o //
translated: Worship is the practice.

original: ji ltar zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na //
translated: How so?

original: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis //
translated: By the rite of means and insight.

original: zhes pa ste thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis yul dang dbang po'i bye brag rtogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ste thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis yul dang dbang po'i bye brag rtogs pas so //
translated: By the realization of the distinction of object and sense-faculty with the nature of means and insight.

original: de nyid rigs pas zhes pa @47b ni kho na nyid la chags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rigs pas zhes pa @47b ni kho na nyid la chags pa'o //
translated: That itself is the principle, which is attachment to reality.

original: rgyu 'di'i rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa ji lta bar yongs su shes pas /
analyzed: rgyu 'di'i rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa ji lta bar yongs su shes pas /
translated: By the nature of this cause, the intuition of reality just as it is,

original: ngo bos gzugs med mthong ba med //
analyzed: ngo bos gzugs med mthong ba med //
translated: the form is not seen by nature.🔽As it is said,

original: ces pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa //
translated: and so on up to

original: sems med sems las byung ba med //
analyzed: sems med sems las byung ba med //
translated: no mind, no mental events.

original: ces pa'i mthar rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa des de kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: ces pa'i mthar rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa des de kho na nyid yin te /
translated: At the end of that, the reality is the non-differentiation of the three vajras.

original: yul lnga dang dbang po lnga dang shes pa lnga dbyer med pas mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: yul lnga dang dbang po lnga dang shes pa lnga dbyer med pas mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The five objects, the five faculties, and the five cognitions are inseparable, and so the mandala has the nature of the fifteen dakinis.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang dbyer med pas yang yul drug dang rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin des phung po dang khams dang skye mched bco brgyad rnams kyang ngo //🔽ji ltar phye bar mi shes pa //🔽de ltar 'bad pas bstan par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang dbyer med pas yang yul drug dang rnam par shes pa drug gi rang bzhin des phung po dang khams dang skye mched bco brgyad rnams kyang ngo // ji ltar phye bar mi shes pa // de ltar 'bad pas bstan par bya //
translated: Since it is inseparable from Vajrasattva, the six objects and the six consciousnesses have that nature, and so the eighteen dhatus and ayatanas are also [included].

original: zhes pa'o // 'di rnams 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba ji ltar bsten zhen /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'di rnams 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba ji ltar bsten zhen /
translated: How should one rely on these [instructions] that contradict the world?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / ji ltar phyed par mi shes pa //
analyzed: gsungs pa / ji ltar phyed par mi shes pa //
translated: As one does not know how to divide,

original: zhes pa ste ji ltar sus kyang mi shes pa de ltar bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste ji ltar sus kyang mi shes pa de ltar bsten par bya'o //
translated: one should rely on them as one does not know how anyone else does.

original: rab tu 'bad pas ni /
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pas ni /
translated: With great effort

original: 'bad rtsol phul du byung ba ste //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol phul du byung ba ste //
translated: one should make the utmost effort.

original: rdo rje 'di ni khu bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje 'di ni khu bar 'gyur //
translated: This vajra becomes the seminal fluid.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: yang na bsten par bya ni goms par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bsten par bya ni goms par bya ba ste /
translated: Or, “one should rely on them” means one should become familiar with them.

original: 'bad pas de nyid ji ltar byed pa mi rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bad pas de nyid ji ltar byed pa mi rig par bya'o //
translated: One should not know how to do that very thing with effort.

original: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said by the Lord:

original: mi phyed mtshan nyid dngos grub ni //
analyzed: mi phyed mtshan nyid dngos grub ni //
translated: The accomplishment of the nature of non-division

original: rnal 'byor pa yi phyag rgyas 'grub //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yi phyag rgyas 'grub //
translated: is accomplished by the seal of the yogi.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gal te phyed par gyur na de'i tshe cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽gsungs pa / ma gsang sbrul dang chom rkun dang // sa spyod me yis sdug bsngal byed //
analyzed: gal te phyed par gyur na de'i tshe cir 'gyur zhe na / gsungs pa / ma gsang sbrul dang chom rkun dang // sa spyod me yis sdug bsngal byed //
translated: If there is division, then what happens?

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: It is said:🔽If not concealed, suffering is produced by snakes, robbers,🔽and by the earth-dwelling fire.

original: gal te gsal bar bsten na de'i tshe sdug bsngal du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gsal bar bsten na de'i tshe sdug bsngal du 'gyur te /
translated: If one relies on the seal in a manifest way, then suffering will occur.

original: gang gis shen /
analyzed: gang gis shen /
translated: How is that known?

original: sbrul dang chom rkun dang sa spyod me yin te sa spyod stag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbrul dang chom rkun dang sa spyod me yin te sa spyod stag la sogs pa'o //
translated: By snakes, robbers, and by the earth-dwelling fire, and by the earth-dwelling tiger, etc.

original: de yang ba ma sdangs par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ba ma sdangs par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, one will die in a state of fear.

original: de nas dmyal bar lhung nas sdug bsngal gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dmyal bar lhung nas sdug bsngal gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having fallen into hell, there will be another suffering.

original: yang na ma gsang na dbyer med de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pas sdug bsngal bar byas te 'khor ba can gyi sdug bsngal gyi bya ba la zhugs nas sbrul dang chom rkun dang me dang sa la spyod pas sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na ma gsang na dbyer med de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pas sdug bsngal bar byas te 'khor ba can gyi sdug bsngal gyi bya ba la zhugs nas sbrul dang chom rkun dang me dang sa la spyod pas sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: If one does not keep it secret, then it is not indivisible, and one is made to suffer by the manifest clinging of subject and object. Having engaged in the activity of the suffering of cyclic existence, one generates suffering by engaging in the conduct of snakes, thieves, fire, and earth.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kun du rtog pa de rnams kyi zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kun du rtog pa de rnams kyi zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “those” is the afflictions and the secondary afflictions that are conceptualizations.

original: gal te 'di bsten pas phyed na skyon du @48a * //
analyzed: gal te 'di bsten pas phyed na skyon du @48a * //
translated: If it is a fault to rely on this and be divided,🔽what is the purpose of relying on this?

original: 'gyur na 'di bsten pas dgos pa ci zhig yod ces pa'i dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'gyur na 'di bsten pas dgos pa ci zhig yod ces pa'i dogs pa bsu nas gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to this question is stated:

original: rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba //
translated: The mudrā of the five families

original: thar pa'i rgyur ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyur ni brjod par bya //
translated: is said to be the cause of liberation.🔽The mudrā of the five families

original: zhes pas thar pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //🔽gar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma //🔽gdol pa de bzhin bram ze ma /
analyzed: zhes pas thar pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro // gar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma // gdol pa de bzhin bram ze ma /
translated: is said to be the cause of liberation.

original: rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba //
translated: The mudrā of the five families

original: thar pa'i rgyur ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyur ni brjod par bya //
translated: is said to be the cause of liberation.

original: yang na rigs lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid phyag rgya yin pas thar pa'i don du bstan to //
analyzed: yang na rigs lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid phyag rgya yin pas thar pa'i don du bstan to //
translated: Or, the five clans are the five transcendent lords themselves, and the seal is taught for the sake of liberation.

original: yang na mi phyed na 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na mi phyed na 'di nyid yin te /
translated: Or, it is just this, non-division.

original: phyag rgya lnga zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i phyag mtshan yin par bshad de /
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i phyag mtshan yin par bshad de /
translated: The so-called five seals are explained as the hand implements of the five transcendent lords.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yul lnga'i rang bzhin gyi phyag rgya lnga po 'di nyid thar pa thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yul lnga'i rang bzhin gyi phyag rgya lnga po 'di nyid thar pa thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: These five seals, the nature of the five objects, are the very nature of the indivisibility of the five transcendent lords, and one attains liberation through them.

original: phyag rgya zhes pa ni sgra 'di ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa ni sgra 'di ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa //
translated: The word “seal” is said to be as follows.

original: rdo rje 'dis ni gdab pa nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dis ni gdab pa nyid //
translated: This vajra is the very nail,

original: des na phyag rgya brjod par bya //
analyzed: des na phyag rgya brjod par bya //
translated: therefore it is called a seal.

original: zhes pa ste gang rdo rje zhes pa bstan pa'i rdo rje mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rjes reg pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ste gang rdo rje zhes pa bstan pa'i rdo rje mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rjes reg pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: That which is called “vajra” is the vajra of Akshobhya, the teacher, because it is the object of the vajra mind.

original: dam pa'i bde ba nyid yin te //
analyzed: dam pa'i bde ba nyid yin te //
translated: It is the very bliss of the sublime,

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: by the words.

original: gar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma /
analyzed: gar ma tshos ma rdo rje ma /
translated: The dancer, the cook, and Vajri

original: gdol pa de bzhin bram ze ma //
analyzed: gdol pa de bzhin bram ze ma //
translated: The caṇḍālī is the same as the brahmin woman.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa de rnams kyi nang nas dang po rdo rje'i rigs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa de rnams kyi nang nas dang po rdo rje'i rigs bstan pa ni /
translated: Among those, the first, the vajra family, is taught.

original: thugs ni thams cad kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs ni thams cad kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is the lord of all.

original: rdo rje padma de bzhin las //
analyzed: rdo rje padma de bzhin las //
translated: The vajra, lotus, and likewise the action,

original: de bzhin gshegs dang rin chen nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs dang rin chen nyid //
translated: the tathāgata, and the jewel,

original: slar dang por gnas pa'i phyag rgya gnyis so //🔽gar ma padma'i rigs te 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs gsung rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: slar dang por gnas pa'i phyag rgya gnyis so // gar ma padma'i rigs te 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs gsung rdo rje ma'o //
translated: are the first and last mudrā.🔽The dancer is the lotus family, the speech vajra of Amitābha.

original: tshos ma las kyi rigs don yod grub pa'i rigs sku rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: tshos ma las kyi rigs don yod grub pa'i rigs sku rdo rje ma'o //
translated: The washerwoman is the action family, the body vajra of Amoghasiddhi.

original: slar lugs las bzlog pa mtha' yas pa nas bzung ste //
analyzed: slar lugs las bzlog pa mtha' yas pa nas bzung ste //
translated: Again, in reverse order, starting from the end,

original: bram ze mo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sku rdo rje ma don yod grub pa ni 'di nyid du zhugs pas so //
analyzed: bram ze mo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs sku rdo rje ma don yod grub pa ni 'di nyid du zhugs pas so //
translated: the brahmin woman is the tathāgata family, the body vajra of Amoghasiddhi, who has entered here.

original: 'di'i don dang po nyid du bstan pa'i yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don dang po nyid du bstan pa'i yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the first verse.

original: gdol pa mo ni rin po che'i rigs te 'od dpag tu med pa gsung rdo rjer zhugs so ;
analyzed: gdol pa mo ni rin po che'i rigs te 'od dpag tu med pa gsung rdo rjer zhugs so ;
translated: The caṇḍālī is the jewel family, the speech vajra of Amitābha, who has entered.

original: /'od dpag tu med pa rin chen 'byung ldan nyi ma ste zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: /'od dpag tu med pa rin chen 'byung ldan nyi ma ste zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Amitābha is Ratnasambhava, the sun, because of being the nature of the moon and sun.

original: gnyi ga yang bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pas /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pas /
translated: Since both are not different from Nairātmya,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis rgyas gdab par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis rgyas gdab par rigs pa yin no //
translated: it is proper to seal them with the bodhicitta.

original: de nyid rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is taught to be the family of Ratnasambhava.

original: snying rje chen po @48b dam pa yi //
analyzed: snying rje chen po @48b dam pa yi //
translated: The family of the supreme great compassion

original: rigs ni rnam pa lnga ru brjod //
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa lnga ru brjod //
translated: is said to be of five types.

original: rim pa 'dis na rigs rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis na rigs rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: By this process, there are five types of families.

original: kye rdo rje snying po snying rje che //🔽zhes pa bod pa'o //
analyzed: kye rdo rje snying po snying rje che // zhes pa bod pa'o //
translated: The essence of Hevajra is great compassion.

original: gzugs la sogs gnyi ga tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs gnyi ga tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: Form and so on are not different from Nairātmya.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang // 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa rnams lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pas bram ze mo dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang // 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa rnams lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pas bram ze mo dang /
translated: Form, sound, smell, taste, and touch are Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, and Akṣobhya, respectively.

original: gdol pa mo dang / gar ma dang tshos ma dang / g-yung mo rnams bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gdol pa mo dang / gar ma dang tshos ma dang / g-yung mo rnams bstan pa yin no //
translated: The brahmin woman, the untouchable woman, the dancer, the wine-server, and the prostitute are taught in the forward and reverse sequences.

original: rdo rje 'dis ni gdab pa nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dis ni gdab pa nyid //
translated: This is the seal.

original: des na phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
analyzed: des na phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
translated: Therefore, it is called a seal.

original: zhes pa ni rgyas gdab par bya ba mtshon pa'i phyir phyag rgyas ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyas gdab par bya ba mtshon pa'i phyir phyag rgyas ste /
translated: This is said to illustrate the sealing.

original: rgyu 'dis na mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis na mngon par brjod do //
translated: By this cause, it is expressed.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rdo rje padma de bzhin las //
analyzed: rdo rje padma de bzhin las //
translated: The vajra, lotus, and likewise, action,

original: de bzhin gshegs dang rin chen nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs dang rin chen nyid //
translated: the tathāgata, and the jewel—

original: 'di dag thams cad phyag rgya zhes mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad phyag rgya zhes mngon par brjod do //
translated: all of these are called seals.

original: rgyu des na rdo rje mi phyed pas na'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na rdo rje mi phyed pas na'o //
translated: By this cause, it is the vajra because it is indivisible.

original: 'di nyid rigs rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rigs rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: This itself is the five families.

original: dam pa bstan pa ni ye shes kyis nges par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa bstan pa ni ye shes kyis nges par ldan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the holy is endowed with intuition.

original: de bas na snying rje chen po zhes bos nas /
analyzed: de bas na snying rje chen po zhes bos nas /
translated: Therefore, having addressed the Great Compassion,

original: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa 'di nyid ye shes yin te /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa 'di nyid ye shes yin te /
translated: this very inseparability of means and insight is intuition,

original: blta bar bya ba 'am lta bar byed pa la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba 'am lta bar byed pa la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of vision, the agent of vision, etc., are inseparable.

original: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab cho ga yis //
translated: By the rite of means and insight,

original: de nyid rig pas rtag tu mchod //
analyzed: de nyid rig pas rtag tu mchod //
translated: one should always worship reality with intuition.

original: ces pa'o // yang na ku'i sgras ni chos 'byung bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: ces pa'o // yang na ku'i sgras ni chos 'byung bdag med ma'o //
translated: Or, the word “also” refers to the source of phenomena, Nairātmyā.

original: de len cing 'dzin la de dang lhan cig tu dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por gyur pas /
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin la de dang lhan cig tu dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por gyur pas /
translated: Taking and holding that, with that, one becomes an entity whose nature is inseparable.

original: rigs lnga po de rnams rgyas pa'i rnam pas rigs mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga po de rnams rgyas pa'i rnam pas rigs mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: Those five clans, by the mode of their expansion, are the infinite clans.

original: ji ltar rigs mtha' yas pa nyid ni sngags kyi rim par phye ba nyid du bstan zin pa dang / rim par phye ba gzhan du yang so sor bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs mtha' yas pa nyid ni sngags kyi rim par phye ba nyid du bstan zin pa dang / rim par phye ba gzhan du yang so sor bstan par bya'o //
translated: The very infinitude of the clans has been taught in the division of the mantra stages, and will be taught individually in other divisions.

original: 'di nyid dam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di nyid dam par bshad do //
translated: This very [mantra stage] is explained as the holy.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i phyir snying rje chen po nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i phyir snying rje chen po nyid do //
translated: It is great compassion itself, because the conventional and the ultimate are inseparable.

original: 'di nyid mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pas so so ba dang bsdus pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid mi phyed pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pas so so ba dang bsdus pas gsungs pa /
translated: In order to realize this very indivisibility, it is taught in forward and reverse order, separately and combined:

original: rdo rje phyag rgya g-yung mo nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje phyag rgya g-yung mo nyid //
translated: The vajra seal is the female outcaste,

original: de bzhin padma gar ma nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin padma gar ma nyid //
translated: and likewise the lotus seal is the female dancer.

original: las ni tshos mar rab tu bshad //
analyzed: las ni tshos mar rab tu bshad //
translated: The karma seal is explained as the female weaver,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bram ze mo //🔽@49a * // rin chen gdol mar shes par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bram ze mo // @49a * // rin chen gdol mar shes par bya //
translated: and the tathāgata seal is the female brahmin.

original: zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The jewel seal is known as the female outcaste.

original: phyag rgya lngar ni rnam par nges //
analyzed: phyag rgya lngar ni rnam par nges //
translated: They are ascertained as the five seals.

original: 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs //
translated: These are the families of the tathāgatas.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are to be expressed in brief.

original: mdor bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni /
translated: In brief,

original: yul dang rnam par shes pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la de'i bdag nyid kyis zhugs pas na rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs yin no //
analyzed: yul dang rnam par shes pa dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la de'i bdag nyid kyis zhugs pas na rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang / mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs yin no //
translated: The objects and consciousnesses are the vajra-women, etc., and the Tathagatas, Akshobhya, etc., because they are engaged in the nature of those.

original: ngo bos gzugs med mthong ba med //
analyzed: ngo bos gzugs med mthong ba med //
translated: The nature of form is not seen without the nature of emptiness.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad nyid bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad nyid bstan to //
translated: All of this is taught.

original: yang na gang gi phyir g-yung mo la sogs pa rnams kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin nyid de 'di rnams kyi rdo rje nyid ni mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin yin no //🔽de nas rnam par nges pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir g-yung mo la sogs pa rnams kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin nyid de 'di rnams kyi rdo rje nyid ni mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin yin no // de nas rnam par nges pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Or else, because of the nature of the mudras, etc., of the vajra-women, etc., their vajra-nature is the nature of indivisibility.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs par nges pa rnams stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin de zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs par nges pa rnams stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin de zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, the nature of freedom from determination is the nature of emptiness and compassion, indivisible.

original: 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs //
translated: These are the families of the Tathagatas.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
translated: They are expressed in brief.

original: 'di nyid rigs kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di nyid rigs kyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the knowledge of the family.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: mdor bsdus pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said to be in brief.

original: yul dang rnam par shes pa dag 'di la de'i bdag nyid gyis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: yul dang rnam par shes pa dag 'di la de'i bdag nyid gyis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The object and consciousness enter into it by way of its nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes pa ni /
translated: The family of the Tathagata is said to be🔽the meaning of the word Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra nyid kyi don ci yin pa gsungs pa /🔽dpal ldan de bzhin nyid gshegs shing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra nyid kyi don ci yin pa gsungs pa / dpal ldan de bzhin nyid gshegs shing //
translated: It is said:🔽The glorious one goes to suchness

original: de bzhin slar yang gshegs pa nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin slar yang gshegs pa nyid //
translated: and goes again to suchness.

original: 'dis ni shes rab rigs pa yis //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab rigs pa yis //
translated: By this, with the knowledge of wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs zhes brjod par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs zhes brjod par bya //
translated: he is to be called Tathagata.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid ni mkha' 'gro ma dang g-yung mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid ni mkha' 'gro ma dang g-yung mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, suchness is the dakinis, yoginis, and so forth.

original: de rnams la rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i tshul gyis son zhing zhugs pa na de bzhin gshegs so //
analyzed: de rnams la rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i tshul gyis son zhing zhugs pa na de bzhin gshegs so //
translated: When he arrives and enters them by way of the mudra of Vajravarahi and so forth, he goes to suchness.

original: gshegs pa ni de nyid mkha' 'gro ma rnams la rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rgyas gdab pa'i tshul gyis bdag nyid rtog pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gshegs pa ni de nyid mkha' 'gro ma rnams la rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rgyas gdab pa'i tshul gyis bdag nyid rtog pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The “going” is the very one who is endowed with the idea of himself as being sealed by the dakinis with Vajravarahi, etc.

original: de bzhin slar yang gshegs pa nyid ni de nyid dpal ldan te /
analyzed: de bzhin slar yang gshegs pa nyid ni de nyid dpal ldan te /
translated: The “coming” is the very one who is glorious.

original: yi ge shr'i ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: yi ge shr'i ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The “shri” is nondual intuition.

original: de yod pas de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yod pas de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since it exists, he is endowed with it.

original: yang na de bzhin nyid ni rnam par @49b mi rtog pa'o //🔽der song ba de'i nang du thim pa de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin nyid ni rnam par @49b mi rtog pa'o // der song ba de'i nang du thim pa de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, “suchness” is nonconceptual intuition.

original: de bzhin slar yang gshegs pa nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin slar yang gshegs pa nyid //
translated: “Gone there” means dissolved into it. “The nature of that” means the nature of that, i.e., nonconceptual intuition.

original: ces pa ni de nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes spros pa'i tshul gyis kyang rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: ces pa ni de nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes spros pa'i tshul gyis kyang rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The “coming” is the very one who, by the method of emanation from nonconceptual intuition, abides in conceptual intuition.

original: dpal ldan zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: “Glorious” has the meaning already explained.

original: 'dis ni shes rab ces pa ni bstan pa'i rim pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa des so //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab ces pa ni bstan pa'i rim pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa des so //
translated: “By that” means by that ultimate truth which is the object of the stage of teaching.

original: rigs pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa zhes pa ni /
translated: “Reason” means

original: bstan pa'i rim pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa des so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i rim pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa des so //
translated: By that conventional truth of the stages of the teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs zhes brjod par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs zhes brjod par bya //
translated: One should say “tathāgata.”

original: zhes pas ni rdo rje 'dzin par gsal por byed do //
analyzed: zhes pas ni rdo rje 'dzin par gsal por byed do //
translated: This clarifies the vajra-holder.

original: da ni ngo bos med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bsdu ba gsungs pa /🔽rigs ni rnam pa drug tu brjod //
analyzed: da ni ngo bos med ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bsdu ba gsungs pa / rigs ni rnam pa drug tu brjod //
translated: Now he states the summary beginning with “without essence,” etc.

original: ces pa ste //
analyzed: ces pa ste //
translated: The family is said to be of six kinds.

original: mig dang rna ba sna dang ni //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna dang ni //
translated: The eye, ear, nose,

original: lce dang lus dang de bzhin yid //
analyzed: lce dang lus dang de bzhin yid //
translated: tongue, body, and likewise the mind,

original: gzugs sgra de bzhin dri dang ni //
analyzed: gzugs sgra de bzhin dri dang ni //
translated: form, sound, and likewise smell,

original: ro dang de bzhin reg bya nyid //
analyzed: ro dang de bzhin reg bya nyid //
translated: taste, and likewise touch,🔽and the nature of the realm of phenomena—

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // rigs ni 'di rnams drug yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // rigs ni 'di rnams drug yin no //
translated: these are the six families.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: In brief, they are of five kinds.

original: zhes pa ni de rnams mdor bsdus pa las rnam pa lnga ste yid de rnams la bshad do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de rnams mdor bsdus pa las rnam pa lnga ste yid de rnams la bshad do //
translated: From the brief summary, they are of five kinds, explained as those minds.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: later they become of three kinds.

original: zhes pa ni skus ni rnam pa snang mdzad dang don yod grub pa dag / thabs shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ni skus ni rnam pa snang mdzad dang don yod grub pa dag / thabs shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: By body, Vairochana and Amoghasiddhi are established as the nature of method and wisdom, respectively.

original: rnam par snang mdzad du don yod grub pa bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad du don yod grub pa bsdus so //
translated: Thus, Amoghasiddhi is included in Vairochana.

original: gsung ni 'od dpag med dang rin chen 'byung ldan dag de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: gsung ni 'od dpag med dang rin chen 'byung ldan dag de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pas so //
translated: By speech, Amitabha and Ratnasambhava are established in the same way.

original: 'od dpag tu med du rin chen 'byung ldan bsdus so //🔽thugs kyis ni sku dang gsung de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pas rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag med bsdus pas so //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med du rin chen 'byung ldan bsdus so // thugs kyis ni sku dang gsung de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pas rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag med bsdus pas so //
translated: Thus, Ratnasambhava is included in Amitabha.🔽By mind, Vairochana and Amitabha are established in the same way.🔽Thus, they are included in Amoghasiddhi.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: later, there are three aspects.

original: zhes pa ni 'gyur bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'gyur bar grags pa'o //
translated: This is well known.🔽Also:

original: yang na / rigs ni rnam pa drug tu brjod //
analyzed: yang na / rigs ni rnam pa drug tu brjod //
translated: The family is said to be of six types.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: In brief, there are five types.

original: zhes pa la rnam pa drug gi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la rnam pa drug gi rnam pa ste /
translated: There are six types of aspects.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang de rnams drug po de bshad pa'i rigs yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang de rnams drug po de bshad pa'i rigs yin no //
translated: The nature of the eye, etc. is the six kinds of consciousness.

original: sku bdag med ma de len cing 'dzin par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid du 'jug pas ni rigs so //
analyzed: sku bdag med ma de len cing 'dzin par byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid du 'jug pas ni rigs so //
translated: It is proper that one should take up and hold the body of Nairatmya, since one enters into the nature of the self by means of the nature of the self.

original: bshad pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: Explanation is knowledge.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: mdor bsdus pa ste bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ste bsdu ba'o //
translated: In brief, that is, in summary.

original: de rnams @50a * //
analyzed: de rnams @50a * //
translated: Those

original: slar rnam pa lnga ste rnam pa lnga ni spro ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: slar rnam pa lnga ste rnam pa lnga ni spro ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: are again fivefold, fivefold by the method of expansion.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: later they become threefold.

original: zhes pa la gang rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa de rnams ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la gang rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa de rnams ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, those that are threefold are threefold by nature.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid dbyer med pa'o //
translated: They are the nature of body, speech, and mind, and are indivisible.

original: de nyid gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid gcig gi tshig go //
translated: That is the word for one.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: How?🔽By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: zhes pa la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: they become the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: dbye ba yis zhes pa ni spro ba'i tshul gyis so sor rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba yis zhes pa ni spro ba'i tshul gyis so sor rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: “By divisions” means by the mode of emanation, individually established.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis te sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyi dbye ba ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis te sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams kyi dbye ba ste /
translated: By the divisions of body, speech, and mind, that is, by the divisions of body, speech, and mind.

original: shin tu 'das pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu 'das pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they are utterly transcendent, they are said to be “without intrinsic nature.”🔽The five families, the five elements, and the five aggregates

original: rigs dang 'byung ba lnga rnams dang // phung po lnga yi rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: rigs dang 'byung ba lnga rnams dang // phung po lnga yi rang bzhin gyi //
translated: are the nature of the fivefold enumeration.

original: rigs dang bgrang bya 'di yis ni //
analyzed: rigs dang bgrang bya 'di yis ni //
translated: By this enumeration of the families,

original: rigs zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
analyzed: rigs zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
translated: they are expressed as families.

original: zhes pa ni gang mi bskyod pa la sogs pas de rnams ni rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang mi bskyod pa la sogs pas de rnams ni rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: The five families are Akṣobhya and so on. They are fivefold.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye bas gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye bas gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the divisions of body, speech, and mind, they are three.

original: rigs de rnams nyid ni /
analyzed: rigs de rnams nyid ni /
translated: Those very families

original: ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: are taught as they are.

original: rigs bgrang bar bya ba'i grangs kyis yongs su gcod pas na rigs te rgyu des na mngon par brjod do ;
analyzed: rigs bgrang bar bya ba'i grangs kyis yongs su gcod pas na rigs te rgyu des na mngon par brjod do ;
translated: The families are fully determined by the enumeration of the families. For that reason, they are expressed.

original: /'byung ba lnga rnams dang zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba lnga rnams so //
analyzed: /'byung ba lnga rnams dang zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba lnga rnams so //
translated: The five elements are the five elements of earth and so forth.

original: de nyid phung po lnga'i rang bzhin rnams te //
analyzed: de nyid phung po lnga'i rang bzhin rnams te //
translated: They are the nature of the five aggregates.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: gang la de ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang la de ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Where those are the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de rnams kyi rigs nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rigs nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is their type?

original: gsungs pa / rigs bgrang bar bya ba'i grangs kyis yongs su gcod pas na rigs te rgyu des nga bshad do //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rigs bgrang bar bya ba'i grangs kyis yongs su gcod pas na rigs te rgyu des nga bshad do //
translated: It is said: Type is defined by the enumeration of types. Therefore, I explain it.

original: yang na rigs dang zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: yang na rigs dang zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Or, type is the nature of Yoginī Nairātmya.

original: 'byung ba lnga rnams ni rgyas par rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du des rnam par gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga rnams ni rgyas par rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du des rnam par gzhag pa rnams so //
translated: The five elements are extensively established by that as they really are by nature.

original: phung po lnga yi rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: phung po lnga yi rang bzhin gyi //
translated: The nature of the five aggregates

original: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: is the aggregate of form and so forth.

original: de yang lnga po ni rgyas par te /
analyzed: de yang lnga po ni rgyas par te /
translated: That is also the five, extensively.

original: rgyu 'dis na rang bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de yod pa yin pas na rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis na rang bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de yod pa yin pas na rang bzhin no //
translated: For this reason, it is the nature itself, just as it is, and since it exists, it is the nature.

original: de rnams kyi rigs bgrang @50b bar bya ba lnga po nyid so so lnga'i rang bzhin rnams te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rigs bgrang @50b bar bya ba lnga po nyid so so lnga'i rang bzhin rnams te /
translated: The enumeration of their families is the fivefold itself, the natures of the individual five.

original: de yang re re zhing lnga'o rang bzhin yin pas mtha' yas pa grangs med pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang re re zhing lnga'o rang bzhin yin pas mtha' yas pa grangs med pa yin no //
translated: And each of those is fivefold, so the natures are infinite, innumerable.

original: rgyu 'dis na rigs te des na de'i rang bzhin gyis mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis na rigs te des na de'i rang bzhin gyis mngon par brjod do //
translated: For this reason, it is the family, and thus its nature is expressed by that.

original: kun nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: kun nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is completely established.

original: 'dis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa nyid kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa nyid kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: By this, it is the vajra holder, because the conventional and the ultimate are not different.

original: de nyid bsgom med sgom pa med //
analyzed: de nyid bsgom med sgom pa med //
translated: That itself is the meditation of nonmeditation.

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: It is taught:

original: rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin nyid med pa ste /
translated: The three vajras are not different, so the nature of the five aggregates does not exist.

original: gzugs med mthong ba po yang med //
analyzed: gzugs med mthong ba po yang med //
translated: There is no form, and there is no seer.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan zin pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan zin pa'o //
translated: And so forth has already been explained.

original: de bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The summary of that is stated:

original: sgom pa po ni lta ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa po ni lta ba po med pa'o //
translated: The meditator is not the seer.

original: bsgom bya ba ni gzugs med do //
analyzed: bsgom bya ba ni gzugs med do //
translated: The object of meditation is formless.

original: sngags med ces pa ni /
analyzed: sngags med ces pa ni /
translated: There is no mantra.

original: sngags kyi sgras rna ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi sgras rna ba yang med pa'o //
translated: By the word mantra, the ear is also absent.

original: lha med ces pa ni dri yang med la rna ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: lha med ces pa ni dri yang med la rna ba yang med pa'o //
translated: There is no god, and there is no smell, and there is no ear.

original: 'dis ni sku dang gsung dang thugs gsum ka yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sku dang gsung dang thugs gsum ka yang med pa yin no //
translated: By this, the body, speech, and mind are all absent.

original: 'o na thams cad stong pa nyid yin na chad ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thams cad stong pa nyid yin na chad ltar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, if everything is emptiness, it becomes nihilism.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: lha dang sngags ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: lha dang sngags ni yang dag gnas //
translated: The god and the mantra are truly present.

original: zhes pa'o // ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: spros pa med pa'i bzhin las zhes pa ste sngags dang lha gsung rdo rje dang / thugs rdo rje dag spros pa'i sku de yang ma lus par de la ltos pa'i phyir thams cad nyid rang rang gi ngo bo la gas pa yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i bzhin las zhes pa ste sngags dang lha gsung rdo rje dang / thugs rdo rje dag spros pa'i sku de yang ma lus par de la ltos pa'i phyir thams cad nyid rang rang gi ngo bo la gas pa yin pa'i don to //
translated: From the face of non-elaboration, the mantra and the god, the vajra of speech and the vajra of mind, the body that is elaborated, that also is without remainder, because it depends on that. The meaning is that everything itself is broken into its own nature.

original: yang na sgom pa po med ces pa ni 'dzin pa nyid kyis gang brtags pa de bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na sgom pa po med ces pa ni 'dzin pa nyid kyis gang brtags pa de bkag pa yin no //
translated: Or, there is no meditator. By the negation, that which is imagined by the apprehender is negated.

original: bsgom bya med ces pa ni gzung bar bya ba nyid du gang brtags pa de bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom bya med ces pa ni gzung bar bya ba nyid du gang brtags pa de bkag pa yin no //
translated: The phrase nothing to meditate on is a negation of anything that is imagined to be an object of meditation.

original: de lta bas na sngags med pa ni mtshan ma med pa yin te ;
analyzed: de lta bas na sngags med pa ni mtshan ma med pa yin te ;
translated: Thus, the absence of mantra is the absence of signs,

original: / mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: / mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of the absence of signs.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi lha yang med ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi lha yang med ste /
translated: There is also no deity that has the nature of consciousness.

original: 'dis ni bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dag bkag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dag bkag pa'o //
translated: This negates both the object of meditation and the meditator.

original: cho ga yang bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: cho ga yang bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The ritual is also taught,

original: sngags dang lhan cig gnas pa las so //
analyzed: sngags dang lhan cig gnas pa las so //
translated: because of the presence of mantra.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽spros pa'i rang bzhin las zhes pa ste spros pa ni rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / spros pa'i rang bzhin las zhes pa ste spros pa ni rgyas pa ste /
translated: How so?

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: From the nature of elaboration, that is, from the nature of the relative truth.

original: spros pa med pa de nyid las 'di rnams thams cad byung ba yin te /
analyzed: spros pa med pa de nyid las 'di rnams thams cad byung ba yin te /
translated: From the absence of elaboration, all of this arises,

original: 'di'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is its nature.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin yang dngos po med pas 'di rnams bkag pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin yang dngos po med pas 'di rnams bkag pa ni med do //
translated: And since its nature is nonexistence, these are not negated.🔽Or else,

original: yang na / spros pa med pa'i @51a * //
analyzed: yang na / spros pa med pa'i @51a * //
translated: from the absence of elaboration,

original: rang bzhin las //
analyzed: rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature.

original: zhes pa ni spros pa las 'das pa'i phyir sngags dang lha mtshan ma dang mtshan med pa dag tu gnas pa'i rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed ba nyid de kho na nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni spros pa las 'das pa'i phyir sngags dang lha mtshan ma dang mtshan med pa dag tu gnas pa'i rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed ba nyid de kho na nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the indivisibility of the three vajras, which abide as mantra and deity, with and without signs, as thatness, because they are beyond conceptual elaboration.

original: sgom pa po med bsgom pa med //
analyzed: sgom pa po med bsgom pa med //
translated: There is no meditator, no meditation.

original: ces pa ni bdag gi de kho na nyid rdo rje rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni bdag gi de kho na nyid rdo rje rim par phye ba'o //
translated: This is the chapter on the reality of the self.

original: sngags med ces pa ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid de sngags kyi rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: sngags med ces pa ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid de sngags kyi rim par phye ba'o //
translated: Without mantra. This is the chapter on the reality of mantra.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni lha'i de kho na nyid de lha'i rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni lha'i de kho na nyid de lha'i rim par phye ba'o //
translated: The deity. This is the chapter on the reality of the deity.

original: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature free of conceptual elaboration.

original: lha dang sngags ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: lha dang sngags ni yang dag gnas //
translated: The deity and mantra are perfectly present.

original: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi da kho na nyid dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi da kho na nyid dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o //
translated: This is the chapter on the reality of gnosis, the stage of empowerment.

original: de ltar bsgom pa nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnam par snang bar snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs lngar gyur pa yin pas gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnam par snang bar snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs lngar gyur pa yin pas gsungs pa //
translated: Since the eye and so on are the five families of Vairochana and so on, by meditating in that way, it is said:🔽Vairochana, Akshobhya, Amoghasiddhi,

original: rnam snang mi bskyod don yod pa dang // rin chen dpag med sems dpa' can //
analyzed: rnam snang mi bskyod don yod pa dang // rin chen dpag med sems dpa' can //
translated: Ratnasambhava, and Amitabha.

original: zhes pa smos te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug rnams ni bsgom par bya ba nyid kyis sgom par byed par rnam par gzhag pa rnam par shes pa'i nang du thim pa'i phyir /
