analyzed: zhes pa smos te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug rnams ni bsgom par bya ba nyid kyis sgom par byed par rnam par gzhag pa rnam par shes pa'i nang du thim pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the six objects such as form and so on are established as the meditator by virtue of being the object of meditation, they are the meditator because they dissolve into the consciousness.

original: sems dpa' can te thams cad nyid la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' can te thams cad nyid la yod pa yin no //
translated: They are the “possessor of the sattva” because they exist in all.🔽Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva,

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang // thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang // thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //
translated: and all are said to be the Buddha.

original: phung po lnga'i gzugs nyid de kho na nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i gzugs nyid de kho na nyid du brjod do //
translated: The form aggregate is said to be reality.

original: sems dpa' can yang /
analyzed: sems dpa' can yang /
translated: The possessor of the sattva

original: sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //
analyzed: sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //
translated: is the sattva who is the one of the three existences.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is stated by the words.

original: bsgom par bya ba dang sgom par byed pa gnyi ga dbyer med par bde ba la sogs pa rnam par rtogs shing khong du chud pa'i phyir srid gsum mo //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba dang sgom par byed pa gnyi ga dbyer med par bde ba la sogs pa rnam par rtogs shing khong du chud pa'i phyir srid gsum mo //
translated: The three worlds are the non-duality of the object of meditation and the meditator, because of the realization and comprehension of bliss, etc.

original: de yi gcig pa ni dbyer med pa yin te /
analyzed: de yi gcig pa ni dbyer med pa yin te /
translated: Their oneness is non-duality,

original: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin du brjod do //
translated: and is described as the nature of reality.

original: yang na tshangs pa rnam par snang mdzad do //🔽khyab 'jug ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa rnam par snang mdzad do // khyab 'jug ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, Brahma is Vairochana,🔽Vishnu is Akshobhya,

original: zhi ba ni don yod pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni don yod pa'o //
translated: Shiva is Amoghasiddhi,

original: thams cad ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: thams cad ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: all is Ratnasambhava,

original: sangs rgyas ni 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'od dpag med do //
translated: and the Buddha is Amitabha.

original: de nyid ni sems dpa' can no //
analyzed: de nyid ni sems dpa' can no //
translated: That is the nature of the bodhisattvas.

original: yang na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs drug po rnams de'i rang bzhin des lnga nyid mtha' yas pa'i rigs su 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs drug po rnams de'i rang bzhin des lnga nyid mtha' yas pa'i rigs su 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
translated: Alternatively, the six families of Vairochana, etc., are his nature, and he is said to be the infinite family of the five.🔽Vairochana, Akshobhya, Amoghasiddhi,

original: rnam snang mi bskyod don yod dang // rin chen dpag med sems dpa' can //
analyzed: rnam snang mi bskyod don yod dang // rin chen dpag med sems dpa' can //
translated: Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and the bodhisattvas.

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang // thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //🔽ces @51b pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang // thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod // ces @51b pa'o //
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, and Siva are all said to be the Buddha himself.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin pas de kho na nyid du 'thad na tshangs pa la sogs pa yang ji ltar yin zhe na /🔽gsungs pa / tshangs pa sgrib bral sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin pas de kho na nyid du 'thad na tshangs pa la sogs pa yang ji ltar yin zhe na / gsungs pa / tshangs pa sgrib bral sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: If it is reasonable that Vairocana and so forth are the Tathagata himself, how is it that Brahma and so forth are also?

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: It is said:🔽Brahma is the Buddha, free from obscuration.

original: tshangs pa yang mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pas so //
analyzed: tshangs pa yang mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pas so //
translated: Brahma also is the realization of nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni brjod ces pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni brjod ces pa ste /
translated: Buddha means is said to be.

original: nyi tshe ba'i rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'jug phyir khyab 'jug nyid du brjod //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i rtogs pa'i phyir ro // 'jug phyir khyab 'jug nyid du brjod //
translated: Because of limited realization.🔽Vishnu is said to be because of entering.

original: ces pa ni gnas nyams nas 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni gnas nyams nas 'jig pa ste /
translated: It is said that entering is the destruction of the abode.

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir khyab 'jug nyi tshe ba'i rtogs pas gnas so //🔽yang na 'jug pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir khyab 'jug nyi tshe ba'i rtogs pas gnas so // yang na 'jug pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Because of the nature of destruction, Vishnu abides with limited realization.🔽Or, entering means

original: 'jug pa 'jug pa ste ;
analyzed: 'jug pa 'jug pa ste ;
translated: entering into.

original: / thams cad la zhugs nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / thams cad la zhugs nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of entering into everything.

original: spro ba tsam gyis rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: spro ba tsam gyis rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: It is the mere expansion of that which is the abode of all things.

original: khyab 'jug sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: khyab 'jug sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called Viṣṇu, Buddha.

original: rtag tu dge bas zhi ba nyid //
analyzed: rtag tu dge bas zhi ba nyid //
translated: It is always peace, because of the generation of virtue.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: zhi ba ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: Peace is Maheśvara.

original: de yang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas so //
translated: And he is the Buddha.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rtag par kun du dge bskyed pa'i phyir te 'di yang nyi tshe ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtag par kun du dge bskyed pa'i phyir te 'di yang nyi tshe ba nyid yin no //
translated: Because he always generates virtue. This is also limited.

original: thams cad kun gyi bdag nyid gnas //
analyzed: thams cad kun gyi bdag nyid gnas //
translated: The abode of the nature of all things.

original: zhes pa ni thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni 'di thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //🔽gnas ni gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thams cad kyang thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni 'di thams cad kyi bdag nyid do // gnas ni gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: All things are the nature of all things.

original: mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //🔽dam pa'i bde bas de nyid de //
analyzed: mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro // dam pa'i bde bas de nyid de //
translated: Abode is because of the nature of the self imagined by the tīrthikas.🔽It is that, because of the realization of bliss.

original: bde ba rtogs phyir rnam sangs rgyas //
analyzed: bde ba rtogs phyir rnam sangs rgyas //
translated: It is the Buddha, because of the realization of bliss.

original: zhes pa la sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rnam par sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rnam par sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is the one who is fully enlightened.

original: bde bar rtogs phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bde bar rtogs phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: Because of the realization of bliss.

original: stong pa nyid bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor ma rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor ma rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of not realizing the emptiness of self,

original: mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the yoginīs.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dam pa'i bde ba ni yang dag pas te /
analyzed: dam pa'i bde ba ni yang dag pas te /
translated: The highest bliss is the reality,

original: rgyu 'dis ni de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis ni de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: because of that cause.🔽Or, Vairocana, Akṣobhya, Amoghasiddhi,

original: yang na / rnam snang mi bskyod don yod dang / rin chen dpag med sems dpa' can //
analyzed: yang na / rnam snang mi bskyod don yod dang / rin chen dpag med sems dpa' can //
translated: Ratnasambhava, Amitābha, and the bodhisattvas,

original: zhes pa ni 'dis ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug rnams thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin des tshangs pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dis ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug rnams thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pas phung po lnga'i rang bzhin des tshangs pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: by this verse he explains that the six sense faculties such as the eyes and the six sense objects such as form, by the inseparability of method and wisdom, are the nature of the five aggregates, and therefore Brahmā and so on are the nature of the tathāgatas.

original: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang // thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //
analyzed: tshangs pa khyab 'jug zhi ba dang // thams cad sangs rgyas de nyid brjod //
translated: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Śiva, and all are said to be the buddhas.

original: ces pas tshangs pa nyid khyab 'jug ste /
analyzed: ces pas tshangs pa nyid khyab 'jug ste /
translated: By this verse, Brahmā is Viṣṇu.

original: tshangs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is Brahmā?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / tshangs pa mya ngan ngan 'das sangs rgyas //🔽@52a * // zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / tshangs pa mya ngan ngan 'das sangs rgyas //🔽@52a * // zhes pa ste /
translated: Brahmā is the buddha of nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin tshangs pa don dam pa'i bden pa des rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin tshangs pa don dam pa'i bden pa des rnam par gnas so //
translated: By that Brahman, the ultimate truth, which is the nature of nirvana, he abides.

original: 'jug phyir khyab 'jug nyid du brjod //
analyzed: 'jug phyir khyab 'jug nyid du brjod //
translated: He is called Vishnu because he pervades.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is saying:

original: thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir spro ba'i tshul gyis bdag nyid des kun rdzob kyi bden par rnam par gnas pas kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa ni de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir spro ba'i tshul gyis bdag nyid des kun rdzob kyi bden par rnam par gnas pas kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa ni de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: Because he pervades everything, he abides in conventional truth by the method of expansion. Therefore, the non-difference of the conventional and the ultimate is reality.

original: tshangs pa nyid khyab 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa nyid khyab 'jug ste /
translated: Brahman is Vishnu

original: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of non-duality.

original: de nyid brjod ces pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod ces pa ni /
translated: That itself is said to be

original: zhi ba nyid thams cad la de yang de kho na nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: zhi ba nyid thams cad la de yang de kho na nyid ces brjod do //
translated: peace. That is also said to be reality in everything.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rtag tu dge ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag tu dge ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is always virtuous.

original: thams cad nyid rang bzhin med pa des dge ba bskyed pa'i phyir bsdu ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: thams cad nyid rang bzhin med pa des dge ba bskyed pa'i phyir bsdu ba'i tshul lo //
translated: By that absence of intrinsic nature in everything, virtue is generated. This is the method of inclusion.🔽The abode of the nature of everything

original: thams cad kun gyi bdag nyid gnas ni 'di rnams thams cad kyi lus la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kun gyi bdag nyid gnas ni 'di rnams thams cad kyi lus la gnas pa yin te /
translated: is present in the body of everything.

original: spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides in the manner of expansion.

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid des gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid des gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir de kho na nyid du brjod do //
translated: By that very nature of expansion and contraction, it is said to be reality, because both are inseparable.

original: de nyid rnam sangs rgyas te khyab par du 'phags pa'i rtogs pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam sangs rgyas te khyab par du 'phags pa'i rtogs pas gnas pa'o //
translated: It is fully enlightened, abiding in the realization of the exalted.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bde ba rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is the realization of bliss,

original: khams gsum stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis snang bas so //
analyzed: khams gsum stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis snang bas so //
translated: because the three realms are illuminated by the nature of emptiness.

original: dam pa'i bde ba yang dag pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i bde ba yang dag pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: It is the highest bliss, because it is reality itself.

original: yang na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sems dpa' can gyi bar du drug dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa de nyid brjod kyi bar du drug ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sems dpa' can gyi bar du drug dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa de nyid brjod kyi bar du drug ste /
translated: Alternatively, there are six, from Vairochana up to Sattvavajrā, and six from Brahma up to Tathagatavādī.

original: drug po 'di gnyi ga sems dpa' can dang tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: drug po 'di gnyi ga sems dpa' can dang tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: Both of these six are not different from Sattvavajrā,

original: sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs dbyer med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they realize the inseparability of body, speech, and mind.

original: lnga po gnyi ga'i de kho na nyid rnams ye shes kyi bdag nyid de nam mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: lnga po gnyi ga'i de kho na nyid rnams ye shes kyi bdag nyid de nam mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The reality of both the five and the five is the nature of intuition, the mandala of the nature of the fifteen dakinis.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin de /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin de /
translated: That, which is the nature of means and insight,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: is the mandala of Vajradhara, which has the nature of the eighteen aggregates, elements, and sense-fields.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag dbyer med pa des rdo rje 'dzin pa rdzogs pa te /
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dag dbyer med pa des rdo rje 'dzin pa rdzogs pa te /
translated: The mandala of intuition and the mandala of commitment, which are the indivisibility of both, are indivisible, and thus Vajradhara is perfected.

original: mi bskyed pa nyid rdo rje 'dzin par rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi bskyed pa nyid rdo rje 'dzin par rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not generated, it is perfected as Vajradhara.

original: lha'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bye brag tu bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bye brag tu bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: In order to realize the nature of the deities, a special explanation is stated:

original: gang phyir lus su 'byung ba nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir lus su 'byung ba nyid //
translated: Since it is the very emergence of the body,

original: lha zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
analyzed: lha zhes mngon par brjod par bya //
translated: it is to be called a deity.

original: zhes pa la //
analyzed: zhes pa la //
translated: With the words

original: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig @52b gis so //
analyzed: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig @52b gis so //
translated: The great intuition abides in the body.

original: yang na lus phung po lnga'i bdag nyid bsags pa'i rang bzhin du byung nas /
analyzed: yang na lus phung po lnga'i bdag nyid bsags pa'i rang bzhin du byung nas /
translated: Or else, the body is the nature of the collection of the five aggregates, and having arisen,

original: de'i bdag nyid du gnas par gyur pas lha yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gnas par gyur pas lha yin no //
translated: it abides in the nature of that, and so is a god.

original: brjod par bya zhes pa ni gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya zhes pa ni gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: The word is is a clarifier.

original: de nyid bcom ldan lha yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan lha yin no //
translated: That itself is the Bhagavān, the god.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la bcom pa yod pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la bcom pa yod pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod do //
translated: Because bhagavat is said to be the Buddha Bhagavān, who has destroyed.

original: bcom pa'i sgra nyid kyis ci brjod pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom pa'i sgra nyid kyis ci brjod pa de gsungs pa /
translated: The word bhagavat itself expresses what is said, so he says:

original: bcom pa rnam pa drug tu brjod //
analyzed: bcom pa rnam pa drug tu brjod //
translated: Bhagavat is said to be the sixfold destruction.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa yon tan kun //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa yon tan kun //
translated: All the qualities of Īśvara,

original: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdud //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdud //
translated: or else, the destruction of the afflictions, and so on, the demons,

original: 'joms phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod //
analyzed: 'joms phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod //
translated: is said to be the Bhagavān.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: This is said.

original: dbang phyug la sogs yon tan kun //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs yon tan kun //
translated: All the qualities of Īśvara,

original: zhes pa ni //
analyzed: zhes pa ni //
translated: and so on,🔽are glory, fame, wisdom,

original: dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste //
analyzed: dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste //
translated: Īśvara, good form, and perfect effort.

original: drug po de la ldan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: drug po de la ldan zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those six are said to be possessed.

original: dbang phyug bzang zhes pa ni bag chags mtha' dag spangs pa'i bdag nyid kun rdzob dang don dam par dbyer med pa'i ngo bo shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ni phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug bzang zhes pa ni bag chags mtha' dag spangs pa'i bdag nyid kun rdzob dang don dam par dbyer med pa'i ngo bo shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ni phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The good lord is the perfect, the utterly pure intuition, the identity of the ultimate and the superficial, which is the self that has abandoned all instincts.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa de rab tu goms par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa de rab tu goms par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is good because it is the basis of the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: gzugs bzang zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan lta bur dngos po thams cad yang dag pa'i lta ba'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyu me long lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzugs bzang zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan lta bur dngos po thams cad yang dag pa'i lta ba'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyu me long lta bu ste /
translated: The good form is the mirror-like intuition, the cause of the arising of the intuition of the right view of all things, like a reflection.

original: gzugs bzang ba'o //🔽grags pa bzang zhes pa ni /🔽thugs rje la sogs pa yon tan rin po che'i mthus 'gro ba dag la sman pa'i nus pa des grags pa bzang ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs bzang ba'o // grags pa bzang zhes pa ni / thugs rje la sogs pa yon tan rin po che'i mthus 'gro ba dag la sman pa'i nus pa des grags pa bzang ba ste /
translated: It is good form.🔽The good fame is the intuition of the fulfillment of duty, which is the cause of the fame of the Buddha's good qualities, such as compassion, in the world by the power of those jewels of good qualities.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad la brten nas bdag por sbyar ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad la brten nas bdag por sbyar ba mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: It is good fame because it is the cause of the fame of the good qualities.🔽The good birth is the intuition of the accomplishment of duty, which is the cause of the birth of the Bodhisattvas in the lineage of the Tathagatas.

original: dpal bzang po ni dngos po thams cad phyin ci ma log pa'i so sor rtog pa des so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dpal bzang po ni dngos po thams cad phyin ci ma log pa'i so sor rtog pa des so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Śrībhadra is the discernment of all things without error, which is the wisdom of discernment.

original: brtson 'grus bzang po zhes pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus bzang po zhes pa ni /
translated: Śubhavīrya is

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa rab tu goms par byas pa bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa rab tu goms par byas pa bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: the wisdom of accomplishment, which is the purification of the perfection of diligence.

original: ye shes bzang po ni /
analyzed: ye shes bzang po ni /
translated: Śubhajñāna is

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyi ye shes dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyi ye shes dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the wisdom of the ultimate realm, which is the emptiness endowed with all supreme aspects, the natural wisdom.

original: 'di ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: This is the lord who is the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: bcom pa drug de la yod pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das so //🔽yang zhes pa ni @53a * //
analyzed: bcom pa drug de la yod pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das so // yang zhes pa ni @53a * //
translated: He is the Bhagavān because he has conquered the six afflictions.🔽Again is

original: phyogs gzhan no //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan no //
translated: another direction.

original: nyon mongs la sogs zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang / phung po lnga'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs la sogs zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang / phung po lnga'i bdud dang / lha'i bu'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag rnams so //
translated: The afflictions and so on refers to the afflictions and the secondary afflictions, the thoroughly afflicted, the demon of the aggregates, the demon of the son of the gods, and the demon of death.

original: 'joms phyir ni /
analyzed: 'joms phyir ni /
translated: The Buddha is the Bhagavat because he has conquered them.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Bhagavat because he is free from obscurations.

original: yang na 'di la bcom pa yod pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rnam pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na 'di la bcom pa yod pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rnam pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bshad do //
translated: Or else, the Buddha is the Bhagavat because he has conquered in this way.

original: bcom pa rnam pa drug ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: bcom pa rnam pa drug ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The conquest is sixfold, and the aspects are six.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mig la sogs pa drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa drug dang / gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa drug dang / gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ste /
translated: The six internal sense spheres, such as the eye, the six external sense spheres, such as form, and the six consciousnesses that are inseparable from those two.

original: de ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched bco brgyad rnams mngon par shes pa drug gi yon tan gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched bco brgyad rnams mngon par shes pa drug gi yon tan gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the eighteen constituents and the aggregates are the nature of the six higher knowledges.

original: brjod pa ni ye shes kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni ye shes kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Speech is the aspect of knowledge.

original: rgyu de'i phyir na dbang phyug la sogs pa bstan pa'i yon tan ma lus par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir na dbang phyug la sogs pa bstan pa'i yon tan ma lus par 'byung ste /
translated: For that reason, all the virtues of the teaching arise from God, etc.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das mchog nyid la yon tan 'di rnams mnga'i gzhan rnams la ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das mchog nyid la yon tan 'di rnams mnga'i gzhan rnams la ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is the supremacy of the Lord, that he has these virtues, but others do not.

original: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdud ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs la sogs bdud ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Or else, the demons of the afflictions, etc., afflict with the afflictions, secondary afflictions, and total afflictions.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa sa rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa sa rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
translated: They operate through attachment to the grasped, the grasper, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa ni dbang po drug rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni dbang po drug rnams so //
translated: The afflictions are the six sense faculties.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni gzung ba'i mngon par zhen pas de rnams la dbang po rnams 'jug pa ste yul la'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni gzung ba'i mngon par zhen pas de rnams la dbang po rnams 'jug pa ste yul la'o //
translated: The secondary afflictions are the engagement of those faculties in their objects through attachment to the grasped.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa la 'jug pas bden pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug 'jug ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa la 'jug pas bden pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug 'jug ste /
translated: The total afflictions are the engagement of the six consciousnesses of truth, etc., through attachment to the grasped and the grasper.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Afflictions, secondary afflictions, and complete affliction.

original: de nyid bdud de /
analyzed: de nyid bdud de /
translated: That itself is Māra.

original: ye shes la sems 'dod pa mi skye bas na bdud do //
analyzed: ye shes la sems 'dod pa mi skye bas na bdud do //
translated: Since the desire for wisdom does not arise, it is Māra.

original: de rnams bcom pa ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas te de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de rnams bcom pa ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas te de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The destruction of those is the nature of the extremely pure dharmadhātu, which is the abode. Therefore, he is the Bhagavān.

original: da ni skyed byed ma dang srid mo zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: da ni skyed byed ma dang srid mo zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bstan nas /
translated: Now, having briefly explained the mother and sister, and so on,

original: rgyas par bshad pa don gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa don gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: the extensive explanation of the other meaning is stated.

original: shes rab ma zhes brjod par bya //
analyzed: shes rab ma zhes brjod par bya //
translated: It should be called the mother of wisdom.

original: zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa smos te /
translated: It is said:

original: 'dir skye 'gro rnams skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir skye 'gro rnams skyed pa'o //
translated: Here, beings are generated.

original: shes @53b rab sring mo zhes bya nyid //
analyzed: shes @53b rab sring mo zhes bya nyid //
translated: The sister is called wisdom.

original: gang phyir skal pa stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir skal pa stong pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the emptiness of fortune,

original: don ni shin tu gsal ba nyid do //🔽yang na / shes rab ma zhes brjod par bya //
analyzed: don ni shin tu gsal ba nyid do // yang na / shes rab ma zhes brjod par bya //
translated: the meaning is very clear.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: Or, it should be called the mother of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi sgras mchog tu byung ba'i ye shes shes rab de shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi sgras mchog tu byung ba'i ye shes shes rab de shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The word “wisdom” refers to the supreme wisdom, which is the consciousness that is utterly pure.

original: de ni ma zhes brjod par bya ni /
analyzed: de ni ma zhes brjod par bya ni /
translated: It should be called “mother”

original: gang gi phyir skye 'gro skyed pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye 'gro skyed pas so //
translated: because it gives birth to the world.

original: skye 'gro zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: skye 'gro zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
translated: The “world” refers to the eyes and so on, which are the five aggregates of form and so on.

original: de nyid shes rab sring mo brjod par bya /
analyzed: de nyid shes rab sring mo brjod par bya /
translated: It should be called “sister wisdom”🔽because it shows the world its good fortune.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang phyir skal pa ston pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir skal pa ston pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it shows good fortune.

original: shes rab sring mor brjod par bya //
analyzed: shes rab sring mor brjod par bya //
translated: It should be called “sister wisdom.”

original: zhes pa ste skal pa ni yul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste skal pa ni yul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'byed pa'o //
translated: Good fortune refers to the discernment of the nature of objects and so on.

original: ston pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: Showing means realizing.

original: yang na cha dang bral ba ni skal pa de dbyer med pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na cha dang bral ba ni skal pa de dbyer med pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Alternatively, being partless is the meaning of “indivisible good fortune.”

original: de 'di ltar ston pa ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar ston pa ste /
translated: It shows in the following way:

original: chos thams cad ni sems kyi lus nyid yin pas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems kyi lus nyid yin pas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “All phenomena are the body of mind.”

original: btso blag ma dang bu mo dang // gar mkhan ma yang brjod par bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: btso blag ma dang bu mo dang // gar mkhan ma yang brjod par bya // zhes pa ni /
translated: The washerwoman, the girl, and the dancer are also to be mentioned.

original: tshos ma dang gar ma la sogs pa dang / bu mo 'di rnams kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshos ma dang gar ma la sogs pa dang / bu mo 'di rnams kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: The washerwoman, the dancer, and so on, and the girl, are also to be explained.

original: sems can thams cad 'tshod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'tshod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the washing of all beings,

original: btso blag ma zhes de bzhin brjod //
analyzed: btso blag ma zhes de bzhin brjod //
translated: the washerwoman is so called.

original: gar ma dang bu mo dag gang las yin pa de gsungs pa /🔽yon tan 'jo phyir shes rab ni //
analyzed: gar ma dang bu mo dag gang las yin pa de gsungs pa / yon tan 'jo phyir shes rab ni //
translated: The girl and the dancer are from where?

original: bu mo zhes ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: bu mo zhes ni brjod par bya //
translated: Wisdom is called the girl because of the enjoyment of qualities.

original: shes rab gar mar brjod par bya //
analyzed: shes rab gar mar brjod par bya //
translated: Wisdom is called the dancer.

original: ji ltar zhe na g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? Because of movement.

original: de yang don de nyid kyis bu mo'o //
analyzed: de yang don de nyid kyis bu mo'o //
translated: And that is the girl because of that very meaning.🔽Because the Bhagavat is not touched,

original: de bas na snying rje chen po zhes bod pa'o / gang phyir bcom ldan mi reg pa //🔽de phyir g-yung mor brjod par bya /
analyzed: de bas na snying rje chen po zhes bod pa'o / gang phyir bcom ldan mi reg pa // de phyir g-yung mor brjod par bya /
translated: he is called the eunuch.

original: 'di yang bu mo nyid do //🔽a'a li k'a li rab brjod phyir //
analyzed: 'di yang bu mo nyid do // a'a li k'a li rab brjod phyir //
translated: And that is the girl.🔽Because of the recitation of the Alikali,

original: brjod pa bzlas par yang dag pa bshad //
analyzed: brjod pa bzlas par yang dag pa bshad //
translated: recitation is explained as the repetition.

original: ces pa 'dis gdol pa mo dang / bram ze mo dag a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa 'dis gdol pa mo dang / bram ze mo dag a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the candālī and brahminī as existing in the nature of ālikāli.

original: yang na btso blag ma dang bu mo bshad par bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na btso blag ma dang bu mo bshad par bya zhes pa ni /
translated: Or, the washerwoman and the girl are to be explained.

original: sems can thams cad 'tshed pa'i phyir btso blag ma zhes pa la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'tshed pa'i phyir btso blag ma zhes pa la /
translated: The washerwoman is so called because she washes all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: All sentient beings are of the nature of the five aggregates, such as form.

original: de rnams 'dod chags chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis /
analyzed: de rnams 'dod chags chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis /
translated: By the characteristic of passion for desire,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa des rnam par gzhag pa sku rdo rje ma btso blag ma'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa des rnam par gzhag pa sku rdo rje ma btso blag ma'o //
translated: the body vajrī is the washerwoman, who is established by that conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa yang de nyid kyis rnam @54a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa yang de nyid kyis rnam @54a * //
translated: Since the ultimate truth is also established by that,

original: par bzhag pa yin pas yon tan 'jo phyir bu mo yin no //
analyzed: par bzhag pa yin pas yon tan 'jo phyir bu mo yin no //
translated: the girl is so called because she takes the essence.

original: shes rab gar mar brjod par bya ba ni g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab gar mar brjod par bya ba ni g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is said to be the dancing girl because of her movement.

original: snying rje chen po zhes pa ni g-yo ba yin te rlung g-yo ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes pa ni g-yo ba yin te rlung g-yo ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great compassion is the movement, because wind is movement.

original: a'a li k'a li'i bdag nyid kyi rlung gar mkhan ma gsung rdo rje ma ste de yang bu mo'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li'i bdag nyid kyi rlung gar mkhan ma gsung rdo rje ma ste de yang bu mo'o //
translated: The wind of the nature of Īkāli is the dancer, Vakvajra, and she is also a girl.

original: gang phyir bcom ldan mi reg pa //
analyzed: gang phyir bcom ldan mi reg pa //
translated: Since the Bhagavān is not touched,

original: de phyir g-yung mor brjod par bya //
analyzed: de phyir g-yung mor brjod par bya //
translated: therefore, she is called the Yoginī.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement,

original: yid ni dam pa'i bde ba 'dzag / ces pa'i tha tshig gis so //
analyzed: yid ni dam pa'i bde ba 'dzag / ces pa'i tha tshig gis so //
translated: “the mind is the flow of supreme bliss.”

original: thugs rdo rje ma g-yung mo de yang bu mo'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje ma g-yung mo de yang bu mo'o //
translated: The mind-vajra Yoginī is also a girl.

original: 'di rnams kyang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir sprul pa'i sku nyid kyis rdo rje'i rigs te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir sprul pa'i sku nyid kyis rdo rje'i rigs te /
translated: These are the vajra family of the nirmāṇakāya itself, because the three vajras are inseparable.

original: rim par phye ba dang po bdag gi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rim par phye ba dang po bdag gi de kho na nyid do //
translated: This is the first chapter on the reality of the self.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the inseparability of the three vajras, it is said:

original: brjod pa bzlas par yang dag bshad /
analyzed: brjod pa bzlas par yang dag bshad /
translated: Recitation is explained as speech.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement,

original: a'a li gdol pa mo rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: a'a li gdol pa mo rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ma bdag med ma'o //
translated: Īkāli is the untouchable, the yoginī Nairātmyā, because she is the purity of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: k'a li bram ze mo rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir thabs so //
analyzed: k'a li bram ze mo rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir thabs so //
translated: Kāli is the brahmin, the method, because she is the purity of Vairocana.

original: gnyi ga yang brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang brjod pa ste /
translated: Both are said to be the recitation.

original: gnyis su med par rnam par gzhag pa'o //🔽bzlas par yang dag bshad ces pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis su med par rnam par gzhag pa'o // bzlas par yang dag bshad ces pa ni /
translated: It is established as non-dual.🔽“Recitation is explained”

original: nges pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: is taught by the definitive.

original: 'di ni sngags kyi rim par phye ba sngags kyi de kho na nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngags kyi rim par phye ba sngags kyi de kho na nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: This is the division of the stages of mantra, the reality of mantra, the saṃbhogakāya.

original: rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor yin //
analyzed: rkang pa'i rjes ni dkyil 'khor yin //
translated: The foot-print is the maṇḍala.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is saying:

original: rkang pa'i cha des ri mo sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis spro ba yin te /
analyzed: rkang pa'i cha des ri mo sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis spro ba yin te /
translated: The part of the foot is the various patterns of the emanation.

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: It is the maṇḍala of the pledge.

original: nyid phyir dkyil 'khor brjod par bya //
analyzed: nyid phyir dkyil 'khor brjod par bya //
translated: Therefore, the maṇḍala is explained.

original: zhes pa ni //
analyzed: zhes pa ni //
translated: This is saying:

original: nyed cing 'dzin pa mi g-yo bar bya zhing bsdu ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyed cing 'dzin pa mi g-yo bar bya zhing bsdu ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should be steady and hold without wavering. It means to gather.

original: 'di yang dkyil 'khor zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di yang dkyil 'khor zhes brjod do //
translated: This is also called the maṇḍala.

original: 'di ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of gnosis.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are two maṇḍalas.

original: yang na dkyil 'khor yin zhes pa ni rkang pa'i rjes ni rkang pa ye shes te rgyu de'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: yang na dkyil 'khor yin zhes pa ni rkang pa'i rjes ni rkang pa ye shes te rgyu de'i phyir na'o //
translated: Alternatively, the foot-print is the foot of gnosis. It is the maṇḍala because of that cause.

original: rjes ni spro ba ste /
analyzed: rjes ni spro ba ste /
translated: The conclusion is the expansion.

original: 'di ni lha'i de kho na nyid lha'i rim par phye ba chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha'i de kho na nyid lha'i rim par phye ba chos kyi sku'o //
translated: This is the reality of the deity, the division into the stages of the deity, the Dharma body.

original: nyed phyir dkyil 'khor brjod par bya //
analyzed: nyed phyir dkyil 'khor brjod par bya //
translated: The mandala is said to be for the sake of the satisfaction.

original: zhes pa ni spyi bor rang ge rigs kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni spyi bor rang ge rigs kyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the head, the lord of one's own clan.

original: 'dis ni he ru ka rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni he ru ka rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: By this, the Heruka is complete.

original: dbang gi rim par phye ba ye shes kyi de kho na nyid sku gsung dbyer med pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //🔽yang na / nyed phyir @54b dkyil 'khor brjod par bya //
analyzed: dbang gi rim par phye ba ye shes kyi de kho na nyid sku gsung dbyer med pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin no // yang na / nyed phyir @54b dkyil 'khor brjod par bya //
translated: The division into the stages of consecration, the reality of intuition, the indivisibility of body and speech, is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du gyur pa'i //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du gyur pa'i //
translated: Again, the mandala is said to be for the sake of the satisfaction.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rkang pa'i rjes te /
analyzed: rkang pa'i rjes te /
translated: The foot-print.

original: rkang pa ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The foot is the fourth, the innate.

original: tshul 'dis na ri mo ste /
analyzed: tshul 'dis na ri mo ste /
translated: By this method, the picture,

original: dmigs pa'o // de nyid dkyil 'khor zhes brjod de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // de nyid dkyil 'khor zhes brjod de /
translated: the object, is said to be the mandala.

original: mnyes nas bzung bas g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mnyes nas bzung bas g-yo ba med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having pleased, it is held, the nature of immobility. Such is the meaning.

original: rim par phye ba 'di nyid du rdo rje 'dis ni gdab pa nyid //
analyzed: rim par phye ba 'di nyid du rdo rje 'dis ni gdab pa nyid //
translated: This very division is the vajra-seal.

original: des na phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
analyzed: des na phyag rgyar brjod par bya //
translated: Therefore, it is called a seal.

original: zhes bya ba mdor bstan nas de kho na nyid rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba mdor bstan nas de kho na nyid rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus summarized, he explains reality in detail:

original: lag pa bsgyur ba phyag rgya yin //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa bsgyur ba phyag rgya yin // zhes pa ste /
translated: The movement of the hands is the seal.

original: lag pa dag phan tshun brdabs pa'i sgra 'di nyid phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa dag phan tshun brdabs pa'i sgra 'di nyid phyag rgya'o //
translated: This very sound of the hands clapping is the seal.

original: sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The fingers interlaced are also like that.

original: zhes pa ni sor mo rnams phan tshun du nyed pa 'di nyid phyag rgya'o //🔽yang na / lag pa bsgyur ba phyag rgya yin //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sor mo rnams phan tshun du nyed pa 'di nyid phyag rgya'o // yang na / lag pa bsgyur ba phyag rgya yin //
translated: This very interlacing of the fingers is the seal.🔽Or, the movement of the hands is the seal.

original: zhes pa ni ka rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ka rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The hand is Vajradhara.

original: ra bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: ra bdag med ma'o //
translated: The palm is Nairātmyā.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni bsgyur ba sgra'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni bsgyur ba sgra'o //
translated: The movement is the nature of both.

original: phyag rgya yi ni mtshan mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya yi ni mtshan mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes the sign of the seal.

original: rigs lnga'i rim pas rigs brgya la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba tha dad pa dbyer med par 'gyur ro //🔽sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i rim pas rigs brgya la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba tha dad pa dbyer med par 'gyur ro // sor mo nyed pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: By the sequence of the five families, the different divisions of the hundred families and so forth become indivisible.

original: zhes pa ni //
analyzed: zhes pa ni //
translated: The fingers interlaced are also like that.

original: sor mo'i sgras yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin gnyi ga lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rigs lnga'o //🔽de'i nyed pa ni bsdu ba la thug pa'i de nyid de kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: sor mo'i sgras yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin gnyi ga lnga'i bdag nyid kyi rigs lnga'o // de'i nyed pa ni bsdu ba la thug pa'i de nyid de kho na nyid yin te /
translated: The sound of the fingers is the nature of both the object and the sense organ, the nature of the five, the five clans.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis tha mi dad par spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis tha mi dad par spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Its reality is the reality that ends in the gathering, that is, the reality that ends in the gathering of the two mandalas, which is the nature of the emanation and gathering without differentiation.

original: lha ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lha ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The god is of two kinds:

original: sku can dang sngags kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: sku can dang sngags kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: one who has a body and one whose nature is mantra.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas de ji ltar bsgom par bya ba yin pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas de ji ltar bsgom par bya ba yin pa de gsungs pa /
translated: How should the yogin of reality meditate on that?

original: de ni bsam bya zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ni bsam bya zhes pa ste /
translated: That is to be contemplated,

original: de ni bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: that is to be cultivated.

original: gang bsams ni gang dang gang bsams pa'i yul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang bsams ni gang dang gang bsams pa'i yul du byas pa'o //
translated: Whatever is contemplated is whatever is made the object of contemplation.

original: gang las she na gang phyir rnam bsams te sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis gsal par byed pa gang de ni bsam byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las she na gang phyir rnam bsams te sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis gsal par byed pa gang de ni bsam byar 'gyur ro //
translated: From what? From whatever is contemplated, from whatever is made clear by the various methods, that is to be contemplated.

original: yang na de ni bsam bya ba ni de ni gzung bar bya ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na de ni bsam bya ba ni de ni gzung bar bya ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Or, that is to be contemplated is the nature of the object to be apprehended.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: gang phyir rnam bsams te /
analyzed: gang phyir rnam bsams te /
translated: Because of the thought.

original: dbang pos 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis yul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang pos 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis yul du byas pa'o //
translated: The object is made into the nature of the sense organ by the method of grasping.

original: gang bsams dbang po'i rang bzhin gang //
analyzed: gang bsams dbang po'i rang bzhin gang //
translated: What is thought, what is the nature of the sense organ,

original: de'i phyir bsgom bya gzung bar bya ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin de la mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom bya gzung bar bya ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin de la mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: therefore, that object to be meditated upon, which is the nature of the object to be grasped, does not exist.

original: gang phyir rnam bsams @55a * //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang phyir rnam bsams @55a * // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the thought.🔽This is because the object and the sense organ are not different.

original: yul dang dbang po tha mi dad pa'i phyir ye shes dang sku can dang sngags kyi rang bzhin can gyi lha'i de kho na nyid rnal 'byor pas thams cad nyid bsgom par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po tha mi dad pa'i phyir ye shes dang sku can dang sngags kyi rang bzhin can gyi lha'i de kho na nyid rnal 'byor pas thams cad nyid bsgom par bya ba yin te /
translated: The yogin should meditate on the reality of the deity, which is the nature of wisdom, body, and mantra.

original: rim par phye ba dang po dang gnyis pa dang lha'i rim par phye ba dang / dbang bskur ba'i rim par phya ba'o //
analyzed: rim par phye ba dang po dang gnyis pa dang lha'i rim par phye ba dang / dbang bskur ba'i rim par phya ba'o //
translated: The first chapter, the second chapter, the chapter on the stages of the deity, and the chapter on the stages of consecration.

original: lha gang bstan pa de rnams ji ltar bsgom par bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha gang bstan pa de rnams ji ltar bsgom par bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: Having taught the deities, it is said how they should be meditated upon.

original: pha las thob pa'i bde ba gang //
analyzed: pha las thob pa'i bde ba gang //
translated: Whatever bliss is obtained from the father,

original: de yi bde ba rang gis bza' //
analyzed: de yi bde ba rang gis bza' //
translated: that bliss is to be enjoyed by oneself.

original: bde ba gang gis 'chi ba 'di //🔽de yi bde ba bsam gtan brjod //
analyzed: bde ba gang gis 'chi ba 'di // de yi bde ba bsam gtan brjod //
translated: What is the bliss by which this death

original: ces pa smos te /
analyzed: ces pa smos te /
translated: is called meditation?

original: pha zhes pa ni skyed par byed pa'i yid de las gang thob pa'i bde ba gang yang yul dang dbang pos bskyed pa'i ye shes bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: pha zhes pa ni skyed par byed pa'i yid de las gang thob pa'i bde ba gang yang yul dang dbang pos bskyed pa'i ye shes bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The bliss that is obtained from the mind that is the father, the bliss that is generated by the object and the sense faculty, is the bliss, etc.,🔽of the form of intuition.

original: de bza' ba ni nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de bza' ba ni nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: To eat that is to experience it.

original: rang gi zhes pa ni bdag nyid kyis te 'dis ni sems las logs shig pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi zhes pa ni bdag nyid kyis te 'dis ni sems las logs shig pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: One’s own means by oneself. By this it is shown that there is nothing apart from the mind.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
translated: Thus it is said by the noble Nagarjuna:

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa yi phyir //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa yi phyir //
translated: “Because of the variety of inclinations,

original: lha yi dmigs pa sos sor yin //
analyzed: lha yi dmigs pa sos sor yin //
translated: the deity is individually visualized.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje ma gtogs pa //🔽gzhan pa'i lha ni med par brjod //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje ma gtogs pa // gzhan pa'i lha ni med par brjod //
translated: Except for the mind-vajra,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: the other deities are said not to exist.”

original: de'i bde ba ni de nyid ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i bde ba ni de nyid ye shes so //
translated: The bliss of that is that intuition itself.

original: bsam gtan brjod ces pa ni bsam gtan zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan brjod ces pa ni bsam gtan zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: It is called meditation, it is said.

original: 'dir ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud 'dir ro //
translated: Here in this tantra of Hevajra,

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: bde ba gang gis te ye shes gang gis so //
analyzed: bde ba gang gis te ye shes gang gis so //
translated: What is the bliss? What is the knowledge?

original: 'chi ba ni 'chi ba lta bu ste yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'gags pa ste gang ye shes las tha dad pa'i ye shes gzhan rtogs pa ma yin pa de'i don to //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni 'chi ba lta bu ste yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'gags pa ste gang ye shes las tha dad pa'i ye shes gzhan rtogs pa ma yin pa de'i don to //
translated: Death is like death, the cessation of the object, faculty, and consciousness. The meaning is that it is not the realization of another knowledge that is different from knowledge.

original: yang na pha zhes pa ni ;
analyzed: yang na pha zhes pa ni ;
translated: Or else, “father” is

original: / skyed par byed pa thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa dag go //
analyzed: / skyed par byed pa thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa dag go //
translated: the realization of the nature of the indivisible method and wisdom that generates.

original: thob pa'i bde ba gang ni ye shes gang bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i bde ba gang ni ye shes gang bskyed pa'o //
translated: What bliss is generated by what knowledge?

original: ye shes de nyid bza' ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes de nyid bza' ba'o //
translated: That very knowledge is the food.

original: rang gis zhes pa ni rang la rang dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis zhes pa ni rang la rang dmigs pa'o //
translated: “By oneself” means that one observes oneself.

original: bde ba de nyid la 'chi ba //
analyzed: bde ba de nyid la 'chi ba //
translated: That very bliss is death.

original: zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: It is also said.

original: bde ba gang gis ni ye shes gang gis so //
analyzed: bde ba gang gis ni ye shes gang gis so //
translated: What bliss is by what knowledge?

original: 'dir bsam gtan brjod ni 'dir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsam gtan brjod ni 'dir bstan pa ste /
translated: Here, the expression “meditation” is taught here.

original: gnas pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gnas pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as abiding.

original: de bas na skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rnams ye shes gcig la rag las pa yin pas rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i ye shes nyid ni nges pa yin @55b no ;
analyzed: de bas na skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rnams ye shes gcig la rag las pa yin pas rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i ye shes nyid ni nges pa yin @55b no ;
translated: Therefore, since origination, persistence, and destruction depend on a single gnosis, the very gnosis that is not different from the three vajras is the ascertainment.

original: / yang na /
analyzed: / yang na /
translated: Or else,

original: pha las thob pa'i bde ba /
analyzed: pha las thob pa'i bde ba /
translated: the bliss obtained from the father

original: zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i bskyed pa pos bskyed pa ni ye shes gang de nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i bskyed pa pos bskyed pa ni ye shes gang de nyid do //
translated: is the very gnosis that is generated by the generator that is the indivisibility of method and wisdom.

original: bdag nyid bza' ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid bza' ste /
translated: One should eat oneself,

original: bdag nyid kyis zhes yongs su brtag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis zhes yongs su brtag go //
translated: one should imagine oneself.

original: de yang bdag med pa nyid yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang bdag med pa nyid yin par gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said to be selflessness:

original: 'chi bde nyid bde ba yin par brjod de /
analyzed: 'chi bde nyid bde ba yin par brjod de /
translated: the very death is bliss.

original: ye shes de nyid 'chi ba yin par brag pa rgyu gang gis /
analyzed: ye shes de nyid 'chi ba yin par brag pa rgyu gang gis /
translated: The very gnosis is death, for what reason?

original: de bas na ye shes de nyid kyis bsam gtan yang brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na ye shes de nyid kyis bsam gtan yang brjod do //
translated: Therefore, that very gnosis is also said to be concentration.

original: brjod ces pa ni lhan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod ces pa ni lhan pa'o //
translated: “Said” means “is said.”

original: des na 'di thams cad bdag med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di thams cad bdag med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, all of this is selfless,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: because it is pure by nature—this is the meaning.

original: / yang na pha zhes pa ni skyed pa po ste bsam gtan dang bsam par bya ba dag mi phye par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: / yang na pha zhes pa ni skyed pa po ste bsam gtan dang bsam par bya ba dag mi phye par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, “father” is the producer, the realization that meditation and the object of meditation are not differentiated.

original: bde ba gang ni ye shes gang ngo //
analyzed: bde ba gang ni ye shes gang ngo //
translated: “Bliss” is the gnosis.

original: de ni bsam gtan zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called “meditation.”

original: de yang rang ces pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa shin tu rnam par ni 'chi ba ste 'chi ba lta bur dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang ces pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa shin tu rnam par ni 'chi ba ste 'chi ba lta bur dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Very” means that it is like death, because the cessation of the senses, their objects, and the consciousnesses is like death.

original: bde ba gang gis ni ye shes gang gis so //
analyzed: bde ba gang gis ni ye shes gang gis so //
translated: “By which” means by which gnosis.

original: 'dir ni 'dir rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dir rtogs pa ste /
translated: “Here” means in this very life.

original: de ni de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyi ye shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gyi ye shes zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called “the gnosis of meditation endowed with reality.”

original: rim par phye ba bzhi gang bstan pa de thams cad de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rim par phye ba bzhi gang bstan pa de thams cad de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba bsdus pa yin no //
translated: All the fourfold divisions that have been taught are included in the division of reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje las de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje las de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba ste lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth chapter on the procedure of reality in the Hevajra tantra of the body, speech and mind of all the tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi ye shes lnga tha mi dad pa mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi ye shes lnga tha mi dad pa mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: All the tathagatas means the five wisdoms, which are inseparable from the extremely pure dharmadhatu nature of the indivisible method and wisdom, and the wisdom of the consecration of the eyes and so forth.

original: sku gsung thugs zhes pa ni sku gsum byin gyis brlabs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs zhes pa ni sku gsum byin gyis brlabs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Body, speech and mind means the wisdom of the consecration of the three bodies.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid do //🔽de kho na nyid ces pa ni /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid do // de kho na nyid ces pa ni /
translated: Hevajra means the nature of method and wisdom.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin 'di thams cad nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin 'di thams cad nyid yin no //
translated: Reality means this nature of the indivisible wisdom vajra holder.

original: lnga pa ni lnga po rnams ni rdzogs pa ste rgyas pa'o /
analyzed: lnga pa ni lnga po rnams ni rdzogs pa ste rgyas pa'o /
translated: Fifth means the five are complete, that is, extensive.

original: de bas na rdzogs pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na rdzogs pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the perfection itself is the nature of emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdo rje rigs @56a * //🔽kyi rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdo rje rigs @56a * // kyi rim par phye ba'o //
translated: Or else, the division of the vajra family by all the tathāgatas.

original: sku gsung thugs kyis sngags kyi rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyis sngags kyi rim par phye ba'o //
translated: The division of the mantra family by body, speech, and mind.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rjes lha'i rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rjes lha'i rim par phye ba'o //
translated: The division of the deity family by Hevajra.

original: de kho na nyid kyis dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyis dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o //
translated: The division of the empowerment by reality.

original: lnga pa zhes pa de kho na nyid bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: lnga pa zhes pa de kho na nyid bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rim par phye ba'o //
translated: The fifth is the division of the reality that is the nature of the four.

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las /
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the glorious Hevajra, the explanatory tantra called “The Illumination of the Lamp,”

original: de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba ste le'u lnga pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba ste le'u lnga pa'o /
translated: this completes the fifth chapter on the division of reality.

original: // / da ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid bzhi rim par phye ba bzhi dang / de kho na nyid bzhi'i bdag nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba bstan nas /
analyzed: // / da ni ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid kyi de kho na nyid bzhi rim par phye ba bzhi dang / de kho na nyid bzhi'i bdag nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba bstan nas /
translated: Now, having taught the fourfold division of reality, which is the nature of the wisdom maṇḍala and the commitment maṇḍala, and the fourfold division of reality, which is the nature of the true wisdom that is the nature of reality,

original: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor bas ji ltar 'khyam zhing 'khyams pa'i de kho na nyid kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor bas ji ltar 'khyam zhing 'khyams pa'i de kho na nyid kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: in order to teach the result of reality, which is the wandering and wandering of the reality yoga, it is said:

original: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad bya //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad bya //
translated: Now, moreover, I will explain

original: spyod pa pha rol phyin mchog rnams //
analyzed: spyod pa pha rol phyin mchog rnams //
translated: the conduct, the supreme perfections,

original: gang gis dngos grub mthar 'gro ba //
analyzed: gang gis dngos grub mthar 'gro ba //
translated: by which there is the cause of the siddhi

original: kye yi rdo rje dngos grub rgyus //
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje dngos grub rgyus //
translated: of the cause of the siddhi of Hevajra.

original: 'di yi don ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: 'di yi don ni 'di yin te //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas 'khyam pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas 'khyam pa'o //
translated: “Conduct” is the wandering of the reality yoga.

original: de bshad bya ni /
analyzed: de bshad bya ni /
translated: “That” is to be explained.

original: gsung rab kyis bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsung rab kyis bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: “By which” is to be taught by the scriptures.

original: gsung rab ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsung rab ces bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called scriptures are

original: gang 'di nyid bya ba med pas bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di nyid bya ba med pas bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: those which teach the performance of the performance-less.

original: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
translated: How is it distinguished?

original: pha rol phyin zhes pa ste rab tu gsal ba'i mthar thug pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol phyin zhes pa ste rab tu gsal ba'i mthar thug pa thob pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection, which is the attainment of the ultimate clarity.

original: de nyid mchog ste dam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mchog ste dam pa'o //
translated: That itself is the best, the highest,

original: dman pa la mos pa'i nyon thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa la mos pa'i nyon thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the object of the disciples and so on who are devoted to the inferior.🔽For what purpose is the performance itself taught?

original: ci'i don du spyad pa nyid bya ba yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i don du spyad pa nyid bya ba yin par gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gang gi dngos grub mthar 'gro ba //
analyzed: gang gi dngos grub mthar 'gro ba //
translated: The one who goes to the perfection of the power🔽of the performance.

original: zhes pa ste spyod pa gang byas pas dngos grub mthar 'gro ba ni rtogs pa ste dngos grub kyi mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste spyod pa gang byas pas dngos grub mthar 'gro ba ni rtogs pa ste dngos grub kyi mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin rtogs pa'o //
translated: By performing which performance one goes to the perfection of the power, which is the realization of the nature of the ultimate perfection.

original: cis khyad par du 'phags shes na /
analyzed: cis khyad par du 'phags shes na /
translated: How is it distinguished?

original: de nas gzhan yang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang zhes pa ste /
translated: Then, moreover,

original: de nas gzhan yang ni de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba bstan pa 'di las 'di rgyur gyur pas /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang ni de kho na nyid kyi rim par phye ba bstan pa 'di las 'di rgyur gyur pas /
translated: then, moreover, from this teaching of the division of the stages of reality, this becomes the cause.

original: mthur thug gi dngos grub kyi 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthur thug gi dngos grub kyi 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: because the result of the power of the ultimate is produced.

original: mchog khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is supreme, that is, it is especially exalted.

original: gang du zhe na /🔽kye'i rdo rje zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang du zhe na / kye'i rdo rje zhes pa ste /
translated: Where?

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyu 'dir ro //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyu 'dir ro //
translated: In Hevajra, that is, in the cause of Hevajra.

original: rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: By what cause?

original: dngos grub rgyus te phyag rgya chen po'i @56b dngos grub kyi rgyus so //
analyzed: dngos grub rgyus te phyag rgya chen po'i @56b dngos grub kyi rgyus so //
translated: By the cause of power, that is, by the cause of the power of the great seal.

original: yang na spyod pa bshad par bya //
analyzed: yang na spyod pa bshad par bya //
translated: Or else, the conduct will be explained.

original: zhes pa ni bstan pa'i don nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bstan pa'i don nyid do //
translated: This is the very meaning of the teaching.

original: dngos grub mthar 'gro ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dngos grub mthar 'gro ba zhes pa ni /
translated: The ultimate of power is

original: dngos grub ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the power of the vajra-holder.

original: de'i mthar ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i mthar ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Its ultimate is the nature.

original: ces khyad par du 'phags she na /
analyzed: ces khyad par du 'phags she na /
translated: How is it especially exalted?

original: mchog ste gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mchog ste gtso bo'o //
translated: It is supreme, that is, it is the chief.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: mtha' bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: mtha' bdag med ma ste /
translated: From the ultimate, Nairatmya.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the vajra-holder and Nairatmya are not different.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ste /
translated: How?

original: gnyis su med par rtogs pa las so //
analyzed: gnyis su med par rtogs pa las so //
translated: In Hevajra, that is, from the realization of nonduality.

original: de nyid ci'i don du rtogs pa yin par gsungs pa dngos grub rgyus te /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i don du rtogs pa yin par gsungs pa dngos grub rgyus te /
translated: The meaning of that is the cause of power.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi phyir yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi phyir yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is for the sake of the power of the Great Seal, not for anything else.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyan 'chang ba'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽sgom pa po yis rnam 'dzin pa //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyan 'chang ba'i phyir gsungs pa / sgom pa po yis rnam 'dzin pa //
translated: The characteristic of a yogin of reality is taught, because he wears the ornaments of the nature of the characteristics of the mundane and supramundane.🔽The ornament of the yogin

original: rna ba dag la rnam cha bzang //
analyzed: rna ba dag la rnam cha bzang //
translated: is the beautiful earring.

original: zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa smos te /
translated: This is said.

original: rnal 'byor pas rgyan bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas rgyan bya ba'o //
translated: The yogin should make the ornament.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rna cha bzang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rna cha bzang zhes pa ste /
translated: The beautiful earring.

original: lha'i bdag nyid kyi lha'i rna rgyan la sogs pa'i lha'i rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i bdag nyid kyi lha'i rna rgyan la sogs pa'i lha'i rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the purification of the divine form of the divine earring, etc. of the nature of the deity.

original: 'dis ni rna rgyan phyag rgya rnam par dag pas lha gang yin pa'i lha de nyid kyi mtshan ma nyid du de la dmigs nas rab tu gnas pa la sogs pa byas nas rna ba dag la yongs su gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rna rgyan phyag rgya rnam par dag pas lha gang yin pa'i lha de nyid kyi mtshan ma nyid du de la dmigs nas rab tu gnas pa la sogs pa byas nas rna ba dag la yongs su gdags par bya'o //
translated: By this, having made the ear ornament, the seal of purification, the sign of that very deity, having focused on it, having performed the consecration, etc., it should be placed on the ears.

original: mdzes pa'i sgra ni kun la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i sgra ni kun la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should cause the sound of beauty to enter everywhere.

original: 'khor lo la gdub la sogs pa rnams la 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo la gdub la sogs pa rnams la 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Here, with respect to the bracelets, etc., one should do as before.

original: yang rkang gdub rdo rje thod pa'i phyag rgya bya'o //
analyzed: yang rkang gdub rdo rje thod pa'i phyag rgya bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should make the anklet, the vajra skull seal.

original: dpung rgyan slar rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dpung rgyan slar rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The armlet is the seal of Vajradhara himself.

original: spyi bor 'khor lo rnam par 'dzin //🔽lag pa dag la lag gdub gnyis //
analyzed: spyi bor 'khor lo rnam par 'dzin // lag pa dag la lag gdub gnyis //
translated: On the head, the wheel-holder.🔽On the hands, the two bracelets.

original: lag skor gnyis so //
analyzed: lag skor gnyis so //
translated: The two armlets.

original: rked pa la yang ska rags nyid //
analyzed: rked pa la yang ska rags nyid //
translated: On the waist, the belt.

original: rkang par de bzhin rkang gdub po //🔽lag pa'i rtsa bar dpung rgyan nyid //
analyzed: rkang par de bzhin rkang gdub po // lag pa'i rtsa bar dpung rgyan nyid //
translated: On the feet, the anklets.🔽On the base of the hands, the armlet.

original: mgrin par rus pa'i phreng ba ste //
analyzed: mgrin par rus pa'i phreng ba ste //
translated: On the throat, the garland of bones.

original: zhes pa la mgrin par ni ram shu'i mgul rgyan bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la mgrin par ni ram shu'i mgul rgyan bya'o //
translated: Here, on the throat, one should make the garland of Ramshusha.

original: 'dis ci bstan na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan na /
translated: What does this teach?

original: rna cha la sogs pa gang ci bstan pa de /
analyzed: rna cha la sogs pa gang ci bstan pa de /
translated: Whatever is taught, such as earrings,

original: thams cad rus pa kho nas bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad rus pa kho nas bya ste /
translated: all of that should be made of bone,

original: rus pa yang chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rus pa yang chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because bone is the nature of the utterly pure realm of phenomena.

original: bdag med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of selflessness.

original: rgyan rnams thams cad nyid @57a * //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad nyid @57a * //
translated: All ornaments

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas bcang bar bya'o //
