translated: are the nature of method and wisdom. Therefore, the practitioner of reality should wear them.

original: yang na sgom pa po yis ni /
analyzed: yang na sgom pa po yis ni /
translated: Or, the meditator

original: de kho na nyid dang ldan pas mdzes pa'i rna rgyan te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang ldan pas mdzes pa'i rna rgyan te /
translated: has beautiful earrings that are endowed with reality.

original: rna cha 'od dpag med kyi bdag / ces pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: rna cha 'od dpag med kyi bdag / ces pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words “earrings are my Amitābha.”

original: de yang rna rgyan mdzes pa ste ;
analyzed: de yang rna rgyan mdzes pa ste ;
translated: Moreover, they are beautiful earrings,

original: / de yang 'od dpag med lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: / de yang 'od dpag med lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: and Amitābha is the nature of all deities.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rna ba dag la a'a li k'a li gnyis kyi n'a da gnyis rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba dag la a'a li k'a li gnyis kyi n'a da gnyis rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two nāḍīs of the āli and kāli are complete in the ears.

original: de nyid rnam par sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis de 'chang ba ste dbyer med pa byas nas /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par sna tshogs pa'i tshul gyis de 'chang ba ste dbyer med pa byas nas /
translated: He holds that, having made it indivisible by means of the various modes,

original: rnam par 'chang ba gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus so //
analyzed: rnam par 'chang ba gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus so //
translated: he holds it in his mind, by means of the nature of the speech vajra, the enjoyment body.

original: spyi bor 'khor lo rnam par 'dzin //
analyzed: spyi bor 'khor lo rnam par 'dzin //
translated: He holds the wheel on his head.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor ba'i bdag po yis na 'khor lo mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor ba'i bdag po yis na 'khor lo mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The lord of the mandala is Akṣobhya.

original: de yang spyi bor ni /🔽gang zhig bde ba chen po'i gnas //
analyzed: de yang spyi bor ni / gang zhig bde ba chen po'i gnas //
translated: And that is on his head.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The words “the place of great bliss” indicate that.

original: rnam par 'dzin ces pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'dzin ces pa ni /
translated: He holds it.

original: de nyid 'khor lo mi bskyod pa gzugs sna tshogs pa btags nas 'chang zhing dbyer med par 'dzin par de bya ba'i tshul des bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'khor lo mi bskyod pa gzugs sna tshogs pa btags nas 'chang zhing dbyer med par 'dzin par de bya ba'i tshul des bcang bar bya'o //
translated: Having designated that Akṣobhya as various forms, he holds it, making it indivisible. He should hold it in that way.

original: aa bdag med ma yin la bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa nyid mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma yin la bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa nyid mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku'o //
translated: A is Nairātmya, and he holds it in the manner of being indivisible from Nairātmya, Akṣobhya, the nature of mind vajra, the truth body.

original: lag pa dag la lag gdub gnyis //
analyzed: lag pa dag la lag gdub gnyis //
translated: He has two bracelets on his arms.🔽This is

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the following:🔽

original: lnga po gnyis kyi bdag nyid de yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin gnyis dag go //
analyzed: lnga po gnyis kyi bdag nyid de yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin gnyis dag go //
translated: The nature of the five pairs is the nature of the objects and the sense faculties.

original: lag gdub kyi sgra ni /🔽rnam par snang mdzad kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: lag gdub kyi sgra ni / rnam par snang mdzad kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku ste /
translated: The sound of the anklet🔽is Vairocana, the nature of the emanation body, the vajra body, the characteristic of universal illumination.

original: lag gdub rnam par snang mdzad yin //
analyzed: lag gdub rnam par snang mdzad yin //
translated: The anklet is Vairocana.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de ltar thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du brjod pas yang dag par rig pa kun du snang ba rab tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid sku gsum de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du brjod pas yang dag par rig pa kun du snang ba rab tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid sku gsum de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor pas bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogin of the reality of the three bodies, the nature of the universal illumination of the correct understanding, should be expressed as the nature of method and wisdom.

original: rgyan ni rgyan te de ltar yang dag par brgyan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyan ni rgyan te de ltar yang dag par brgyan pa yin no //
translated: The ornament is the ornament, and thus it is the correct ornament.

original: 'di rnams nyid thabs dang dbyer mi phyed par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid thabs dang dbyer mi phyed par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach that these are inseparable from the method, it is said:

original: rked pa la yang ska rags nyid //🔽ces pa ste /
analyzed: rked pa la yang ska rags nyid // ces pa ste /
translated: The belt is also around the waist.

original: ka ni bde ba chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽der 'gro zhing shin tu 'da' bar byed pas rked pa ste /
analyzed: ka ni bde ba chags pa'i mtshan nyid do // der 'gro zhing shin tu 'da' bar byed pas rked pa ste /
translated: The ka is the characteristic of the attachment of bliss.

original: bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: bdag med ma'o //
translated: The one who goes there and passes beyond is the waist, Nairātmya.

original: de yang rten dang brten pa de yis khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir /
analyzed: de yang rten dang brten pa de yis khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir /
translated: Moreover, since the nature of the supported and the support is that of the supported and the support,

original: ska rags don yod grub pa ste sku rdo @57b rje'o //
analyzed: ska rags don yod grub pa ste sku rdo @57b rje'o //
translated: the belt is Amoghasiddhi, that is, Vajrakāya.

original: 'od dpag la ni don yod bzhugs //
analyzed: 'od dpag la ni don yod bzhugs //
translated: The light rays are established as Amogha.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer mi phyed pa'i sku rdo rje yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer mi phyed pa'i sku rdo rje yin no //
translated: The body of indivisible relative and ultimate [truths] is Vajrakāya.

original: rkang par de bzhin rkang gdub po //
analyzed: rkang par de bzhin rkang gdub po //
translated: The anklets are likewise on the feet.

original: zhes pa ni gnyi ga'i ye shes nyid dbyer med pa rkang gdub ste a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnyi ga'i ye shes nyid dbyer med pa rkang gdub ste a'a li k'a li'i n'a da phreng gnyis so //
translated: The gnosis of both is indivisible, the anklets, the two garlands of the nādas of ālikāli.

original: de bzhin zhes pa ni gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid gsung rdo rje yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa ni gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid gsung rdo rje yin no //
translated: “Likewise” means that the indivisibility of both is Vajra Speech.

original: lag pa'i rtsa bar dpung rgyan nyid //
analyzed: lag pa'i rtsa bar dpung rgyan nyid //
translated: The bracelets are on the wrists.

original: ces pa ni byang chub sems so //
analyzed: ces pa ni byang chub sems so //
translated: This is bodhicitta.

original: aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: A is Nairātmya.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid byang chub kyi sems yin pas pa'o //🔽ha ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid byang chub kyi sems yin pas pa'o // ha ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is bodhicitta, which is pa.🔽Ha is Vajradhara.

original: de yang au rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang au rdo rje mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa'o //
translated: That is also adorned with o Vajraḍāka.

original: de ltar h'um rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid byang chub kyi sems yin te gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i gnyi ga'i bdag nyid gang de ni phung po sgra'o /
analyzed: de ltar h'um rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid byang chub kyi sems yin te gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i gnyi ga'i bdag nyid gang de ni phung po sgra'o /
translated: Thus, the nature of the syllable hum, which is the nature of Vajradhara, is the Thought of Enlightenment, and that which is the nature of both, the inseparability of both, is the aggregate of sound.

original: de nyid rtsa ba yin te dang po gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rtsa ba yin te dang po gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the root, because it is the principal one at the beginning.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is the intuition which is the nature of the five elements.

original: au spos mo sa'o //🔽sbos mo sa yi khams su bshad //
analyzed: au spos mo sa'o // sbos mo sa yi khams su bshad //
translated: The syllable u is earth.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The word “earth” is explained as the element of earth.

original: ka chu'i khams so //
analyzed: ka chu'i khams so //
translated: The syllable ka is the element of water.

original: ya rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: ya rlung gi khams so //
translated: The syllable ya is the element of wind.

original: ra me'i khams so //
analyzed: ra me'i khams so //
translated: The syllable ra is the element of fire.

original: ae chos 'byung nam mkha'i khams yin te /
analyzed: ae chos 'byung nam mkha'i khams yin te /
translated: The syllable e is the element of space, the source of phenomena.

original: dpung rgyan 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpung rgyan 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes byed pa'o //
translated: The armlet is the intuition which is the nature of the five great elements.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid thugs rdo rje yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid thugs rdo rje yin no //
translated: The indivisibility of both is the vajra mind.

original: mgrin par rus pa'i phreng ba nyid //
analyzed: mgrin par rus pa'i phreng ba nyid //
translated: The garland of bones is at the throat.

original: ces pa ni mgrin pa'i sgras mgrin pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni mgrin pa'i sgras mgrin pa ste /
translated: The word “throat” means the throat.

original: de yang longs spyod kyi 'khor lo de 'dra ma bcu drug pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: de yang longs spyod kyi 'khor lo de 'dra ma bcu drug pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since the enjoyment wheel has sixteen aspects, it is the sixteen emptinesses.

original: de la rten dang brten pa'i dngos pos khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa des rus pa ni ram shu chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mkha' 'gro ma rnams te de nyid rgyan no //
analyzed: de la rten dang brten pa'i dngos pos khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa des rus pa ni ram shu chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mkha' 'gro ma rnams te de nyid rgyan no //
translated: There, the pervaded and the pervader are the supported and the support. Since the bones are the dharmadhātu by nature, they are the ḍākinīs, and they are the ornaments.
